This sovereignty extends to the air space over the territorial sea as well as to its bed and subsoil.
The sovereignty over the territorial sea is exercised subject to the United Nations Convention of Law on the Sea (UNCLOS) and to other rules of international law.

FeatureType.name: GeographicalName
FeatureType.definition: Proper noun applied to a real world entity.

FeatureAttribute.name: language
FeatureAttribute.definition: Language of the name, given as a three letters code, in accordance with either ISO 639-3 or ISO 639-5.
NOTE 1More precisely, this definition refers to the language used by the community that uses the name.

NOTE 2 The code "mul" for "multilingual" should not be used in general. However it can be used in rare cases like official names composed of two names in different languages. For example, "Vitoria-Gasteiz" is such a multilingual official name in Spain.
NOTE 3 Even if this attribute is "voidable" for pragmatic reasons, it is of first importance in several use cases in the multi-language context of Europe.

FeatureAttribute.name: nativeness
FeatureAttribute.definition: Information enabling to acknowledge if the name is the one that is/was used in the area where the spatial object is situated at the instant when the name is/was in use.

FeatureAttribute.name: nameStatus
FeatureAttribute.definition: Qualitative information enabling to discern which credit should be given to the name with respect to its standardisation and/or its topicality.

NOTE The Geographical Names application schema does not explicitly make a preference between different names (e.g. official endonyms) of a specific real world entity. The necessary information for making the preference (e.g. the linguistic status of the administrative or geographic area in question), for a certain use case, must be obtained from other data or information sources. For example, the status of the language of the name may be known through queries on the geometries of named places against the geometry of administrative units recorded in a certain source with the language statuses information.

FeatureAttribute.name: sourceOfName
FeatureAttribute.definition: Original data source from which the geographical name is taken from and integrated in the data set providing/publishing it. For some named spatial objects it might refer again to the publishing data set if no other information is available.
EXAMPLES Gazetteer, geographical names data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: pronunciation
FeatureAttribute.definition: Proper, correct or standard (standard within the linguistic community concerned) pronunciation of the geographical name.

FeatureAttribute.name: spelling
FeatureAttribute.definition: A proper way of writing the geographical name.
NOTE 1 Different spellings should only be used for names rendered in different scripts. .

NOTE 2 While a particular GeographicalName should only have one spelling in a given script, providing different spellings in the same script should be done through the provision of different geographical names associated with the same named place.

FeatureAttribute.name: grammaticalGender
FeatureAttribute.definition: Class of nouns reflected in the behaviour of associated words.
NOTE the attribute has cardinality [0..1] and is voidable, which means that:
- in case the concept of grammatical gender has no sense for a given name (i.e. the attribute is not applicable), the attribute should not be provided.
- in case the concept of grammatical gender has some sense for the name but is unknown, the attribute should be provided but void.

FeatureAttribute.name: grammaticalNumber
FeatureAttribute.definition: Grammatical category of nouns that expresses count distinctions.
NOTE the attribute has cardinality [0..1] and is voidable, which means that:
- in case the concept of grammatical number has no sense for a given name (i.e. the attribute is not applicable), the attribute should not be provided.
- in case the concept of grammatical number has some sense for the name but is unknown, the attribute should be provided but void.

FeatureType.name: GrammaticalGenderValue
FeatureType.definition: The grammatical gender of a geographical name.

FeatureType.name: GrammaticalNumberValue
FeatureType.definition: The grammatical number of a geographical name.

FeatureAttribute.name: singular
FeatureAttribute.definition: EXAMPLES Danube (English), Lac du Bourget (French), Praha (Czech), Nederland (Dutch).

FeatureType.name: NameStatusValue
FeatureType.definition: The status of a geographical name, that is the information enabling to discern which credit should be given to the name with respect to its standardisation and/or its topicality.
NOTE The precise definition of the values 'Official', 'Standardised', 'Historical' and 'Other' can only be decided by Member States according to their legislation and practice.

FeatureAttribute.name: official
FeatureAttribute.definition: Name in current use and officially approved or established by legislation.

FeatureAttribute.name: standardised
FeatureAttribute.definition: Name in current use and accepted or recommended by a body assigned advisory function and/or power of decision in matters of toponymy.

FeatureAttribute.name: historical
FeatureAttribute.definition: Historical name not in current use.

FeatureAttribute.name: other
FeatureAttribute.definition: Current, but not official, nor approved name.

FeatureType.name: NamedPlace
FeatureType.definition: Any real world entity referred to by one or several proper nouns.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Geometry associated to the named place. This data specification does not restrict the geometry types.

NOTE 1 The most common geometry types for a named place are a reference point (modelled as GM_Point), a more precise geometry of the footprint (typically modelled as GM_Curve or GM_Surface), or a bounding box (to be modelled as a GM_Surface).

NOTE 2 If the geometry depicts the spatial footprint of the named place, a reference point and a bounding box could be derived from it. However, this specification does not require the explicit provision of any specific type of geometry such as bounding boxes or reference points.
NOTE 3 To avoid any misunderstanding, note that null geometry is not allowed by this specification.
NOTE 4 3D geometries are not really required for Geographical Names, but the model allows for it, so a data provider may publish it.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.

NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: leastDetailedViewingResolution
FeatureAttribute.definition: Resolution, expressed as the inverse of an indicative scale or a ground distance, above which the named place and its associated name(s) should no longer be displayed in a basic viewing service.

NOTE 1This information may be used to determine if the names of the named place should be displayed at a given scale of display, only in the context of basic viewing services intending to show the content of the data set containing names. Even if this information is a valuable one for mapping in general, it is only approximate; cartographic services intending to produce high quality maps should certainly rely on other criteria and techniques for selecting names for the map.

NOTE 2 Even if this attribute is "voidable" for practical reasons linked to its availability in data sources, this information may be of first importance for viewing services. There are great chances that viewing services will inefficiently manage named places having this attribute void.
EXAMPLES The following examples use the equivalentScale attribute of MD_Resolution to express the attribute value.
- Names of important cities in Europe may be displayed at all viewing scales greater than 1/5,000,000. In this case, the value of the attribute is 5,000,000
- Names of small hamlets may only be displayed from all viewing scale greater than 1/25,000. In this case, the value of the attribute is 25,000
- Names of countries may be displayed at any small scale. In this case, this attribute is not filled.

NOTE 3 If the data set contain multiple representations of the same real world entity represented at different levels of detail, the scale ranges defined by the attributes leastDetailedViewingResolution and mostDetailedViewingResolution should not overlap, in order to avoid displaying the same names several times.
NOTE 4 The geometry of the named place should have a level of detail (i.e. resolution, granularity, precision, etc.) roughly compatible with its associated viewing scales.

FeatureAttribute.name: localType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Characterisation of the kind of entity designated by geographical name(s), as defined by the data provider, given in at least in one official language of the European Union.
NOTE Local types may be defined in additional European languages, either EU official languages or other languages such as the language(s) of the geographical names provided.

FeatureAttribute.name: mostDetailedViewingResolution
FeatureAttribute.definition: Resolution, expressed as the inverse of an indicative scale or a ground distance, below which the named place and its associated name(s) should no longer be displayed in a basic viewing service.
EXAMPLES The following examples use the equivalentScale attribute of MD_Resolution to express the attribute value.
- Names of wide areas like mountain ranges may not be displayed at all in viewing scales greater than 1/100,000. In this case, the value of the attribute is 100,000
- Names of small hamlets may be displayed at any large scale. In this case, this attribute is not filled.

FeatureAttribute.name: relatedSpatialObject
FeatureAttribute.definition: Identifier of a spatial object representing the same entity but appearing in other themes of INSPIRE, if any.
NOTE If no identifier is provided with features of other INSPIRE themes, those features can of course not be referred by the NamedPlace.

FeatureAttribute.name: type
FeatureAttribute.definition: Characterisation of the kind of entity designated by geographical name(s).

NOTE 1 This attribute should be consistent with the attribute 'relatedSpatialObject'. More precisely, if the attribute 'relatedSpatialObject' is filled in, the attribute 'type' should be filled in, and its value(s) should be consistent with the spatial data theme(s) of the related object(s).

NOTE 2 Even if this attribute may introduce some redundancy with the attribute 'relatedSpatialObject', it has to be filled in order to allow to use geographical names on their own without accessing to any other INSPIRE data set, which may be necessary in most cases.

FeatureType.name: NamedPlaceTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: The type of a named place.

FeatureAttribute.name: administrativeUnit
FeatureAttribute.definition: Units of administration, dividing areas where Member States have and/or exercise jurisdictional rights, for local, regional and national governance, separated by administrative boundaries.
SOURCE Definition of Annex I theme, INSPIRE Directive [Regulation 1205/2008/EC].
- Administrative unit within a country such as state, province, region, municipality.

FeatureAttribute.name: building
FeatureAttribute.definition: SOURCE Definition of Annex III theme [INSPIRE Directive].
NOTE This definition of building should be refined from future works on the specification of the INSPIRE annex III theme BUILDINGS.
- Public buildings such as theatre, museum, library;
- Religious buildings such as church, mosque, synagogue;

FeatureAttribute.name: hydrography
FeatureAttribute.definition: Hydrographic elements, including marine areas and all other water bodies and items related to them, including river basins and sub-basins.
SOURCE Definition of Annex I theme HYDROGRAPHY, INSPIRE Directive [Regulation 1205/2008/EC].
NOTE For the usage with Geographical names this includes named places in seas and oceans.
- Marine areas and parts of them such as sea, gulf, sea strait, sea channel, fjord, sea bay;
- Inland water areas such as lake, reservoir, pond, lake strait, lake bay;
- Watercourses such as river, stream, rapids, waterfall, canal;
- Other hydrographic features such as glacier, snowfield, geyser, spring, fountain, well.

FeatureAttribute.name: landcover
FeatureAttribute.definition: Physical and biological cover of the earth's surface including artificial surfaces, agricultural areas, forests, (semi-)natural areas, wetlands, water bodies.
SOURCE Definition of Annex III theme, INSPIRE Directive.
- Low vegetation areas such as thicket;
- Wetlands such as marsh, swamp, bog;
- Agricultural areas such as arable land, cultivated field, pasture;
- Other terrain cover features such as desert, badland, lava field, remarkable tree.

FeatureAttribute.name: landform
FeatureAttribute.definition: - Land elevations such as mountain range, mountain, mountainside, fell, highland, hill, ridge, peak;
- Land depressions such as plain, valley, pass, gorge;
- Coastal land formations such as peninsula, headland, cape, delta, beach, cliff;
- Other landforms such as cave, devil's churn, stone.

FeatureAttribute.name: protectedSite
FeatureAttribute.definition: Area designated or managed within a framework of international, Community and Member States' legislation to achieve specific conservation objectives.
SOURCE Definition of Annex I theme, INSPIRE Directive [Regulation 1205/2008/EC].

FeatureAttribute.name: transportNetwork
FeatureAttribute.definition: Road, rail, air and water transport networks and related infrastructure. Includes links between different networks.
SOURCE Definition of Annex I theme, INSPIRE Directive [Regulation 1205/2008/EC].
- Air transport structures and facilities such as airport, heliport;
- Water transport structures and facilities such as harbour, dock, pier, ferry line;
- Rail transport structures and facilities such as railway station, railway bridge, railway tunnel;
- Road transport structures and facilities such as bus station, highway, road, street, road bridge, road tunnel.

FeatureAttribute.name: other
FeatureAttribute.definition: A spatial object not included in the other types of the code list.

FeatureType.name: NativenessValue
FeatureType.definition: The nativeness of a geographical name.

FeatureAttribute.name: endonym
FeatureAttribute.definition: Name for a geographical feature in an official or well-established language occurring in that area where the feature is situated.

FeatureAttribute.name: exonym
FeatureAttribute.definition: Name used in a specific language for a geographical feature situated outside the area where that language is widely spoken, and differing in form from the respective endonym(s) in the area where the geographical feature is situated.

FeatureType.name: PronunciationOfName
FeatureType.definition: Proper, correct or standard (standard within the linguistic community concerned) pronunciation of a name.

constraint.name: pronunciationSoundLink or pronunciationIPA not empty
constraint.expression: /* At least one of the two attributes pronunciationSoundLink and pronunciationIPA shall not be void. */ inv: self.pronounciationIPA -> notEmpty() or self.pronounciationSoundLink -> notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: pronunciationSoundLink
FeatureAttribute.definition: Proper, correct or standard (standard within the linguistic community concerned) pronunciation of a name, expressed by a link to any sound file.

FeatureAttribute.name: pronunciationIPA
FeatureAttribute.definition: Proper, correct or standard (standard within the linguistic community concerned) pronunciation of a name, expressed in International Phonetic Alphabet (IPA).

FeatureType.name: SpellingOfName
FeatureType.definition: Proper way of writing a name.
NOTE Proper spelling means the writing of a name with the correct capitalisation and the correct letters and diacritics present in an accepted standard order.

FeatureAttribute.name: script
FeatureAttribute.definition: Set of graphic symbols (for example an alphabet) employed in writing the name, expressed using the four letters codes defined in ISO 15924, where applicable.
NOTE 1The four letter codes for Latin (Roman), Cyrillic and Greek script are "Latn", "Cyrl" and "Grek", respectively.
NOTE 2 In rare cases other codes could be used (for other scripts than Latin, Greek and Cyrillic). However, this should mainly apply for historical names in historical scripts.
NOTE 3 This attribute is of first importance in the multi-scriptual context of Europe.

FeatureAttribute.name: transliterationScheme
FeatureAttribute.definition: Method used for the names conversion between different scripts.
NOTE 1 This attribute should be filled for any transliterated spellings. If the transliteration scheme used is recorded in codelists maintained by ISO or UN, those codes should be preferred.

ApplicationSchema.name: Hydro - base
ApplicationSchema.definition: This package provides base classes used to identify real-world objects. These identities may be used to provide implicit semantic associations between different 'implementation views'.

EXAMPLE: A real-world object identified as the 'Rhine' may be realised through a Network view (as a set of links and nodes), a Physical Waters view (as a Watercourse), and a reporting view (as a WFDRiver).

FeatureType.name: HydroIdentifier
FeatureType.definition: NOTE May be used to hold a national hydrological identification code.

FeatureAttribute.name: classificationScheme
FeatureAttribute.definition: A description of the identification scheme (National, European, etc.) being used.

FeatureAttribute.name: localId
FeatureAttribute.definition: A local identifier, assigned by some authority.
NOTE It will often be a national hydrographic identifier.

FeatureAttribute.name: namespace
FeatureAttribute.definition: An indicator of the scope for the local identifier.
NOTE In the case of a national hydrographic identifier it should be a two-letter country code as per ISO 3166-1-Alpha-2.

FeatureType.name: HydroObject
FeatureType.definition: An identity base for hydrographic (including man-made) objects in the real world.

NOTE Derived 'views' of real-world hydrographic objects are represented through specialisations in other application schemas; all representations of the same real-world object share a common geographic name or hydrographic identifier.

FeatureAttribute.name: geographicalName
FeatureAttribute.definition: A geographical name that is used to identify a hydrographic object in the real world. It provides a 'key' for implicitly associating different representations of the object.
EXAMPLE A standing water in a mapping view may share the same geographical name as a WFD lake in a reporting view, implying they are both representations of the same real world object.

FeatureAttribute.name: hydroId
FeatureAttribute.definition: An identifier that is used to identify a hydrographic object in the real world. It provides a 'key' for implicitly associating different representations of the object.
NOTE 1 The identifier may be a national hydrological identification code.
NOTE 2 More than one identifier may be required, for instance a watercourse may be assigned different identifying codes under national and European schemes.
EXAMPLE A lock in a mapping view may share the same identifier as a hydro node in a network view, implying they are both representations of the same real world object.

RelationshipRole.name: relatedHydroObject
RelationshipRole.definition: A related hydrographic object representing the same real-world entity.

ApplicationSchema.name: Hydro - Network
ApplicationSchema.definition: The Network application schema contains spatial objects associated with a connected hydrographic network representation of waterways, lakes etc. This is required primarily for the 'spatial analysis and modelling' Use Case.

FeatureType.name: HydroNode
FeatureType.definition: A node within the hydrographic network.
NOTE May represent a physical confluence, bifurcation/confluence/vanishing point etc, or it may be associated with a hydrographic point of interest or facility.

FeatureType.name: HydroNodeCategoryValue
FeatureType.definition: Defines categories for different types of hydrographic network nodes.

FeatureAttribute.name: boundary
FeatureAttribute.definition: Node used to connect different networks.

NOTE Can be used to connect cross border networks or adjacent networks together. Differs from source / outlet in that in the real world there is an adjacent link that is not present in the dataset supplied.

FeatureAttribute.name: flowConstriction
FeatureAttribute.definition: A network node unrelated to the network topology per se, but associated with a hydrographic point of interest or facility, or a man-made object, that affects the network flow.
NOTE May include dams, widenings and other obstructions in the watercourse.

FeatureAttribute.name: flowRegulation
FeatureAttribute.definition: A network node unrelated to the network topology per se, but associated with a hydrographic point of interest or facility, or a man-made object, that regulates the network flow.
NOTE May include weirs, pumping stations and hydro power plants as well as abstraction and discharge into / from the watercourse.

FeatureAttribute.name: junction
FeatureAttribute.definition: Node where three or more links are coincident.
NOTE Includes all nodes at which different watercourses or watercourse branches merge into one (confluence) and where watercourses fork and divide (bifurcations).

FeatureAttribute.name: outlet
FeatureAttribute.definition: Ending node of a series of interconnected links.
NOTE Does not have an downstream output link. Includes sinks and watercourse mouths.

FeatureAttribute.name: source
FeatureAttribute.definition: Starting node of a series of interconnected links.
NOTE Does not have an upstream input link. Includes springs and seeps.

FeatureType.name: WatercourseLink
FeatureType.definition: A segment of a watercourse within a hydrographic network.
NOTE A watercourse link may be fictitious, with no direct correspondence to a real-world object and included only to ensure a closed network.
- virtual network segment in coastal water area
- virtual network segment in lake area
- virtual network segment in river to connect tributary
- virtual network segment in transitional water area

FeatureAttribute.name: flowDirection
FeatureAttribute.definition: Direction of water flow in the segment relative to digitisation of segment geometry.

FeatureType.name: WatercourseLinkSequence
FeatureType.definition: A sequence of watercourse links representing a non-branching path through a hydrographic network.

FeatureType.name: WatercourseSeparatedCrossing
FeatureType.definition: An element in the hydrographic network used to indicate non-interacting crossing of watercourse links separated by level.
NOTE The crossing may legitimately break a no-intersection quality rule.

ApplicationSchema.name: Hydro - Physical Waters
ApplicationSchema.definition: The 'PhysicalWaters' application schema is concerned primarily with the 'mapping' Use Case

FeatureType.name: Crossing
FeatureType.definition: A man-made object allowing the passage of water above or below an obstacle.

FeatureAttribute.name: aqueduct
FeatureAttribute.definition: A pipe or artificial channel that is designed to transport water from a remote source, usually by gravity, for freshwater supply, agricultural, and/or industrial use.

FeatureAttribute.name: bridge
FeatureAttribute.definition: A structure that connects two locations and provides for the passage of a transportation route over a terrain obstacle.
EXAMPLE 1 (Transportation route) A road or a railway.
EXAMPLE 2 (Terrain obstacle) A waterbody, a gully, and/or a road.

FeatureAttribute.name: culvert
FeatureAttribute.definition: An enclosed channel for carrying a watercourse under a route.
EXAMPLE 1 (Watercourse carried in an enclosed channel) A stream, a sewer, or a drain.
EXAMPLE 2 (Route over a culvert) A road, a railway, or an embankment.

FeatureAttribute.name: siphon
FeatureAttribute.definition: A pipe used for conveying liquid from one level to a lower level, using the liquid pressure differential to force a column of the liquid up to a higher level before it falls to the outlet.

FeatureType.name: DamOrWeir
FeatureType.definition: A permanent barrier across a watercourse used to impound water or to control its flow.

FeatureType.name: DrainageBasin
FeatureType.definition: Area having a common outlet for its surface runoff.

NOTE 1 Regarding the different classifications of drainage basins, no distinction is made between drainage basins / sub-basins since this will vary with application. It is possible to build basins from other basins.
NOTE 2 The outlet of a drainage basin may be a canal or a lake.
NOTE 3 Synonyms for drainage basin include: catchment; catchment area; drainage area; river basin; watershed.

constraint.name: largestBasinIsRiverBasin
constraint.expression: /* A river basin may not be contained in any other basin */ inv: self.containsBasin->forall(c | not c.oclIsTypeOf(RiverBasin))

FeatureAttribute.name: area
FeatureAttribute.definition: Size of the drainage basin area.

FeatureAttribute.name: basinOrder
FeatureAttribute.definition: Number (or code) expressing the degree of branching/dividing in a drainage basin system.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: The geometry of the drainage basin, as a surface.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.

NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: origin
FeatureAttribute.definition: NOTE A polder is a drainage basin of man-made origin.

RelationshipRole.name: outlet
RelationshipRole.definition: The surface water outlet(s) of a drainage basin.

RelationshipRole.name: drainsBasin
RelationshipRole.definition: The basin(s) drained by a surface water.

RelationshipRole.name: containsBasin
RelationshipRole.definition: A smaller sub-basin contained within a larger basin.

FeatureType.name: Embankment
FeatureType.definition: A man-made raised long mound of earth or other material.
NOTE 1 Includes retaining walls, harbours, dikes.
NOTE 2 Regarded as a candidate spatial object in Annex III theme 'Natural risk zones' due to its role in limiting flooding.

FeatureType.name: Falls
FeatureType.definition: A vertically descending part of a watercourse where it falls from a height.
EXAMPLE Waterfalls over a rock or a precipice.

FeatureAttribute.name: height
FeatureAttribute.definition: Distance measured from the lowest point of the base at ground or water level (downhill side/downstream side) to the tallest point of the spatial object.

FeatureType.name: FluvialPoint
FeatureType.definition: A hydro point of interest that affects the flow of a watercourse.

FeatureType.name: Ford
FeatureType.definition: A shallow part of a watercourse used as a road crossing.

FeatureType.name: HydroOrderCode
FeatureType.definition: A hydrologically meaningful 'order code' for ordering hierarchies of watercourses and drainage basins.

FeatureAttribute.name: order
FeatureAttribute.definition: Number (or code) expressing the degree of branching or dividing in a stream or drainage basin system.
SOURCE [Based on UNESCO/WMO International Glossary of Hydrology].

FeatureAttribute.name: orderScheme
FeatureAttribute.definition: A description of the concept for ordering.

FeatureAttribute.name: scope
FeatureAttribute.definition: An indicator of the scope or origin for an order code (including whether it is national, supranational or European).
NOTE In the case of a national hydrographic identifier it may start with a two-letter country code as per ISO 3166-1-Alpha-2.

FeatureType.name: HydroPointOfInterest
FeatureType.definition: A natural place where water appears, disappears or changes its flow.

EXAMPLE Fluvial points (waterfall, cascade, rapids, breaker), spring/water hole (spring, source, geyser, thermal spring, natural fountain, well, also fumarole, artesian), sinkhole (sinkhole, drainage loss).
NOTE A hydro point of interest may create a flow constriction in the network.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: The geometry of the hydro point of interest, as a point, curve or surface.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.

NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: levelOfDetail
FeatureAttribute.definition: Resolution, expressed as the inverse of an indicative scale or a ground distance.
NOTE The object is captured at a scale of this level of detail; rules apply for portrayal and visualisation.

FeatureType.name: HydrologicalPersistenceValue
FeatureType.definition: Categories of hydrological persistence of a body of water.

FeatureAttribute.name: dry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Filled and/or flowing infrequently, generally only during and/or immediately after heavy precipitation.
NOTE The waterbody is often vegetated (for example: with shrubs); such a streambed in the Southwestern United States is termed a 'derramadero'.

FeatureAttribute.name: ephemeral
FeatureAttribute.definition: Filled and/or flowing during and immediately after precipitation.

FeatureAttribute.name: intermittent
FeatureAttribute.definition: Filled and/or flowing for part of the year.

FeatureAttribute.name: perennial
FeatureAttribute.definition: Filled and/or flowing continuously throughout the year as its bed lies below the water table.

FeatureType.name: LandWaterBoundary
FeatureType.definition: The line where a land mass is in contact with a body of water.

NOTE The plane of reference for the land-water boundary should be a high water datum, such as 'Mean High Water Springs', 'High Water' or 'Mean Higher High Water'. Where there is little appreciable change in waterlevels / tide at the adjacent shore, then 'Mean Sea Level' or 'Local Datum' may be used.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: The geometry of the land-water boundary, as a curve.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.

NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: origin
FeatureAttribute.definition: EXAMPLE Natural, man-made, etc.; a sea defence is a land-water boundary of man-made origin.

FeatureAttribute.name: waterLevelCategory
FeatureAttribute.definition: EXAMPLE High water, low water, etc.

FeatureType.name: Lock
FeatureType.definition: An enclosure with a pair or series of gates used for raising or lowering vessels as they pass from one water level to another.

FeatureType.name: ManMadeObject
FeatureType.definition: An artificial object which lies inside a body of water and has one of the following types of function:
- Alters the course of the water;
- Allows watercourses to cross each other.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: condition
FeatureAttribute.definition: The state of planning, construction, repair, and/or maintenance of the structures and/or equipment comprising a facility and/or located at a site, as a whole.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: The geometry of the man-made object, as a point, curve or surface.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.

NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: levelOfDetail
FeatureAttribute.definition: Resolution, expressed as the inverse of an indicative scale or a ground distance.
NOTE The object is captured at a scale of this level of detail; rules apply for portrayal and visualisation.

FeatureType.name: OriginValue
FeatureType.definition: An enumeration type specifying a set of hydrographic 'origin' categories (natural, man-made) for various hydrographic objects.

FeatureAttribute.name: natural
FeatureAttribute.definition: An indication that a spatial object is natural.

FeatureAttribute.name: manMade
FeatureAttribute.definition: An indication that a spatial object is man-made.

FeatureType.name: Rapids
FeatureType.definition: Portions of a stream with accelerated current where it descends rapidly but without a break in the slope of the bed sufficient to form a waterfall.

FeatureType.name: RiverBasin
FeatureType.definition: The area of land from which all surface run-off flows through a sequence of streams, rivers and, possibly, lakes into the sea at a single river mouth, estuary or delta.

constraint.name: largestBasinIsRiverBasin
constraint.expression: /* A river basin may not be contained in any other basin */ inv: self.containsBasin->forall(c | not c.oclIsTypeOf(RiverBasin))

FeatureType.name: Shore
FeatureType.definition: The narrow strip of land in immediate contact with any body of water including the area between high and low water lines.
NOTE Regarded as a candidate spatial object in Annex II theme 'Land cover' due to unconsolidated shore inclusion in coastal land-cover classificaction schemes.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.

NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: composition
FeatureAttribute.definition: The primary type(s) of material composing a spatial object, exclusive of the surface.
NOTE The basis for 'primary' may be, for example, compositional dominance or structural organization.

FeatureAttribute.name: delineationKnown
FeatureAttribute.definition: An indication that the delineation (for example: limits and information) of a spatial object is known.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: clay
FeatureAttribute.definition: A stiff tenacious fine-grained earth consisting mainly of hydrated aluminosilicates, which become more plastic when water is added and can be moulded and dried.

FeatureAttribute.name: mud
FeatureAttribute.definition: Soft wet soil, sand, dust, and/or other earthy matter.

FeatureAttribute.name: sand
FeatureAttribute.definition: Granular material consisting of small eroded fragments of (mainly siliceous) rocks, finer than gravel and larger than a coarse silt grain.

FeatureAttribute.name: shingle
FeatureAttribute.definition: Small, loose, rounded waterworn pebbles, especially as accumulated on a seashore.

FeatureAttribute.name: stone
FeatureAttribute.definition: Pieces of rock or mineral substance (other than metal) of definite form and size, usually artificially shaped, and used for some special purpose.

FeatureType.name: ShorelineConstruction
FeatureType.definition: An artificial structure attached to land bordering a body of water and fixed in position.

NOTE 1 It is usually fixed to the waterbody bottom (for example: a mole) but may occasionally be fixed in position (for example: attached to the shore at one end and held between pilings at the other) but floating. Shoreline constructions are normally used for berthing and/or protection.
NOTE 2 Includes breakwater/groyne/wharf; but has more flexibility - also applies to inland waters.

FeatureType.name: Sluice
FeatureType.definition: An open, inclined conduit fitted with a gate for regulating water flow.

FeatureType.name: StandingWater
FeatureType.definition: A body of water that is entirely surrounded by land.

NOTE It may occur in a natural terrain depression in which water collects, or may be impounded by a dam, or formed by its bed being hollowed out of the soil, or formed by embanking and/or damming up a natural hollow (for example: by a beaver dam). It may be connected to inflowing / outflowing watercourses or other standing waters.

constraint.name: geometryIsSurfaceOrPoint
constraint.description: Standing water geometry may be a surface or point
constraint.expression: inv: self.geometry.oclIsTypeOf(GM_Surface) or self.geometry.oclIsTypeOf(GM_Point)

FeatureAttribute.name: meanDepth
FeatureAttribute.definition: Average depth of the body of water.

FeatureAttribute.name: surfaceArea
FeatureAttribute.definition: Surface area of the body of water.

FeatureType.name: SurfaceWater
FeatureType.definition: NOTE May include islands, represented as 'holes' in its geometry. Islands may be surrounded by a shore and / or land-ware boundary.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: The geometry of the surface water:
- either a curve or surface for a watercourse;
- either a point or surface for a standing water.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.

NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: levelOfDetail
FeatureAttribute.definition: Resolution, expressed as the inverse of an indicative scale or a ground distance.
NOTE The object is captured at a scale of this level of detail; rules apply for portrayal and visualisation.

FeatureAttribute.name: localType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Provides 'local' name for the type of surface water.

FeatureAttribute.name: origin
FeatureAttribute.definition: NOTE 1 Natural surface waters are natural watercourses (e.g. rivers, streams) and standing waters (e.g. pools, lakes) naturally preserved and that have been canalised and / or dammed either for navigation or for preventing flood disaster.
NOTE 2 A man-made surface water is a surface water entirely created by man for drainage, storage or transportation purpose, this includes canals, ditches and reservoirs.

FeatureAttribute.name: persistence
FeatureAttribute.definition: The degree of persistence of water.

FeatureAttribute.name: tidal
FeatureAttribute.definition: Identifies whether the surface water is affected by tidal water.

RelationshipRole.name: bank
RelationshipRole.definition: The bank(s) associated to a surface water.

RelationshipRole.name: neighbour
RelationshipRole.definition: An association to another instance of the same real-world surface water in another data set.

FeatureType.name: WaterLevelValue
FeatureType.definition: The tidal datum / waterlevel to which depths and heights are referenced.

FeatureAttribute.name: equinoctialSpringLowWater
FeatureAttribute.definition: The level of low water springs near the time of an equinox.

FeatureAttribute.name: higherHighWater
FeatureAttribute.definition: The highest of the high waters (or single high water) of any specified tidal day due to the declination A1 effects of the moon and sun.

FeatureAttribute.name: higherHighWaterLargeTide
FeatureAttribute.definition: The average of the highest high waters, one from each of 19 years of observations.

FeatureAttribute.name: highestAstronomicalTide
FeatureAttribute.definition: The highest tidal level, which can be predicted to occur under average meteorological conditions and under any combination of astronomical conditions.

FeatureAttribute.name: highestHighWater
FeatureAttribute.definition: The highest water level observed at a location.

FeatureAttribute.name: highWater
FeatureAttribute.definition: The highest level reached at a location by the water surface in one tidal cycle.
NOTE When used on inland waters it is generally defined as a level that the daily mean water level exceeds less than 5 percent of the time.

FeatureAttribute.name: highWaterSprings
FeatureAttribute.definition: An arbitrary level, approximating that of mean high water springs.

FeatureAttribute.name: indianSpringHighWater
FeatureAttribute.definition: A tidal surface datum approximating the level of the mean of the higher high water at spring tides.
NOTE This tidal datum approximates the highest water level observed at a location and is usually above that of the higher high water at spring tides.

FeatureAttribute.name: indianSpringLowWater
FeatureAttribute.definition: A tidal surface datum approximating the level of the mean of the lower low water at spring tides.
NOTE This tidal datum approximates the lowest water level observed at a location and is usually below that of the lower low water at spring tides.

FeatureAttribute.name: localDatum
FeatureAttribute.definition: An arbitrary datum defined by an authority of a local harbour, from which levels and tidal heights are measured by that authority.

FeatureAttribute.name: lowerLowWater
FeatureAttribute.definition: The lowest of the low waters (or single low water) of any specified tidal day due to the declination A1 effects of the moon and sun.

FeatureAttribute.name: lowerLowWaterLargeTide
FeatureAttribute.definition: The average of the lowest low waters, one from each of 19 years of observations.

FeatureAttribute.name: lowestAstronomicalTide
FeatureAttribute.definition: The lowest tide level that can be predicted to occur under average meteorological conditions and under any combination of astronomical conditions.

FeatureAttribute.name: lowestLowWater
FeatureAttribute.definition: An arbitrary level conforming to the lowest tide observed at a location, or somewhat lower.

FeatureAttribute.name: lowestLowWaterSprings
FeatureAttribute.definition: An arbitrary level conforming to the lowest water level observed at a location at spring tides during a period shorter than 19 years.

FeatureAttribute.name: lowWater
FeatureAttribute.definition: An approximation of mean low water adopted as the reference level for a limited region, irrespective of better determinations later.

NOTE Used mostly in harbour and river engineering. Used in inland waters. It is generally defined as a level which the daily mean water level would fall below less than 5 percent of the time and by no more than 0.2 metres during the navigation season. A single level surface is usually chosen as the low water datum for a whole lake. On a river, low water datum is a sloping surface, which approximates the surface of the river at a low state.

FeatureAttribute.name: lowWaterDatum
FeatureAttribute.definition: An approximation of mean low water that has been adopted as a standard reference for a limited area.
NOTE 1 It is retained for an indefinite period regardless of the fact that it may differ slightly from a better determination of mean low water from a subsequent series of observations.
NOTE 2 Used primarily for river and harbor engineering purposes.

FeatureAttribute.name: lowWaterSprings
FeatureAttribute.definition: A level approximating that of mean low water springs.

FeatureAttribute.name: meanHigherHighWater
FeatureAttribute.definition: The average height of higher high waters at a location over a 19-year period.

FeatureAttribute.name: meanHigherHighWaterSprings
FeatureAttribute.definition: The average height of higher high water at spring tides at a location.

FeatureAttribute.name: meanHigherLowWater
FeatureAttribute.definition: The average of the higher low water height of each tidal day observed over a National Tidal Datum Epoch.
NOTE For stations with shorter series, comparison of simultaneous observations with a control tide station is made in order to derive the equivalent datum of the National Tidal Datum Epoch.

FeatureAttribute.name: meanHighWater
FeatureAttribute.definition: The average height of all high waters at a location over a 19-year period.

FeatureAttribute.name: meanHighWaterNeaps
FeatureAttribute.definition: The average height of the high waters of the neap tide.

FeatureAttribute.name: meanHighWaterSprings
FeatureAttribute.definition: The average height of the high waters of spring tides.

FeatureAttribute.name: meanLowerHighWater
FeatureAttribute.definition: The average of the lower high water height of each tidal day observed over a National Tidal Datum Epoch.
NOTE For stations with shorter series, comparison of simultaneous observations with a control tide station is made in order to derive the equivalent datum of the National Tidal Datum Epoch.

FeatureAttribute.name: meanLowerLowWater
FeatureAttribute.definition: The average height of the lower low waters at a location over a 19-year period.

FeatureAttribute.name: meanLowerLowWaterSprings
FeatureAttribute.definition: The average height of lower low water at spring tides at a location.

FeatureAttribute.name: meanLowWater
FeatureAttribute.definition: The average height of all low waters at a location over a 19-year period.

FeatureAttribute.name: meanLowWaterNeaps
FeatureAttribute.definition: The average height of the low waters of the neap tide.

FeatureAttribute.name: meanLowWaterSprings
FeatureAttribute.definition: The average height of the low waters of spring tides.

FeatureAttribute.name: meanSeaLevel
FeatureAttribute.definition: The average height of the sea at a tide station measured from a fixed predetermined reference level.
NOTE Usually determined from hourly height readings, for all stages of the tide, over a 19-year period.

FeatureAttribute.name: meanTideLevel
FeatureAttribute.definition: The arithmetic mean of mean high water and mean low water.

FeatureAttribute.name: meanWaterLevel
FeatureAttribute.definition: The average of all hourly water levels over the available period of record.

FeatureAttribute.name: nearlyHighestHighWater
FeatureAttribute.definition: An arbitrary level approximating the highest water level observed at a location, usually equivalent to the high water springs.

FeatureAttribute.name: nearlyLowestLowWater
FeatureAttribute.definition: A level approximating the lowest water level observed at a location, usually equivalent to Indian spring low water.

FeatureAttribute.name: tropicHigherHighWater
FeatureAttribute.definition: The highest of the high waters (or single high water) of the tides occurring semimonthly when the effect of the Moon's maximum declination is greatest.
NOTE At these times there is a tendency for an increase in the diurnal range.

FeatureAttribute.name: tropicLowerLowWater
FeatureAttribute.definition: The lowest of the low waters (or single low water) of the tides occurring semimonthly when the effect of the Moon's maximum declination is greatest.
NOTE At these times there is a tendency for an increase in the diurnal range.

FeatureType.name: Watercourse
FeatureType.definition: A natural or man-made flowing watercourse or stream.

constraint.name: banksShallBeDifferentShoreObjects
constraint.expression: /*The shores on either side of a watercourse shall be provided (using the bank property) as two separate Shore objects.*/

constraint.name: geometryIsCurveOrSurface
constraint.description: Watercourse geometry may be a curve or surface
constraint.expression: inv: self.geometry.oclIsTypeOf(GM_Curve) or self.geometry.oclIsTypeOf(GM_Surface)

constraint.name: onlyManmadeHasConditionAttr
constraint.expression: /* A condition attribute may be specified only for a man-made watercourse */ inv: (self->count(condition)=1) implies (self.origin=OriginType::manMade)

FeatureAttribute.name: condition
FeatureAttribute.definition: The state of planning, construction, repair, and/or maintenance of a watercourse.
NOTE Only relevant for a man-made watercourse.

FeatureAttribute.name: delineationKnown
FeatureAttribute.definition: An indication that the delineation (for example: limits and information) of a spatial object is known.
EXAMPLE The delineation may not be known in the following situations:
- real underground network segment (pipeline or natural network section)
- transition area between a broad river and a smaller tributary

FeatureAttribute.name: level
FeatureAttribute.definition: Vertical location of watercourse relative to ground.

FeatureAttribute.name: streamOrder
FeatureAttribute.definition: Number (or code) expressing the degree of branching in a stream system.
SOURCE [Based on UNESCO/WMO International Glossary of Hydrology].

FeatureAttribute.name: width
FeatureAttribute.definition: Width of watercourse (as a range) along its length.

FeatureType.name: Wetland
FeatureType.definition: A poorly drained or periodically flooded area where the soil is saturated with water, and vegetation is supported.
NOTE Regarded as a candidate spatial object in Annex II theme 'Land cover' due to explicit mention in 2007/2/EC Ann. II 2.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.

NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: The geometry of the wetland, as a surface.

FeatureAttribute.name: localType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Provides 'local' name for the type of wetland.

FeatureAttribute.name: tidal
FeatureAttribute.definition: Identifies whether the wetland is affected by tidal water.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureType.name: WidthRange
FeatureType.definition: The range of a watercourse's horizontal width along its length.

FeatureType.name: DesignationSchemeValue
FeatureType.definition: The scheme used to assign a designation to the Protected Sites.

NOTE 1 Schemes may be internationally recognised (for example, Natura2000 or the Emerald Network schemes), or may be national schemes (for example, the designations used for nature conservation in a particular Member State).
NOTE 2 Typically, this code list will be extended with code schemes used within Member States.

FeatureAttribute.name: natura2000
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site has a designation under either the Habitat Directive (92/43/EEC) or the Birds Directive (79/409/EEC).

FeatureAttribute.name: emeraldNetwork
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site has a designation under the Emerald Network.
The Emerald Network is an ecological network to conserve wild flora and fauna and their natural habitats in Europe.

FeatureAttribute.name: ramsar
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site has a designation under the Ramsar Convention.
The Ramsar Convention provides the framework for national action and international cooperation for the conservation and wise use of wetlands and their resources.

FeatureAttribute.name: UNESCOWorldHeritage
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site has a designation under UNESCO World Heritage Convention.

FeatureAttribute.name: IUCN
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site has a classification using the International Union for Conservation of Nature classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: UNESCOManAndBiosphereProgramme
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site has a designation under UNESCO Man and Biosphere programme.

FeatureAttribute.name: nationalMonumentsRecord
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site has a classification using the National Monuments Record classification scheme.

FeatureType.name: DesignationType
FeatureType.definition: A data type designed to contain a designation for the Protected Site, including the designation scheme used and the value within that scheme.

constraint.name: DesignationConstraint
constraint.expression: /*Sites must use designations from an appropriate designation scheme, and the designation code value must agree with the designation scheme.*/ inv: self.designationScheme = DesignationSchemeValue::natura2000 implies self.designation.oclIsKindOf(DesignationValueNatura2000) and self.designationScheme = DesignationSchemeValue::emeraldNetwork implies self.designation.oclIsKindOf(DesignationValueEmeraldNetwork) and self.designationScheme = DesignationSchemeValue::ramsar implies self.designation.oclIsKindOf(DesignationValueRamsar) and self.designationScheme = DesignationSchemeValue::UNESCOWorldHeritage implies self.designation.oclIsKindOf(DesignationValueUNESCOWorldHeritage) and self.designationScheme = DesignationSchemeValue::IUCN implies self.designation.oclIsKindOf(DesignationValueIUCN) and self.designationScheme = DesignationSchemeValue::UNESCOManAndBiosphereProgramme implies self.designation.oclIsKindOf(DesignationValueUNESCOManAndBiosphereProgramme) and self.designationScheme = DesignationSchemeValue::nationalMonumentsRecord implies self.designation.oclIsKindOf(DesignationValueNationalMonumentsRecord)

FeatureAttribute.name: designationScheme
FeatureAttribute.definition: The scheme from which the designation code comes.

FeatureAttribute.name: percentageUnderDesignation
FeatureAttribute.definition: The percentage of the site that falls under the designation. This is used in particular for the IUCN categorisation. If a value is not provided for this attribute, it is assumed to be 100%

FeatureType.name: DesignationValue
FeatureType.definition: Abstract base type for code lists containing the classificaiton and desigation types under different schemes.
NOTE 1Some of these designation and classification lists are closed (for example, Natura2000), while some change regularly.

NOTE 2 Typically, additional code lists will be created as sub-types of this type to represent designation or classification values within Member States, e.g. natuurbeschermingsGebieden, rijksBeschermdeArcheologischeGebieden, nationaleParken, nationaleLandschappen etc. in the Netherlands.

FeatureType.name: IUCNDesignationValue
FeatureType.definition: A code list for the International Union for the Conservation of Nature classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: strictNatureReserve
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is classified as a strict nature reserve under the IUCN classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: wildernessArea
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is classified as a wilderness area under the IUCN classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: nationalPark
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is classified as a national park under the IUCN classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: habitatSpeciesManagementArea
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is classified as a habitat species management area under the IUCN classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: naturalMonument
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is classified as a natural monument under the IUCN classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: managedResourceProtectedArea
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is classified as a managed resource protected area under the IUCN classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: protectedLandscapeOrSeascape
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is classified as a protected landscape or seascape under the IUCN classification scheme.

FeatureType.name: NationalMonumentsRecordDesignationValue
FeatureType.definition: A code list for the National Monuments Record classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: agricultureAndSubsistence
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is classified as an agricultural or subsistence monument under the National Monuments Record classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: civil
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is classified as a civil monument under the National Monuments Record classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: commemorative
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is classified as a commemorative monument under the National Monuments Record classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: commercial
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is classified as a commercial monument under the National Monuments Record classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: communications
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is classified as a communications monument under the National Monuments Record classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: defence
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is classified as a defence monument under the National Monuments Record classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: domestic
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is classified as a domestic monument under the National Monuments Record classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: education
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is classified as a education monument under the National Monuments Record classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: gardensParksAndUrbanSpaces
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is classified as a garden, park or urban space monument under the National Monuments Record classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: healthAndWelfare
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is classified as a health and welfare monument under the National Monuments Record classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: industrial
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is classified as a industrial monument under the National Monuments Record classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: maritime
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is classified as a maritime monument under the National Monuments Record classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: monument
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is classified as a monument with some unclassified form under the National Monuments Record classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: recreational
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is classified as a recreational monument under the National Monuments Record classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: religiousRitualAndFunerary
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is classified as a religious, ritual or funerary monument under the National Monuments Record classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: settlement
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is classified as a settlement under the National Monuments Record classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: transport
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is classified as a transport monument under the National Monuments Record classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: waterSupplyAndDrainage
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is classified as a water supply and drainage monument under the National Monuments Record classification scheme.

FeatureType.name: Natura2000DesignationValue
FeatureType.definition: A code list for the Natura2000 designation scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: specialAreaOfConservation
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is designated as a Special Area of Conservation (SAC) under Natura2000.

FeatureAttribute.name: specialProtectionArea
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is designated as a Special Protection Area (SPA) under Natura2000.

FeatureAttribute.name: siteOfCommunityImportance
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is designated as a Site of Community Interest (SCI) under Natura2000.

FeatureAttribute.name: proposedSiteOfCommunityImportance
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is proposed as a Site of Community Interest (SCI) under Natura2000.

FeatureAttribute.name: proposedSpecialProtectionArea
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is proposed as a Special Protection Area (SPA) under Natura2000.

FeatureType.name: Percentage
FeatureType.definition: A percentage value, being an integer between 0 and 100 inclusive.

FeatureType.name: ProtectedSite
FeatureType.definition: An area designated or managed within a framework of international, Community and Member States' legislation to achieve specific conservation objectives.

Each protected site has a boundary defined through formal, legal or administrative agreements or decisions. The establishment of a protected site is normally underpinned by legislation and thus given weight in decisions about land use change and spatial planning. Each Site is normally selected as a representative example of a wider resource and selected through a formal criterion based approach. A protected site can be a contiguous extent of land/sea or a collection of discrete areas that together represent a single formal Protected Site. This class has the attributes, constraints and associations that are part of the Simple application schema.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: The geometry defining the boundary of the Protected Site.

The geometry may be determined by a wide range of methods, including surveying, digitisation or visual reference to natural features or cadastral boundaries and may be defined by the legal document that creates the protected area. The geometry included in a data set that uses this data model is stored as a fixed geometry by coordinates, not by reference to natural, cadastral or administrative boundaries, although it may originally have been defined from these.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireID
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the protected site.

NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: legalFoundationDate
FeatureAttribute.definition: The date that the protected site was legally created. This is the date that the real world object was created, not the date that its representation in an information system was created.

NOTE In the case of Natura2000 sites, a protected site may go through several different stages (for example, proposed as SCI, confirmed as SCI, designated as SAC). A new version of the site is created for each of these different stages (because there is a change in the designation), and the new version should have the date on which the new stage was legally assigned as the legalFoundationDate (for example, when designated as a SAC, the version for the SAC would have the designation date as the legalFoundationDate).

FeatureAttribute.name: legalFoundationDocument
FeatureAttribute.definition: A URL or text citation referencing the legal act that created the Protected Site.

FeatureAttribute.name: siteDesignation
FeatureAttribute.definition: At least one designation is required, but designations may be available using a number of different designation schemes, all of which can be accommodated in the DesignationSchemeValue codelist.

FeatureAttribute.name: siteName
FeatureAttribute.definition: The name of the Protected Site.
NOTE 1 Several names in different languages may be expressed.
NOTE 2 It is recommended that the language of the name (part of the GeographicalName data type) be filled where ever possible. This is an important identifying attribute of a Protected Site.

FeatureAttribute.name: siteProtectionClassification
FeatureAttribute.definition: The classification of the protected site based on the purpose for protection.
The site may have more than one classification.

FeatureType.name: ProtectionClassificationValue
FeatureType.definition: The protected site classification based on the purpose of protection.

FeatureAttribute.name: natureConservation
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is protected for the maintenance of biological diversity.

FeatureAttribute.name: archaeological
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is protected for the maintenance of archaeological heritage.

FeatureAttribute.name: cultural
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is protected for the maintenance of cultural heritage.

FeatureAttribute.name: ecological
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is protected for the maintenance of ecological stability.

FeatureAttribute.name: landscape
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is protected for the maintenance of landscape characteristics.

FeatureAttribute.name: environment
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is protected for the maintenance of environmental stability.

FeatureAttribute.name: geological
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is protected for the maintenance of geological characteristics.

FeatureType.name: RamsarDesignationValue
FeatureType.definition: A code list for the Ramsar Convention designatoin scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: ramsar
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is designated under the Ramsar Convention.

FeatureType.name: UNESCOManAndBiosphereProgrammeDesignationValue
FeatureType.definition: A code list for the World Heritage Man and Biosphere Programme classification scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: BiosphereReserve
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is designated as a Biosphere Reserve under the World Heritage Man and Biosphere Programme.

FeatureType.name: UNESCOWorldHeritageDesignationValue
FeatureType.definition: A code list for the World Heritage designation scheme.

FeatureAttribute.name: natural
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is designated as a natural World Heritage site.

FeatureAttribute.name: cultural
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is designated as a cultural World Heritage site.

FeatureAttribute.name: mixed
FeatureAttribute.definition: The Protected Site is designated as a mixed World Heritage site.

ApplicationSchema.name: Cable Transport Network
ApplicationSchema.definition: This package defines the types that are used on the cable subtheme.

FeatureType.name: CablewayLink
FeatureType.definition: Linear spatial object that describes the geometry and connectivity of a cable network between two points in a cableway transport network.
NOTE Cableway transport is a form of transport based on a cable suspended normally from a set of consecutive towers.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport links have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: cablewayType
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of a cableway transport.

FeatureType.name: CablewayLinkSequence
FeatureType.definition: An ordered collection of cableway links that are characterized by one or more thematic identifiers and/or properties.

constraint.name: All components belong to same transport network
constraint.description: A transport link sequence must be composed of transport links that all belong to the same transport network.
constraint.expression: inv: link->forAll(l | l.link.inNetwork = self.inNetwork)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport link sequences have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv: inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: CablewayLinkSet
FeatureType.definition: A collection of cableway link sequences and or individual cableway links that has a specific function or significance in a cable transport network.

constraint.name: All components belong to same transport network
constraint.description: A transport link set must be composed of transport links and or transport link sequences that all belong to the same transport network.
constraint.expression: inv: link->forAll(l | l.inNetwork = self.inNetwork)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport link sets have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: CablewayNode
FeatureType.definition: A point spatial object that is used to represent connectivity between two consecutive cableway links.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport nodes have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: CablewayTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: The possible types of cableway transport.

FeatureAttribute.name: cabinCableCar
FeatureAttribute.definition: A cableway transport whose vehicles consist on a suspended cabin to carry groups of people and/or goods inside it from one destination to another.

FeatureAttribute.name: chairLift
FeatureAttribute.definition: A cableway transport whose vehicles consist on suspended chairs to carry individuals or groups of people from one destination to another via a steel cable or rope which is looped around two points.
It Is traditionally found on mountains or steep hills but is being used more and more in amusement parks.

FeatureAttribute.name: skiTow
FeatureAttribute.definition: A cableway transport is a mechanised system for pulling skiers and snowboarders uphill.
Passengers grab hold of the rope and are pulled along while standing on their skis or snowboards and sliding up the hill. Synonyms: rope tow, handle tow.

ApplicationSchema.name: Air Transport Network
ApplicationSchema.definition: This package defines the types that are used on the air transport subtheme.

FeatureType.name: AerodromeArea
FeatureType.definition: A defined area on land or water (including any buildings, installations and equipment) intended to be used either wholly or in part for the arrival, departure and surface movement of aircraft and/or helicopters.
NOTE An area spatial object which is used to represent the physical limits of all the facilities which form part of an inland aerodrome.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport areas have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: AerodromeCategory
FeatureType.definition: Aerodrome category concerning the scope and importance of the air traffic services offered from and to it.

constraint.name: Applies to AerodromeNode and AerodromeArea only
constraint.expression: /* This property can only be associated with a spatial object that is an Aerodrome Node or an Aerodrome Area. */ inv: networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(AerodromeNode) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(AerodromeArea)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: aerodromeCategory
FeatureAttribute.definition: Value which indicates the category of an aerodrome.

FeatureType.name: AerodromeCategoryValue
FeatureType.definition: Aerodrome possible categories concerning the scope and importance of the air traffic services offered from and to it.

FeatureAttribute.name: domesticNational
FeatureAttribute.definition: Aerodrome serving domestic national air traffic services.

FeatureAttribute.name: domesticRegional
FeatureAttribute.definition: Aerodrome serving domestic regional air traffic services.

FeatureAttribute.name: international
FeatureAttribute.definition: Aerodrome serving international air traffic services.

FeatureType.name: AerodromeNode
FeatureType.definition: Node located at the aerodrome reference point of an airport/heliport, which is used to represent it in a simplified way.

DEFINITION Aerodrome Reference Point (ARP): The designated geographical location of an aerodrome, located near the initial or planned geometric centre of the aerodrome and normally remaining where originally established [AIXM3.3].

DEFINITION Airport/heliport: A defined area on land or water (including any buildings, installations and equipment) intended to be used either wholly or in part for the arrival, departure and surface movement of aircraft/helicopters [AIXM5.0].

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport nodes have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: designatorIATA
FeatureAttribute.definition: The three letter IATA designator of the aerodrome (airport/heliport).

FeatureAttribute.name: locationIndicatorICAO
FeatureAttribute.definition: The four letter ICAO location indicator of the aerodrome (airport/heliport), as listed in ICAO DOC 7910.

RelationshipRole.name: controlTowers
RelationshipRole.definition: The set of control towers belonging to an aerodrome (airport/heliport).

FeatureType.name: AerodromeType
FeatureType.definition: A code specifying the type of aerodrome.
EXAMPLE Aerodrome only, combined aerodrome/heliport or simple landing site.

constraint.name: Applies to AerodromeNode and AerodromeArea only
constraint.expression: /* This property can only be associated with a spatial object that is an Aerodrome Node or Aerodrome Area. */ inv: networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(AerodromeNode) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(AerodromeArea)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: AerodromeTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: A code specifying whether a particular entity occurrence is an Aerodrome or a Heliport.

FeatureType.name: AirLink
FeatureType.definition: A linear spatial object that describes the geometry and connectivity of the air network between two points in the network.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport links have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: AirLinkSequence
FeatureType.definition: A linear spatial object, composed of an ordered collection of air links, which represents a continuous path in the air network without any branches.

NOTE 1 The element has a defined beginning and end and every position on the air link sequence is identifiable with one single parameter such as length. It describes an element of the air network, which could be characterized by one or more thematical identifiers and/or properties.

NOTE 2 This collection of air links is equivalent to RoutePortion feature in AIXM5.0. RoutePortion: A group of two or more consecutive segments of the same route, which have the usage and/or the same flight restrictions [AIXM5.0].

constraint.name: All components belong to same transport network
constraint.description: A transport link sequence must be composed of transport links that all belong to the same transport network.
constraint.expression: inv: link->forAll(l | l.link.inNetwork = self.inNetwork)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport link sequences have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv: inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: AirNode
FeatureType.definition: A node which occurs in a air network.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport nodes have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: significantPoint
FeatureAttribute.definition: Attribute which indicates whether the air node is or is not a significant point.
DEFINITION Significant point: A specified geographical location used to define an ATS route, the flight path of an aircraft or for other navigation/ATS purposes [AIXM5.0].
NOTE Significant Points are specific air nodes which normally define air routes.

FeatureType.name: AirRoute
FeatureType.definition: A specified route designed for channelling the flow of traffic as necessary for the provision of air traffic services, from the end of the take-off and initial climb phase to the commencement of the approach and landing phase.
NOTE A collection of air link sequences and or individual air links that are characterized by one or more thematic identifiers and /or properties, which perform a Route.

constraint.name: All components belong to same transport network
constraint.description: A transport link set must be composed of transport links and or transport link sequences that all belong to the same transport network.
