constraint.expression: inv: link->forAll(l | l.inNetwork = self.inNetwork)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport link sets have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: designator
FeatureAttribute.definition: Code or designator that identifies an Air Route.

FeatureType.name: AirRouteLink
FeatureType.definition: A portion of a route to be flown usually without an intermediate stop, as defined by two consecutive significant points.
NOTE The presence of air nodes (normally defining Significant Points) is not mandated.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport links have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: airRouteLinkClass
FeatureAttribute.definition: The class or type of an air route link.

FeatureType.name: AirRouteLinkClassValue
FeatureType.definition: The type of the route from the navigation point of view.
NOTE These values enumerate the possible usages of a AirRouteLink.

FeatureAttribute.name: conventional
FeatureAttribute.definition: Conventional navigation route: An air route which does neither use Area Navigation (RNAV) nor TACAN navigation for air traffic services.

DEFINITION Definition of Area Navigation (RNAV): A method of navigation which permits aircraft operation on any desired flight path within the coverage of station-referenced navigation aids or within the limits of the capability of selfcontained aids, or a combination of both [ICAO].

FeatureAttribute.name: RNAV
FeatureAttribute.definition: Area navigation route: An air route which uses Area Navigation (RNAV) for air traffic services.

DEFINTION Area Navigation (RNAV): A method of navigation which permits aircraft operation on any desired flight path within the coverage of station-referenced navigation aids or within the limits of the capability of selfcontained aids, or a combination of both [ICAO].

FeatureAttribute.name: TACAN
FeatureAttribute.definition: TACAN route: An air route which uses TACAN Navigation for air traffic services.

DEFINITION TACAN Navigation: A method of navigation which permits aircraft operation on any desired flight path within the coverage of station-referenced Tactical Air Navigation Beacon (TACAN) navigation aids.

FeatureType.name: AirRouteTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: The route classification as ATS route or North Atlantic Tracks.

FeatureAttribute.name: ATS
FeatureAttribute.definition: ATS Route as described in ICAO Annex 11.

FeatureAttribute.name: NAT
FeatureAttribute.definition: North Atlantic Track (part of Organized Track System).

FeatureType.name: AirUseRestrictionValue
FeatureType.definition: The use restrictions for an air network object.

FeatureAttribute.name: reservedForMilitary
FeatureAttribute.definition: The air network object is exclusively for military use.

FeatureAttribute.name: temporalRestrictions
FeatureAttribute.definition: The temporal restrictions apply to the use of the air network object.

FeatureType.name: AirspaceArea
FeatureType.definition: A defined volume in the air, described as horizontal projection with vertical limits.
NOTE 1 Definition of Airspace: A defined three dimensional region of space relevant to air traffic [AIXM5.0].
NOTE 2 Airspace regions are managed by air traffic control systems to provide a safe IFR (Instrument Flight Rules) navigation for air traffic services and aircrafts.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport areas have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: AirspaceAreaType
FeatureAttribute.definition: A code indicating the general structure or characteristics of a particular airspace.

FeatureAttribute.name: ATZ
FeatureAttribute.definition: Airport Traffic Zone. Airspace of defined dimensions established around an airport for the protection of airport traffic. Description: ICAO Recognized.
NOTE An ATZ usually is set up from the lower limit of a Control Zone (CTR) to the surface.

FeatureAttribute.name: CTA
FeatureAttribute.definition: Control area. A controlled airspace extending upwards from a specified limit above the earth. Description: ICAO Recognized.

NOTE 1 A CTA could exist in the vicinity of a single airport to manage a busy air traffic area in order to provide protection to aircraft climbing out from the airport. As such it is a smaller version of a Terminal Maneuvering Area or Terminal Control Area (TMA), equivalent to it but serving only to one airport.
NOTE 2 Standard Intrument Departure (SID) routes usually ends at the upper limit of a TMA or CTA, where the air route phase starts.

FeatureAttribute.name: CTR
FeatureAttribute.definition: Control zone. A controlled airspace extending upwards from the surface of the earth to a specified upper limit. Description: ICAO Recognized.

NOTE It is normally extended from the surface to a specified upper limit, set up to protect air traffic operating to and from that airport. A CTR usually is set up from the upper limit of an Aerodrome Traffic Zone (ATZ).

FeatureAttribute.name: D
FeatureAttribute.definition: Danger area. Airspace of defined dimensions within which activities dangerous to the flight of aircraft may exist at specified times. Description: ICAO Recognized.

NOTE It is defined as a constraint airspace area to be avoided if possible, which could be dangerous for navigation of air traffic services and could be crossed only by specific routes and specific flight levels defined by the Defence Authority.

FeatureAttribute.name: FIR
FeatureAttribute.definition: Flight information region. Airspace of defined dimensions within which flight information service and alerting service are provided. Description: ICAO Recognized. Might, for example, be used if service provided by more than one unit.
NOTE 1 A FIR is an airspace region in which information, management and search-and-rescue services are provided by an air navigation service provider.

NOTE 2 Any portion of the atmosphere belongs to some specific FIR, except from some cases. Small countries could have only a single FIR; bigger ones could have some regional FIRs. The division among different countries is done by international agreement through ICAO.

FeatureAttribute.name: P
FeatureAttribute.definition: Prohibited area. Airspace of defined dimensions, above the land areas or territorial waters of a State, within which the flight of aircraft is prohibited. Description: ICAO Recognized.
NOTE It is defined as a constraint airspace area to be avoided, in which navigation of air traffic services is forbidden for high security reasons.

FeatureAttribute.name: R
FeatureAttribute.definition: Restricted area. Airspace of defined dimensions, above the land areas or territorial waters of a State, within which the flight of aircraft is restricted in accordance with certain specified conditions. Description: ICAO Recognized.
NOTE It is defined as a constraint airspace area in which navigation of air traffic services is restricted and could only be crossed temporarily with authorisation and at specific flight levels.

FeatureAttribute.name: TMA
FeatureAttribute.definition: Terminal control area. Control area normally established at the confluence of ATS routes in the vicinity of one or more major aerodromes. Description: Non-ICAO Recognized. Mainly used in Europe under the Flexible Use of Airspace concept.

NOTE 1 It is normally extended from a lower to an upper limit, set up at an area of confluence of busy airways in the vicinity of one or more major airports to protect traffic climbing out from and descending into the airports.
NOTE 2 As such it is a larger version of a Control Area (CTA). Standard Intrument Departure (SID) routes usually ends at the upper limit of a TMA or CTA, where the air route phase starts.

FeatureAttribute.name: UIR
FeatureAttribute.definition: Upper flight information region (UIR). An upper airspace of defined dimensions within which flight information service and alerting service are provided. Description: Non-ICAO Recognized. Each state determines its definition for upper airspace.

FeatureType.name: ApronArea
FeatureType.definition: A defined area, on a land aerodrome/heliport, intended to accommodate aircraft/helicopters for purposes of loading and unloading passengers, mail or cargo, and for fuelling, parking or maintenance.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport areas have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: ConditionOfAirFacility
FeatureType.definition: State of an air transport network element with regards to its completion and use.

constraint.name: Applies only to AerodromeNode, AerodromeArea and RunwayArea
constraint.expression: /* This property can only be associated with a spatial object that is an Aerodrome Node, an Aerodrome Area or a Runway Area. */ inv: networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(AerodromeNode) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(AerodromeArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RunwayArea)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: DesignatedPoint
FeatureType.definition: A geographical location not marked by the site of a radio navigation aid, used in defining an ATS route, the flight path of an aircraft or for other navigation or ATS purposes.
NOTE Examples of Designated points are compulsory and non-compulsory reporting points.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport nodes have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: designator
FeatureAttribute.definition: The coded designator of the point.
EXAMPLE The five-letter ICAO name of the point.

FeatureType.name: ElementLength
FeatureType.definition: The physical length of the element.

constraint.name: Applies to RunwayArea, TaxiwayArea and TouchDownLiftOff only
constraint.expression: /* This property can only be associated with a spatial object that is a Runway Area, Taxiway Area or Touch Down Lift Off. */ inv: networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RunwayArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(TaxiwayArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(TouchDownLiftOff)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: length
FeatureAttribute.definition: The physical length of the element.
NOTE 1 The value of the physical length of the runway [AIXM5.0], when applied to RunwayArea.
NOTE 2 Value for the length of the taxiway [AIXM5.0], when applied to TaxiwayArea.
NOTE 3 The value of the physical length of the touchdown and lift-off area [AIXM5.0], when applied to TouchDownLiftOff.

FeatureType.name: ElementWidth
FeatureType.definition: The physical width of the element.

constraint.name: Applies to RunwayArea, TaxiwayArea and TouchDownLiftOff only
constraint.expression: /* This property can only be associated with a spatial object that is a Runway Area, Taxiway Area or Touch Down Lift Off. */ inv: networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RunwayArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(TaxiwayArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(TouchDownLiftOff)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: width
FeatureAttribute.definition: The physical width of the element.
NOTE 1 The value of the physical width of the runway [AIXM5.0], when applied to RunwayArea.
NOTE 2 The value of the physical width of the taxiway [AIXM5.0], when applied to TaxiwayArea.
NOTE 3 The value of the physical width of the touchdown and lift-off area [AIXM5.0], when applied to TouchDownLiftOff.

FeatureType.name: FieldElevation
FeatureType.definition: The aerodrome elevation as the vertical distance between the highest point of the landing area of an aerodrome and mean sea level.
NOTE This might be different from the elevation of the Aerodrome Reference Point.

constraint.name: Applies to AerodromeNode and AerodromeArea only
All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: InstrumentApproachProcedure
FeatureType.definition: A series of predetermined manoeuvres by reference to flight instruments with specified protection from obstacles from the initial approach fix, or where applicable, from the beginning of a defined arrival route to a point from which a landing can be completed and thereafter, if a landing is not completed, to a position at which holding or en route obstacle clearance criteria apply.
NOTE 2 It corresponds to the final approach and arrival during the landing phase.
NOTE 3 A specific runway of an airport/heliport usually has more than one IAP, depending on the landing direction on it.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport links have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: LowerAltitudeLimit
FeatureType.definition: Altitude that defines the lower limit of an air transport network object.
NOTE When applied to an AirRouteLink it corresponds to the Lowest Safe Altitude, which is defined in order to provide safety for navigation.

constraint.name: Applies to AirRouteLink and AirspaceArea only
All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: Navaid
FeatureType.definition: One or more Navaid Equipments providing navigation services.
DEFINITION Navaid equipment: A physical navaid equipment like VOR, DME, localizer, TACAN or etc.
The Navaid Equipment share business rules like paired frequencies [AIXM5.0].

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport nodes have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: designator
FeatureAttribute.definition: The coded identifier given to the navaid system.

FeatureAttribute.name: NDB-MKR
FeatureAttribute.definition: Non-Directional Radio Beacon and Marker Beacon.

FeatureType.name: PointRoleValue
FeatureType.definition: Role of the Runway Centreline Point.

FeatureAttribute.name: end
FeatureAttribute.definition: Physical end of a runway direction.

FeatureAttribute.name: mid
FeatureAttribute.definition: The mid point of the runway.

FeatureAttribute.name: start
FeatureAttribute.definition: Physical start of a runway direction.

FeatureType.name: ProcedureLink
FeatureType.definition: A series of predetermined manoeuvres with specified protection from obstacles.

NOTE 1 A defined airway connector designed for channelling the flow of traffic as necessary for the provision of air traffic services during the take-off or landing phase, which links an airport/heliport to a significant point, usually connected to one or more air routes.

NOTE 2 When a airport/heliport is not connected with a standardized airway connector to the rest of the air network, this object can be used as a fictitious connector between the airport/heliport and a significant point on one or more ATS routes - for example for VFR (Visual Flight Rules) flights.
NOTE 3 Nevertheless, three main types of standardized Procedures are usually defined for IFR (Instrument Flight Rules) flights:
- Standard Instrument Departure (SID), corresponding to the take-off phase.
- Standard Instrument Arrival (STAR), corresponding to the initial approach during the landing phase.
- Instrument Approach Procedure (IAP), corresponding to the final approach and arrival during the landing phase.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport links have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: RunwayArea
FeatureType.definition: A defined rectangular area on a land aerodrome/heliport prepared for the landing and take-off of aircraft.
NOTE 1 This includes the concept of Final Approach and Take-Off Area (FATO) for helicopters [Runway - AIXM5.0].

NOTE 2 The runway strip is a defined area including the runway and stopway, if provided, intended : a) to reduce the risk of damage to aircraft running off a runway; and b) to protect aircraft flying over it during take-off or landing operations [ICAO].

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport areas have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: designator
FeatureAttribute.definition: The full textual designator of the runway, used to uniquely identify it at an aerodrome/heliport which has more than one.

FeatureAttribute.name: runwayType
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of runway, either runway for airplanes or final approach and take off area (FATO) for helicopters.

FeatureType.name: RunwayCentrelinePoint
FeatureType.definition: An operationally significant position on the center line of a runway direction.
NOTE 1 The role of the point along the runway direction centreline is indicated within the pointRole attribute.
NOTE 2 Runway centreline points are used to connect the Procedure Links that connect an airport/heliport to the rest of the air network.
EXAMPLE A typical example is the runway threshold [AIXM5.0].

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport nodes have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: pointRole
FeatureAttribute.definition: The role of the point along the runway direction centreline.

FeatureType.name: RunwayTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: A code that makes a distinction between runways for airplanes and FATO for helicopters.

FeatureAttribute.name: FATO
FeatureAttribute.definition: Final Approach and Take Off Area for helicopters.

FeatureType.name: StandardInstrumentArrival
FeatureType.definition: A designated instrument flight rule (IFR) arrival route linking a significant point, normally on an ATS route, with a point from which a published instrument approach procedure can be commenced.

NOTE 2 It corresponds to the initial approach during the landing phase. Each airport/heliport could have various STAR linking significant points (usually connected to air routes) to the points designated to start the landing on a specific runway.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport links have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: designator
FeatureAttribute.definition: The textual designator of the Standard Instrument Arrival.

FeatureType.name: StandardInstrumentDeparture
FeatureType.definition: A designated instrument flight rule (IFR) departure route linking the aerodrome or a specific runway of the aerodrome with a specified significant point, normally on a designated ATS route, at which the en-route phase of a flight commences.
NOTE 2 It corresponds to the take-off phase. Each airport/heliport could have various SID linking the different runways to one or various significant points, usually connected to air routes.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport links have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: designator
FeatureAttribute.definition: The full textual designator of the Standard Instrument Departure.

FeatureType.name: SurfaceComposition
FeatureType.definition: The composition of an aerodrome/heliport related surface.

constraint.name: Applies to RunwayArea, TaxiwayArea, ApronArea and TouchDownLiftOff only
constraint.expression: /* This property can only be associated with a spatial object that is a Runway Area, Taxiway Area, Apron Area or Touch Down Lift Off. */ inv: networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RunwayArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(TaxiwayArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(ApronArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(TouchDownLiftOff)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: surfaceComposition
FeatureAttribute.definition: A code indicating the composition of an aerodrome/heliport related surface.

FeatureType.name: SurfaceCompositionValue
FeatureType.definition: A code indicating the composition of a surface.

FeatureAttribute.name: asphalt
FeatureAttribute.definition: Surface made of an asphalt layer.

FeatureAttribute.name: concrete
FeatureAttribute.definition: Surface made of a concrete layer.

FeatureAttribute.name: grass
FeatureAttribute.definition: Surface consisting on a grass layer.

FeatureType.name: TaxiwayArea
FeatureType.definition: A defined path at an aerodrome/heliport established for the taxiing of aircraft/helicopters and intended to provide a link between one part of the aerodrome and another.
NOTE This includes aircraft/helicopter stand taxilines, apron taxiways, rapid exit taxiways, air taxiways etc.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport areas have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: designator
FeatureAttribute.definition: The textual designator of the taxiway.

FeatureType.name: TouchDownLiftOff
FeatureType.definition: A load bearing area on which a helicopter may touch down or lift-off.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport nodes have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: designator
FeatureAttribute.definition: The textual designator of the touch down and lift-off area.

FeatureType.name: UpperAltitudeLimit
FeatureType.definition: Altitude that defines the upper limit of an air transport network object.

constraint.name: Applies to AirRouteLink and AirspaceArea only
All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: UseRestriction
FeatureType.definition: The restrictions to the use of an air network object.

constraint.name: Applies to AirRoute, AirLinks, AirNodes and AerodromeArea only
constraint.expression: /* This property can only be associated with a spatial object that is an Air Route, Air Link (or specialized Air Link), Air Node (or specialized Air Node) or Aerodrome Area. */ inv: networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(AirRoute) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(AirLink) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(AirNode) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(AerodromeArea)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: restriction
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of use restriction for the air network object.

ApplicationSchema.name: Railway Transport Network
ApplicationSchema.definition: This package defines the types that are used on the rail subtheme

FeatureType.name: DesignSpeed
FeatureType.definition: The specification of the maximum speed to which a railway line is designed for.

constraint.name: Applies to railway transport classes only
constraint.expression: /* This property can only be associated with a spatial object that is part of a railway transport network. */ inv: networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayYardArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayStationArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayLine) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayLinkSequence) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayLink) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayNode)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: speed
FeatureAttribute.definition: The specification of the maximum speed to which a railway line is designed for.

FeatureType.name: FormOfRailwayNodeValue
FeatureType.definition: The possible functions of a railway node within the railway network.

FeatureAttribute.name: junction
FeatureAttribute.definition: A railway node where the railway network have a mechanism consisting on a railroad track with two movable rails and the necessary connections, which let vehicles turn from one track to another.

FeatureAttribute.name: levelCrossing
FeatureAttribute.definition: A railway node where the railway network is a crossed by a road at the same level.

FeatureAttribute.name: pseudoNode
FeatureAttribute.definition: A railway node which represents a point where one or more attributes of the railway links connected to it change their value, or a point necessary to describe the geometry of the network.

FeatureAttribute.name: railwayEnd
FeatureAttribute.definition: A railway node where the railway starts or ends. The railway network is interrupted at this point.

FeatureAttribute.name: railwayStop
FeatureAttribute.definition: A place in the railway network where trains stop to load/unload cargo or to let passengers get on and off the train.

FeatureType.name: MinMaxTrackValue
FeatureType.definition: Values to indicate whether number of tracks are counted as the maximum, minimum or average number.

FeatureAttribute.name: average
FeatureAttribute.definition: The number of tracks is the average value for a given part of the railway network.

FeatureAttribute.name: maximum
FeatureAttribute.definition: The number of tracks is the maximum value for a given part of the railway network.

FeatureAttribute.name: minimum
FeatureAttribute.definition: The number of tracks is the minimum value for a given part of the railway network.

FeatureType.name: NominalTrackGauge
FeatureType.definition: The nominal distance between the two outer rails (gauge) of a railway track.

constraint.name: Applies to railway transport classes only
constraint.expression: /* This property can only be associated with a spatial object that is part of a railway transport network. */ inv: networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayYardArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayStationArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayLine) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayLinkSequence) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayLink) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayNode)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: nominalGauge
FeatureAttribute.definition: A single value that identifies the track gauge.

FeatureAttribute.name: nominalGaugeCategory
FeatureAttribute.definition: Provision of the gauge of a railway track as a fuzzy category with respect to the European standard nominal gauge.

FeatureType.name: NumberOfTracks
FeatureType.definition: The number of tracks for a railway stretch.
This is dependent on the resolution of the data.

constraint.name: Applies to railway transport classes only
constraint.expression: /* This property can only be associated with a spatial object that is part of a railway transport network. */ inv: networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayYardArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayStationArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayLine) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayLinkSequence) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayLink) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayNode)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: minMaxNumberOfTracks
FeatureAttribute.definition: Indicates whether the number of tracks are counted as minimum or maximum value.
NOTE This attribute only applies when the value in numberOfTracks is not an exact value.

FeatureType.name: RailwayArea
FeatureType.definition: Surface occupied by a railway track, including ballast.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport areas have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: RailwayElectrification
FeatureType.definition: Indication whether the railway is provided with an electric system to power vehicles moving along it.

constraint.name: Applies to railway transport classes only
constraint.expression: /* This property can only be associated with a spatial object that is part of a railway transport network. */ inv: networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayYardArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayStationArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayLine) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayLinkSequence) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayLink) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayNode)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: electrified
FeatureAttribute.definition: Inidicates whether the railway is provided with an electric system to power vehicles moving along it.

FeatureType.name: RailwayLine
FeatureType.definition: A collection of railway link sequences and or individual railway links that are characterized by one or more thematical identifiers and/or properties.
EXAMPLE Railway lines characterized by a specific identification code, used by railroad companies or tourist railways, identified by a specific name.

constraint.name: All components belong to same transport network
constraint.description: A transport link set must be composed of transport links and or transport link sequences that all belong to the same transport network.
constraint.expression: inv: link->forAll(l | l.inNetwork = self.inNetwork)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport link sets have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: railwayLineCode
FeatureAttribute.definition: A code assigned to a railway line which is unique within a Member State.

FeatureType.name: RailwayLink
FeatureType.definition: A linear spatial object that describes the geometry and connectivity of a railway network between two points in the network.
NOTE Railway links can be used to represent stretches of railway with one or multiple tracks.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport links have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: fictitious
FeatureAttribute.definition: The railway link does not represent a real and existing railway track but a fictitious trajectory.
EXAMPLE A fictitious trajectory to connect railway links across a turntable.

FeatureType.name: RailwayLinkSequence
FeatureType.definition: A linear spatial object, composed of an ordered collection of railway links, which represents a continuous path in a railway network without any branches. The element has a defined beginning and end and every position on the railway link sequence is identifiable with one single parameter such as length. It describes an element of the railway network, characterized by one or more thematical identifiers and/or properties.

constraint.name: All components belong to same transport network
constraint.description: A transport link sequence must be composed of transport links that all belong to the same transport network.
constraint.expression: inv: link->forAll(l | l.link.inNetwork = self.inNetwork)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport link sequences have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv: inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: RailwayNode
FeatureType.definition: A point spatial object which represents a significant point along the railway network or defines an intersection of railway tracks used to describe its connectivity.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport nodes have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: formOfNode
FeatureAttribute.definition: The function of a railway node within the railway network.

FeatureType.name: RailwayStationArea
FeatureType.definition: An area spatial object which is used to represent the topographical limits of the facilities of a railway station (buildings, railway yards, installations and equipment) devoted to carry out railway station operations.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport areas have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: RailwayStationCode
FeatureType.definition: The unique code assigned to a railway station.

constraint.name: Applies to Railway Transport classes only
constraint.expression: /* This property can only be associated with a spatial object that is part of a railway transport network. */ inv: networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayYardArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayStationArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayLine) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayLinkSequence) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayLink) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayNode)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: stationCode
FeatureAttribute.definition: A unique code assigned to a railway station.

FeatureType.name: RailwayStationNode
FeatureType.definition: A railway node which represents the location of a railway station along the railway network.

constraint.name: formOfNode is always RailwayStop
constraint.expression: /* For a railway station node, the value for the "formOfNode" attribute shall always be "RailwayStop". */ formOfNode = FormOfRailwayNodeValue::railwayStop

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport nodes have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: numberOfPlatforms
FeatureAttribute.definition: A value indicating the number of platforms available at a railway station.

FeatureType.name: RailwayType
FeatureType.definition: The type of railway transport the line is designed for.

constraint.name: Applies to railway transport classes only
constraint.expression: /* This property can only be associated with a spatial object that is part of a railway transport network. */ inv: networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayYardArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayStationArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayLine) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayLinkSequence) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayLink) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayNode)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: type
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of railway transport to which the line is designed for.

FeatureType.name: RailwayTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: The possible types of railway transport.

FeatureAttribute.name: cogRailway
FeatureAttribute.definition: A railway transport which allows the vehicles to operate on steep gradients, consisting on a railway provided with a toothed rack rail (usually between the running rails) where vehicles are fitted with one or more cog wheels or pinions that mesh with this rack rail.
Synonyms: cog railway, pens and rails railway, rack-and-pinion railway or rack railway.

FeatureAttribute.name: funicular
FeatureAttribute.definition: A railway transport consisting on a cable attached to a vehicle on rails which moves them up and down a very steep slope, where it is possible the ascending and descending vehicles counterbalancing each other.
Synonyms: funicular railway, incline, inclined railway, inclined plane or cliff railway.

FeatureAttribute.name: magneticLevitation
FeatureAttribute.definition: A railway transport based on a single rail which acts as guideway of a vehicle and support it by means of a magnetic levitation mechanism.

FeatureAttribute.name: metro
FeatureAttribute.definition: An urban railway transport system used in large urban areas, which runs on a separate track from other transport systems, is usually electrically powered and in some cases runs under ground. .

FeatureAttribute.name: monorail
FeatureAttribute.definition: A railway transport based on a single rail which acts either as its only support and guideway.

FeatureAttribute.name: suspendedRail
FeatureAttribute.definition: A railway transport based on a single rail, acting either as support and guideway, from which a vehicle is suspended to move along the railway.

FeatureAttribute.name: train
FeatureAttribute.definition: A railway transport usually consisting on two parallel rails on which a powered-vehicle or train machine pulls a connected series of vehicles to move them along the railway in order to transport freight or passengers from one destination to another.

FeatureAttribute.name: tramway
FeatureAttribute.definition: A railway transport system used in urban areas, which often runs at street level, sharing road space with motor traffic and pedestrians. Tramways are usually electrically powered.

FeatureType.name: RailwayUse
FeatureType.definition: The current use of the railway.

constraint.name: Applies to Railway Transport classes only
constraint.expression: /* This property can only be associated with a spatial object that is part of a railway transport network. */ inv: networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayYardArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayStationArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayLine) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayLinkSequence) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayLink) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RailwayNode)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: use
FeatureAttribute.definition: The current use of the railway.

FeatureAttribute.name: cargo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The use of railway is exclusively for cargo operations.

FeatureAttribute.name: carShuttle
FeatureAttribute.definition: The use of railway is exclusively to perform car shuttle transport.

FeatureAttribute.name: mixed
FeatureAttribute.definition: The use of railway is mixed. It is used to transport passengers and cargo..

FeatureAttribute.name: passengers
FeatureAttribute.definition: The use of railway is exclusively to transport passengers[TWG-TN].

FeatureType.name: RailwayYardArea
FeatureType.definition: An area spatial object which is used to represent the topographical limits of a railway yard.

DEFINITION Railway yard: An area crossed by a number of parallel railway tracks (usually more than two) interconnected between them, which are used to stop trains in order to load / unload freight without interrupting the traffic of a main railway line.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport areas have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: RailwayYardNode
FeatureType.definition: A railway node which occurs within a railway yard area.

DEFINTION Railway yard: An area crossed by a number of parallel railway tracks (usually more than two) interconnected between them, which are used to stop trains in order to load / unload freight without interrupting the traffic of a main railway line.

constraint.name: formOfNode is always RailwayStop
constraint.expression: /* For a railway yard node, the value for the "formOfNode" attribute shall always be "RailwayStop". */ formOfNode = FormOfRailwayNodeValue::railwayStop

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport nodes have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: TrackGaugeCategoryValue
FeatureType.definition: The possible categories of railways concerning its nominal track gauge.

FeatureAttribute.name: broad
FeatureAttribute.definition: The nominal track gauge property is broader than the standard one.

FeatureAttribute.name: standard
FeatureAttribute.definition: The nominal track gauge property is equal to the European standard (1435 millimetres).

FeatureAttribute.name: narrow
FeatureAttribute.definition: The nominal track gauge property is narrower than the standard one.

FeatureAttribute.name: notApplicable
FeatureAttribute.definition: The definition of a nominal track gauge property is not applicable to the type of railway transport.

ApplicationSchema.name: Water Transport Network
ApplicationSchema.definition: This package defines the types that are used on the water transport subtheme.

FeatureType.name: Beacon
FeatureType.definition: A prominent specially constructed object forming a conspicuous mark as a fixed aid to navigation, or for use in hydrographic survey.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport points have an external object identfier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: Buoy
FeatureType.definition: A floating object moored to the bottom in a particular (charted) place, as an aid to navigation or for other specific purposes.

NOTE Navigational buoys may be classified according to: (a) their shape, appearance, or construction, such as barrel, can, cask, conical, cylindrical, dan, keg, nun, pillar, spar, spherical, or topmark buoy; (b) their colour, such as black, chequered, green, red buoy; (c) their location, such as bifurcation, fairway, junction, mid-channel, middle-ground, or turning buoy; (d) the various kinds of hazards or dangers to navigation which they mark, such as bar, isolated danger, fish trap, obstruction, spoil ground, telegraph or wreck buoy; (e) their particular purpose or use, such as anchor, anchorage, compass adjustment, dredging, farewell (or landfall), marker, quarantine, station (or watch), or warping buoy. [S-32 - IHO International Hydrographic Dictionary].

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport points have an external object identfier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: CEMTClass
FeatureType.definition: Classification of an inland waterway according to CEMT (European Conference of Ministers of Transport).

constraint.name: Applies to InlandWaterway only
constraint.expression: /* This property can only be associated with a spatial object that is part of a water transport network. */ inv: networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(InlandWaterway)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: CEMTClass
FeatureAttribute.definition: Value indicating the classification of an Inland waterway according to CEMT (European Conference of Ministers of Transport).

FeatureType.name: CEMTClassValue
FeatureType.definition: Inland waterway classification according to CEMT (European Conference of Ministers of Transport) Resolution No.92/2.

FeatureAttribute.name: I
FeatureAttribute.definition: Inland waterway belonging to CEMT-class I, defined by the European Conference of Ministers of Transport, Resolution No.92/2 - Table 1.

FeatureAttribute.name: II
FeatureAttribute.definition: Inland waterway belonging to CEMT-class II, defined by the European Conference of Ministers of Transport, Resolution No.92/2 - Table 1.

FeatureAttribute.name: III
FeatureAttribute.definition: Inland waterway belonging to CEMT-class III, defined by the European Conference of Ministers of Transport, Resolution No.92/2 - Table 1.

FeatureAttribute.name: IV
FeatureAttribute.definition: Inland waterway belonging to CEMT-class IV, defined by the European Conference of Ministers of Transport, Resolution No.92/2 - Table 1.

FeatureAttribute.name: Va
FeatureAttribute.definition: Inland waterway belonging to CEMT-class Va, defined by the European Conference of Ministers of Transport, Resolution No.92/2 - Table 1.

FeatureAttribute.name: Vb
FeatureAttribute.definition: Inland waterway belonging to CEMT-class Vb, defined by the European Conference of Ministers of Transport, Resolution No.92/2 - Table 1.

FeatureAttribute.name: VIa
FeatureAttribute.definition: Inland waterway belonging to CEMT-class VIa, defined by the European Conference of Ministers of Transport, Resolution No.92/2 - Table 1.

FeatureAttribute.name: VIb
FeatureAttribute.definition: Inland waterway belonging to CEMT-class VIb, defined by the European Conference of Ministers of Transport, Resolution No.92/2 - Table 1.

FeatureAttribute.name: VIc
FeatureAttribute.definition: Inland waterway belonging to CEMT-class VIc, defined by the European Conference of Ministers of Transport, Resolution No.92/2 - Table 1.

FeatureAttribute.name: VII
FeatureAttribute.definition: Inland waterway belonging to CEMT-class VII, defined by the European Conference of Ministers of Transport, Resolution No.92/2 - Table 1.

FeatureType.name: ConditionOfWaterFacility
FeatureType.definition: State of a water transport network element with regards to its completion and use.

constraint.name: Applies to PortNode and PortArea only
constraint.expression: /* This property can only be associated with a spatial object that is part of a water transport network. */ inv: networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(PortArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(PortNode)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: FairwayArea
FeatureType.definition: The main travelled part of a waterway.

NOTE That part of a river, harbour and so on, where the main navigable channel for vessels of larger size lies. It is also the usual course followed by vessels entering or leaving harbours, called 'ship channel' [IHO Hidrographic Registry].

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport areas have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: FerryCrossing
FeatureType.definition: A special waterway aimed at supporting the transport of passengers, vehicles or other cargo/freight across a water body, and which is normally used as a connection linking two or more nodes of a land based transport network.

constraint.name: All components belong to same transport network
constraint.description: A transport link set must be composed of transport links and or transport link sequences that all belong to the same transport network.
constraint.expression: inv: link->forAll(l | l.inNetwork = self.inNetwork)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport link sets have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: FerryUse
FeatureType.definition: The type of transport carried out by a ferry crossing.

constraint.name: Applies to FerryCrossing only
constraint.expression: /* This property can only be associated with a spatial object that is part of a water transport network. */ inv: networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(FerryCrossing)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: ferryUse
FeatureAttribute.definition: Value indicating the type of transport carried out by a ferry crossing.

FeatureType.name: FerryUseValue
FeatureType.definition: Types of transport carried out by a ferry.

FeatureAttribute.name: other
FeatureAttribute.definition: Ferry carries others forms of transport than passengers, cars, trucks or trains.

FeatureType.name: FormOfWaterwayNodeValue
FeatureType.definition: Function of a WaterwayNode in the water transport network.

FeatureAttribute.name: junctionFork
FeatureAttribute.definition: Infrastructure elements where the one vessel traffic flow crosses another vessel traffic flow or points where vessel traffic flows divide or come together.

FeatureAttribute.name: lockComplex
FeatureAttribute.definition: Lock or group of locks, intended for raising and lowering boats between stretches of water of different levels on river and canal waterways.

FeatureAttribute.name: movableBridge
FeatureAttribute.definition: Bridge that can be raised or turned to allow the passage of ships.

FeatureAttribute.name: terminal
FeatureAttribute.definition: The location where goods are transhipped.
NOTE A terminal forms a link between the various transport modes, of which shipping is one. A terminal therefore has waterside loading and unloading places [COMPRIS].

FeatureAttribute.name: turningBasin
FeatureAttribute.definition: A place where a canal or narrow waterway is widened to allow boats to turn around.

FeatureAttribute.name: shipLift
FeatureAttribute.definition: A machine for transporting boats between water bodies at two different elevations, which is used as an alternative to the canal locks..
NOTE Synonyms: boat lift, lift lock.

FeatureType.name: InlandWaterway
FeatureType.definition: Waterway which is defined at inland continental waters.
EXAMPLE The inland waterways classified by the CEMT (European Conference of Ministers of Transport).

constraint.name: All components belong to same transport network
constraint.description: A transport link set must be composed of transport links and or transport link sequences that all belong to the same transport network.
constraint.expression: inv: link->forAll(l | l.inNetwork = self.inNetwork)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport link sets have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: MarineWaterway
FeatureType.definition: Waterway which is defined at sea waters.

constraint.name: All components belong to same transport network
constraint.description: A transport link set must be composed of transport links and or transport link sequences that all belong to the same transport network.
constraint.expression: inv: link->forAll(l | l.inNetwork = self.inNetwork)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport link sets have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: deepWaterRoute
FeatureAttribute.definition: Attribute which indicates if the maritime waterway is a deep water route.

DEFINITION Deep water route: A route in a designated area within defined limits which has been accurately surveyed for clearance of sea bottom and submerged obstacles to a minimum indicated depth of water [S-32 - IHO International Hydrographic Dictionary].

FeatureType.name: PortArea
FeatureType.definition: An area spatial object which is used to represent the physical limits of all the facilities which constitute the terrestrial zone of a sea or inland port.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport areas have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: PortNode
FeatureType.definition: A point spatial object which is used to represent a sea or inland port in a simplified way, aproximately located at the bank of the waterbody where the port is placed.
NOTE It is used to connect the port with the rest of the water transport network, by means of the different waterway links which arrive to / depart from it.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport nodes have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: RestrictionForWaterVehicles
FeatureType.definition: Restriction on vehicles on a water transport element.

constraint.name: Applies to WaterwayLink and WaterwayNode only
All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: TrafficSeparationScheme
FeatureType.definition: A scheme which aims at reducing the risk of collision in congested and/or converging areas by separating traffic moving in opposite, or nearly opposite, directions.
NOTE 2 TSSs constitute main components of maritime routing measures for hydrographic transport.

RelationshipRole.name: component
RelationshipRole.definition: A component of a traffic separation scheme.

RelationshipRole.name: markerBuoy
RelationshipRole.definition: A marker forming part of a traffic separation scheme.

RelationshipRole.name: marineWaterRoute
RelationshipRole.definition: The collection of marine waterways associated with a traffic separation scheme.

RelationshipRole.name: markerBeacon
RelationshipRole.definition: A marker forming part of a traffic separation scheme.

FeatureType.name: TrafficSeparationSchemeArea
FeatureType.definition: An area spatial object forming part of a traffic separation scheme.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport areas have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: TrafficSeparationSchemeCrossing
FeatureType.definition: A defined area where traffic lanes cross.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport areas have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: TrafficSeparationSchemeLane
FeatureType.definition: An area within defined limits in which one-way traffic flow is established.
SOURCE [IMO Ships Routeing, 6th Edition], [IHO Hydrographic Registry].

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport areas have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: TrafficSeparationSchemeRoundabout
FeatureType.definition: A traffic separation scheme in which traffic moves in a counter-clockwise direction around a specified point or zone.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport areas have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: TrafficSeparationSchemeSeparator
FeatureType.definition: A zone separating the lanes in which ships are proceeding in opposite or nearly opposite directions; or separating traffic lanes designated for particular classes of ships proceeding in the same direction.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport areas have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: WaterLinkSequence
FeatureType.definition: A linear spatial object, composed of an ordered collection of waterway and/or watercourse links (as necessary), which represents a continuous path in the water network without any branches.

NOTE The element has a defined beginning and end and every position on the water link sequence is identifiable with one single parameter such as length. It describes a element of the water network, which is a navigable path within a water body (oceans, seas, rivers, lakes, channels or canals) and could be characterized by one or more thematical identifiers and/or properties.

constraint.name: All components belong to same transport network
constraint.description: A transport link sequence must be composed of transport links that all belong to the same transport network.
constraint.expression: inv: link->forAll(l | l.link.inNetwork = self.inNetwork)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport link sequences have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv: inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: WaterNode
FeatureType.definition: A point spatial object which is used to represent the connectivity between two different waterway links, or between a waterway link and a watercourse link, in the water transport network.
NOTE It is also used to represent a significant feature in the network, such as a port.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport nodes have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: WaterTrafficFlowDirection
FeatureType.definition: Indicates the direction of the flow of water transport traffic in relation to the direction of the water transport link vector.

constraint.name: Applies to WaterwayLink and WaterLinkSequence only
Applies to Link and LinkSequence only
constraint.expression: /* This property can only be associated with a spatial object of the type Link or LinkSequence. */ inv: networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(LinkReference)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: Waterway
FeatureType.definition: A collection of water link sequences and or individual waterway and/or watercourse links (as necessary) that are characterized by one or more thematical identifiers and/or properties, which perform a navigable route within a water body (oceans, seas, rivers, lakes, channels or canals).

constraint.name: All components belong to same transport network
constraint.description: A transport link set must be composed of transport links and or transport link sequences that all belong to the same transport network.
constraint.expression: inv: link->forAll(l | l.inNetwork = self.inNetwork)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport link sets have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: WaterwayLink
FeatureType.definition: A linear spatial object that describes the geometry or connectivity of the water transport network between two consecutive waterway or watercourse nodes. It represents a linear section across a body of water which is used for shipping.
NOTE Water Transport Networks will use the WatercourseLink class - provided by the INSPIRE Hydrography Data Specification - wherever possible.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport links have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: WaterwayNode
FeatureType.definition: A point spatial object which is used to represent the connectivity between two different waterway links, or between a waterway link and a watercourse link, in the water transport network.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport nodes have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: formOfWaterwayNode
FeatureAttribute.definition: Description of the function of a waterway node in the water transport network.

ApplicationSchema.name: Common Transport Elements
ApplicationSchema.definition: This package defines the types that are common for all transport networks subthemes.

FeatureType.name: AccessRestriction
FeatureType.definition: A restriction on the access to a transport element.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: AccessRestrictionValue
FeatureType.definition: Types of access restrictions for a transport element.

FeatureAttribute.name: forbiddenLegally
FeatureAttribute.definition: Access to the transport element is forbidden by law.

FeatureAttribute.name: physicallyImpossible
FeatureAttribute.definition: Access to the transport element is physically impossible due to the presence of barriers or other physical obstacles.

FeatureAttribute.name: private
FeatureAttribute.definition: Access to the transport element is restricted because it is privately owned.

FeatureAttribute.name: publicAccess
FeatureAttribute.definition: The transport element is open to public access.

FeatureAttribute.name: seasonal
FeatureAttribute.definition: Access to the transport element depends on the season.

FeatureAttribute.name: toll
FeatureAttribute.definition: Access to the transport element is subject to toll.

FeatureType.name: ConditionOfFacility
FeatureType.definition: State of a transport network element with regards to its completion and use.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: currentStatus
FeatureAttribute.definition: Current status value of a transport network element with regards to its completion and use.

FeatureType.name: MaintenanceAuthority
FeatureType.definition: The authority responsible for maintenance of the transport element.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: MarkerPost
FeatureType.definition: Reference marker placed along a route in a transport network, mostly at regular intervals, indicating the distance from the beginning of the route, or some other reference point, to the point where the marker is located.
EXAMPLE Examples of routes along which marker posts can be found are roads, railway lines and navigable waterways.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport points have an external object identfier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: location
FeatureAttribute.definition: Distance from the beginning of the route, or some other reference point, to the point where a marker post is located.

RelationshipRole.name: route
RelationshipRole.definition: Route in a transport network along which the marker post is placed.

RelationshipRole.name: post
RelationshipRole.definition: Marker post along a route in a transport network.

FeatureType.name: OwnerAuthority
FeatureType.definition: The authority owning the transport element.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: RestrictionForVehicles
FeatureType.definition: Restriction on vehicles on a transport element.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: RestrictionTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: Possible restrictions on vehicles that can access a transport element.

FeatureAttribute.name: maximumDoubleAxleWeight
FeatureAttribute.definition: The maximum weight per double axle of a vehicle allowed at a transport element.
NOTE This value applies to wheeled vehicles only.

FeatureAttribute.name: maximumHeight
FeatureAttribute.definition: The maximum height of a vehicle which can pass under another object .

FeatureAttribute.name: maximumLength
FeatureAttribute.definition: The maximum length of a vehicle allowed at a transport element.

FeatureAttribute.name: maximumSingleAxleWeight
FeatureAttribute.definition: The maximum weight per single axle of a vehicle allowed at a transport element.
NOTE This value applies to wheeled vehicles only.

FeatureAttribute.name: maximumTotalWeight
FeatureAttribute.definition: The maximum total weight of a vehicle allowed at a transport element.

FeatureAttribute.name: maximumTripleAxleWeight
FeatureAttribute.definition: The maximum weight per triple axle of a vehicle allowed at a transport element.
NOTE This value applies to wheeled vehicles only.

FeatureAttribute.name: maximumWidth
FeatureAttribute.definition: The maximum width of a vehicle allowed on a transport element.

FeatureType.name: TrafficFlowDirection
FeatureType.definition: Indicates the direction of the flow of traffic in relation to the direction of the transport link vector.

constraint.name: Applies to Link and LinkSequence only
constraint.expression: /* This property can only be associated with a spatial object of the type Link or LinkSequence. */ inv: networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(LinkReference)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: direction
FeatureAttribute.definition: Indicates the direction of the flow of traffic.

FeatureType.name: TransportArea
FeatureType.definition: Surface that represents the spatial extent of an element of a transport network.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport areas have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time when the transport area started to exist in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which the transport area no longer exists in the real world.

FeatureType.name: TransportLink
FeatureType.definition: A linear spatial object that describes the geometry and connectivity of a transport network between two points in the network.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport links have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time when the transport link started to exist in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which the transport link no longer exists in the real world.

FeatureType.name: TransportLinkSequence
FeatureType.definition: A linear spatial object, composed of an ordered collection of transport links, which represents a continuous path in the transport network without any branches. The element has a defined beginning and end and every position on the transport link sequence is identifiable with one single parameter such as length. It describes an element of the transport network, characterized by one or more thematical identifiers and/or properties.

constraint.name: All components belong to same transport network
constraint.description: A transport link sequence must be composed of transport links that all belong to the same transport network.
constraint.expression: inv: link->forAll(l | l.link.inNetwork = self.inNetwork)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport link sequences have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv: inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time when the transport link sequence started to exist in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which the transport link sequence no longer exists in the real world.

FeatureType.name: TransportLinkSet
FeatureType.definition: A collection of transport link sequences and or individual transport links that has a specific function or significance in a transport network.
This spatial object type supports the aggregation of links to form objects with branches, loops, parallel sequences of links, gaps, etc.
A dual carriageway road, as a collection of the two link sequences that represent each carriageway.

constraint.name: All components belong to same transport network
constraint.description: A transport link set must be composed of transport links and or transport link sequences that all belong to the same transport network.
constraint.expression: inv: link->forAll(l | l.inNetwork = self.inNetwork)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport link sets have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time when the transport link set started to exist in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which the transport link set no longer exists in the real world.

FeatureType.name: TransportNetwork
FeatureType.definition: Collection of network elements that belong to a single mode of transport.

NOTE Road, rail, water and air transport are always considered separate transport modes. Even within these four categories, multiple modes of transport can be defined, based on infrastructure, vehicle types, propulsion system, operation and/or other defining characteristics.

EXAMPLE All road transport can be considered one mode of transport for some applications. For other applications, it might be necessary to distinguish between different public road transport networks. Within water transport, marine and inland water transport can be considered to be separate modes of transport for some applications, as they use different types of ships.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.

FeatureAttribute.name: typeOfTransport
FeatureAttribute.definition: Type of transport network, based on the type of infrastructure the network uses.

FeatureType.name: TransportNode
FeatureType.definition: A point spatial object which is used for connectivity.
Nodes are found at either end of the TransportLink.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport nodes have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time when the transport node started to exist in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which the transport node no longer exists in the real world.

FeatureType.name: TransportObject
FeatureType.definition: An identity base for transport network objects in the real world.

NOTE Derived 'views' of real-world transport objects are represented through specialisations in other application schemas; all representations of the same real-world object share a common geographic name.

FeatureAttribute.name: geographicalName
FeatureAttribute.definition: A geographical name that is used to identify the transport network object in the real world. It provides a 'key' for implicitly associating different representations of the object.

FeatureType.name: TransportPoint
FeatureType.definition: A point spatial object - which is not a node - that represents the position of an element of a transport network.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport points have an external object identfier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: The location of the transport point.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time when the transport point started to exist in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which the transport point no longer exists in the real world.

FeatureType.name: TransportProperty
FeatureType.definition: A reference to a property that falls upon the network. This property can apply to the whole of the network element it is associated with or - for linear spatial objects - be described using linear referencing.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time when the transport property started to exist in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which the transport property no longer exists in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: air
FeatureAttribute.definition: The transport network consists of transport by air.

FeatureAttribute.name: cable
FeatureAttribute.definition: The transport network consists of transport by cable.

FeatureAttribute.name: rail
FeatureAttribute.definition: The transport network consists of transport by rail.

FeatureAttribute.name: road
FeatureAttribute.definition: The transport network consists of transport by road.

FeatureAttribute.name: water
FeatureAttribute.definition: The transport network consists of transport by water.

FeatureType.name: VerticalPosition
FeatureType.definition: Vertical level relative to other transport network elements.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: verticalPosition
FeatureAttribute.definition: Relative vertical position of the transport element.

ApplicationSchema.name: Road Transport Network
ApplicationSchema.definition: This package defines the types that are used on the road subtheme.

FeatureType.name: AreaConditionValue
FeatureType.definition: Speed limit restriction depending on the area.

FeatureAttribute.name: inNationalPark
FeatureAttribute.definition: Speed limit restriction inside national park.

FeatureAttribute.name: nearRailroadCrossing
FeatureAttribute.definition: Speed limit restriction near rail road crossing.

FeatureAttribute.name: trafficCalmingArea
FeatureAttribute.definition: Speed limit restriction in traffic calming area.

FeatureType.name: ERoad
FeatureType.definition: A collection of road link sequences and or individual road links that represents a route that is part of the international E-road network, characterized by its European route number.

constraint.name: All components belong to same transport network
constraint.description: A transport link set must be composed of transport links and or transport link sequences that all belong to the same transport network.
constraint.expression: inv: link->forAll(l | l.inNetwork = self.inNetwork)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport link sets have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: europeanRouteNumber
FeatureAttribute.definition: Code, identifying the route in the international E-road network.
The code always starts with a letter 'E', followed by a one-, two- or three-digit number.

FeatureType.name: FormOfRoadNodeValue
FeatureType.definition: Functions of road nodes within Euroroads.

FeatureAttribute.name: enclosedTrafficArea
FeatureAttribute.definition: The road node is situated inside and/or represents an enclosed traffic area.
A traffic area is an area with no internal structure of legally defined driving directions. At least two roads are connected to the area..

FeatureAttribute.name: junction
FeatureAttribute.definition: Three or more road links intersect at the road node.

FeatureAttribute.name: levelCrossing
FeatureAttribute.definition: A railway crosses a road on the same level at the position of the road node.

FeatureAttribute.name: pseudoNode
FeatureAttribute.definition: Exactly two road links connect to the road node.

FeatureAttribute.name: roadEnd
FeatureAttribute.definition: Only one road link connects to the road node. It signifies the end of a road.

FeatureAttribute.name: roundabout
FeatureAttribute.definition: The road node represents or is a part of a roundabout.

FeatureAttribute.name: trafficSquare
FeatureAttribute.definition: The road node is situated inside and/or represents a traffic square.
A traffic square is an area (partly) enclosed by roads which is used for non-traffic purposes and which is not a roundabout.

FeatureAttribute.name: roadServiceArea
FeatureAttribute.definition: Surface annexed to a road and devoted to offer particular services for it.
EXAMPLES Gas station, rest area, toll area.

FeatureType.name: FormOfWay
FeatureType.definition: A classification based on the physical properties of the Road Link.

constraint.name: Applies to road transport elements only
constraint.expression: /* This property can only be associated with a spatial object that is part of a road transport network. */ inv: networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(Road) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(ERoad) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadLink) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadLinkSequence) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadNode) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadServiceArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(VehicleTrafficArea)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: FormOfWayValue
FeatureType.definition: Classification based on the physical properties of the road link.

FeatureAttribute.name: bicycleRoad
FeatureAttribute.definition: Road where bicycles are the only vehicles allowed.

FeatureAttribute.name: dualCarriageway
FeatureAttribute.definition: Road with physically separated carriageways regardless of the number of lanes, which is not a motorway or a freeway.

FeatureAttribute.name: enclosedTrafficArea
FeatureAttribute.definition: Area with no internal structure of legally defined driving directions. At least two roads are connected to the area.

FeatureAttribute.name: entranceOrExitCarPark
FeatureAttribute.definition: Road specially designed to enter or to leave a parking area.

FeatureAttribute.name: entranceOrExitService
FeatureAttribute.definition: Road used only to enter or to leave a service.

FeatureAttribute.name: freeway
FeatureAttribute.definition: Road having no single level crossings with other roads.
NOTE This means that connections with other roads consist of slip roads.

FeatureAttribute.name: motorway
FeatureAttribute.definition: Road permitted for motorized vehicles only in combination with a prescribed minimum speed. It has two or more mostly physically separated carriageways and no single level-crossings.

FeatureAttribute.name: pedestrianZone
FeatureAttribute.definition: Area with a road network which is especially designed for use by pedestrians.

NOTE Pedestrian zones are usually located in urban areas. Except for emergency vehicles and for delivery vehicles during certain hours no traffic is allowed on the road network elements which are located inside the zone.
