FeatureAttribute.name: roundabout
FeatureAttribute.definition: Road which forms a ring on which traffic travelling in only one direction is allowed.
NOTE The Road elements which make up a roundabout are connected to one another and they form exactly one ring.

FeatureAttribute.name: serviceRoad
FeatureAttribute.definition: Road running parallel to and connecting to a road with a relatively high connectivity function, which is especially designed to enable access from the connecting roads to roads with a low connectivity function in its vicinity.
NOTE Generally, service roads have the same name as the higher class road it runs parallel to and are only divided from it by small constructions like walkways, traffic islands etc.

FeatureAttribute.name: singleCarriageway
FeatureAttribute.definition: Road where the traffic is not separated by any physical object.
NOTE All roads without separate carriageways are considered as roads with a single carriageway.

FeatureAttribute.name: slipRoad
FeatureAttribute.definition: Road especially designed to enter or leave a road.

FeatureAttribute.name: tractor
FeatureAttribute.definition: Arranged road only usable for a tractor (farm vehicle or forest machine) or terrain vehicle (a vehicle with higher ground clearance, big wheels and 4 wheel drive).

FeatureAttribute.name: trafficSquare
FeatureAttribute.definition: Area (partly) enclosed by roads which is used for non-traffic purposes and which is not a roundabout.

FeatureAttribute.name: walkway
FeatureAttribute.definition: Road reserved for pedestrian use and closed for regular vehicular use by a physically barrier.
NOTE Occasional use by (emergency) services may occur.

FeatureType.name: FunctionalRoadClass
FeatureType.definition: A classification based on the importance of the role that the road performs in the road network.

constraint.name: Applies to road transport elements only
constraint.expression: /* This property can only be associated with a spatial object that is part of a road transport network. */ inv: networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(Road) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(ERoad) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadLink) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadLinkSequence) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadNode) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadServiceArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(VehicleTrafficArea)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: functionalClass
FeatureAttribute.definition: Functional rank of the road link in the road network.

NOTE Where functional classification systems are used that have fewer classes/ranks than the number provided by FunctionalRoadClassValues, classes with codes 1 to n will be used, where n corresponds to the number of classes that are used in the classification system.

FeatureType.name: FunctionalRoadClassValue
FeatureType.definition: Values for the functional road classification. This classification is based on the importance of the role that the road performs in the road network.

FeatureAttribute.name: mainRoad
FeatureAttribute.definition: The most important roads in a given network.

FeatureAttribute.name: firstClass
FeatureAttribute.definition: The second most important roads in a given network.

FeatureAttribute.name: secondClass
FeatureAttribute.definition: The third most important roads in a given network.

FeatureAttribute.name: thirdClass
FeatureAttribute.definition: The fourth most important roads in a given network.

FeatureAttribute.name: fourthClass
FeatureAttribute.definition: The fifth most important roads in a given network.

FeatureAttribute.name: fifthClass
FeatureAttribute.definition: The sixth most important roads in a given network.

FeatureAttribute.name: sixthClass
FeatureAttribute.definition: The seventh most important roads in a given network.

FeatureAttribute.name: seventhClass
FeatureAttribute.definition: The eighth most important roads in a given network.

FeatureAttribute.name: eighthClass
FeatureAttribute.definition: The ninth most important roads in a given network.

FeatureAttribute.name: ninthClass
FeatureAttribute.definition: The least important roads in a given network.
NOTE The farthest ways in the forest road network. It has no regular maintenance. [NVDB] [Euroroads].

FeatureType.name: MinMaxLaneValue
FeatureType.definition: Values to indicate whether number of lanes are counted as the maximum, minimum or average number.

FeatureAttribute.name: maximum
FeatureAttribute.definition: The number of lanes is the maximum value for a given part of the road network.

FeatureAttribute.name: minimum
FeatureAttribute.definition: The number of lanes is the minimum value for a given part of the road network.

FeatureAttribute.name: average
FeatureAttribute.definition: The number of lanes is the average value for a given part of the road network.

FeatureType.name: NumberOfLanes
FeatureType.definition: The number of lanes of a road element.

constraint.name: Applies to road transport elements only
constraint.expression: /* This property can only be associated with a spatial object that is part of a road transport network. */ inv: networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(Road) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(ERoad) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadLink) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadLinkSequence) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadNode) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadServiceArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(VehicleTrafficArea)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: direction
FeatureAttribute.definition: Indicates which direction the number of lanes is valid for.
NOTE When the value for this attribute is 'both', numberOfLanes contains the sum of the number of lanes in both directions of travel.
NOTE This attribute only applies when the property is associated with a road link or road link sequence.

FeatureAttribute.name: minMaxNumberOfLanes
FeatureAttribute.definition: Indicates if the number of lanes is counted as minimum or maximum value.
NOTE This attribute only applies when the value in numberOfLanes is not an exact value.

FeatureType.name: Road
FeatureType.definition: A collection of road link sequences and/or individual road links that are characterized by one or more thematic identifiers and/or properties.
EXAMPLE Examples are roads characterized by a specific identification code, used by road management authorities or tourist routes, identified by a specific name.

constraint.name: All components belong to same transport network
constraint.description: A transport link set must be composed of transport links and or transport link sequences that all belong to the same transport network.
constraint.expression: inv: link->forAll(l | l.inNetwork = self.inNetwork)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport link sets have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: localRoadCode
FeatureAttribute.definition: Identification code assigned to the road by the local road authority.

FeatureAttribute.name: nationalRoadCode
FeatureAttribute.definition: The national number of the road.

FeatureType.name: RoadArea
FeatureType.definition: Surface which extends to the limits of a road, including vehicular areas and other parts of it.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport areas have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: RoadLink
FeatureType.definition: A linear spatial object that describes the geometry and connectivity of a road network between two points in the network.
Road links can represent paths, bicycle roads, single carriageways, multiple carriageway roads and even fictitious trajectories across traffic squares.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport links have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: RoadLinkSequence
FeatureType.definition: A linear spatial object, composed of an ordered collection of road links, which represents a continuous path in a road network without any branches. The element has a defined beginning and end and every position on the road link sequence is identifiable with one single parameter such as length. It describes an element of the road network, characterized by one or more thematic identifiers and/or properties.

constraint.name: All components belong to same transport network
constraint.description: A transport link sequence must be composed of transport links that all belong to the same transport network.
constraint.expression: inv: link->forAll(l | l.link.inNetwork = self.inNetwork)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport link sequences have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv: inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: RoadName
FeatureType.definition: Name of a road, as assigned by the responsible authority.

constraint.name: Applies to road transport elements only
constraint.expression: /* This property can only be associated with a spatial object that is part of a road transport network. */ inv: networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(Road) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(ERoad) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadLink) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadLinkSequence) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadNode) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadServiceArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(VehicleTrafficArea)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: RoadNode
FeatureType.definition: A point spatial object that is used to either represent connectivity between two road links or to represent a significant spatial object such as a services station or roundabout.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport nodes have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: formOfRoadNode
FeatureAttribute.definition: Description of the function of a road node in the road transport network.

FeatureType.name: RoadPartValue
FeatureType.definition: Indication to which part of a road the value of a measurement applies.

FeatureAttribute.name: carriageway
FeatureAttribute.definition: The part of a road which is reserved for traffic.

FeatureAttribute.name: pavedSurface
FeatureAttribute.definition: The part of the road which is paved.

FeatureType.name: RoadServiceArea
FeatureType.definition: Surface annexed to a road and devoted to offer particular services for it.
EXAMPLES Gas station, rest area, toll area.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport areas have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: RoadServiceType
FeatureType.definition: Description of the type of road service area and the available facilities.

constraint.name: Applies to road service areas only
All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: availableFacility
FeatureAttribute.definition: Facility that is available for a given road service area.

FeatureAttribute.name: busStation
FeatureAttribute.definition: The road service is a bus stop.

FeatureAttribute.name: parking
FeatureAttribute.definition: The road service areea is a parking facility.

FeatureAttribute.name: restArea
FeatureAttribute.definition: The road service is a rest area.

FeatureAttribute.name: toll
FeatureAttribute.definition: Area that provides toll services such as ticket dispensers or toll payment services.

FeatureType.name: RoadSurfaceCategory
FeatureType.definition: Specification of the state of the surface of the associated Road Element. Indicates whether a road is paved or unpaved.

constraint.name: Applies to road transport elements only
constraint.expression: /* This property can only be associated with a spatial object that is part of a road transport network. */ inv: networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(Road) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(ERoad) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadLink) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadLinkSequence) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadNode) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadServiceArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(VehicleTrafficArea)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureType.name: RoadSurfaceCategoryValue
FeatureType.definition: Values to indicate whether a road is paved or not paved.

FeatureAttribute.name: paved
FeatureAttribute.definition: Road with a hard paved surface.

FeatureType.name: RoadWidth
FeatureType.definition: The width of the road, measured as an average value.

constraint.name: Applies to road transport elements only
constraint.expression: /* This property can only be associated with a spatial object that is part of a road transport network. */ inv: networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(Road) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(ERoad) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadLink) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadLinkSequence) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadNode) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadServiceArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(VehicleTrafficArea)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: measuredRoadPart
FeatureAttribute.definition: Indicates to which part of a road the value for the attribute 'width' applies.

FeatureType.name: ServiceFacilityValue
FeatureType.definition: Possible service facilities available at a road service area.

FeatureType.name: SpeedLimit
FeatureType.definition: Limit for the speed of a vehicle on a road..

constraint.name: Applies to road transport elements only
constraint.expression: /* This property can only be associated with a spatial object that is part of a road transport network. */ inv: networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(Road) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(ERoad) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadLink) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadLinkSequence) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadNode) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(RoadServiceArea) or networkRef.element.oclIsKindOf(VehicleTrafficArea)

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport properties have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: areaCondition
FeatureAttribute.definition: Speed limit is dependent on environmental circumstances.

FeatureAttribute.name: direction
FeatureAttribute.definition: Indicates which direction the speed limit is valid for.
NOTE This attribute only applies when the property is associated with a road link or road link sequence.

FeatureAttribute.name: laneExtension
FeatureAttribute.definition: Number of lanes including the start lane counted from the right hand side for which the speed limit applies.
NOTE This attribute only applies when the property is associated with a road link or road link sequence.

FeatureAttribute.name: speedLimitMinMaxType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Indicates if the speed limit is maximum or minimum and if it is recommended.

FeatureAttribute.name: startLane
FeatureAttribute.definition: Start lane counted from the right side for which speed limit applies.
NOTE This attribute only applies when the property is associated with a road link or road link sequence.

FeatureAttribute.name: validityPeriod
FeatureAttribute.definition: Period during which the speed limit is valid.

FeatureAttribute.name: vehicleType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Vehicle type the speed limit is restricted to.

FeatureAttribute.name: weatherCondition
FeatureAttribute.definition: Weather condition the speed limit is dependent on.

FeatureType.name: SpeedLimitMinMaxValue
FeatureType.definition: Possible values to indicate the nature of a speed limit.

FeatureAttribute.name: maximum
FeatureAttribute.definition: Speed limit is a maximum value

FeatureAttribute.name: minimum
FeatureAttribute.definition: Speed limit is a minimum value

FeatureAttribute.name: recommendedMaximum
FeatureAttribute.definition: Speed limit is a recommended maximum value

FeatureAttribute.name: recommendedMinimum
FeatureAttribute.definition: Speed limit is a recommended minimum value

FeatureAttribute.name: fixedTrafficSign
FeatureAttribute.definition: Source is a fixed traffic sign (site specific administrative order, explicit speed limit).

FeatureAttribute.name: regulation
FeatureAttribute.definition: Source is a regulation (national regulation, rule or 'implicit speed limit').

FeatureAttribute.name: variableTrafficSign
FeatureAttribute.definition: Source is a variable traffic sign.

FeatureType.name: VehicleTrafficArea
FeatureType.definition: Surface that represents the part of a road which is used for the normal traffic of vehicles.

constraint.name: All objects have inspireId
constraint.description: All transport areas have an external object identifier.
constraint.expression: inv:inspireId->notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: carWithTrailer
FeatureAttribute.definition: A passenger car with an attached trailer.

FeatureAttribute.name: deliveryTruck
FeatureAttribute.definition: A truck vehicle of relatively small size, whose principal use is for delivery of goods and materials.

FeatureAttribute.name: emergencyVehicle
FeatureAttribute.definition: A vehicle engaged in emergency response, included but not limited to police, ambulance and fire.

FeatureAttribute.name: employeeVehicle
FeatureAttribute.definition: A vehicle operated by an employee of an organization that is used within that organization's ground.

FeatureAttribute.name: facilityVehicle
FeatureAttribute.definition: A vehicle dedicated to a localized area within a private or restricted estate.
EXAMPLE Facilities roads within an airport or theme park.

FeatureAttribute.name: farmVehicle
FeatureAttribute.definition: Vehicle commonly associated with farming activities.

FeatureAttribute.name: highOccupancyVehicle
FeatureAttribute.definition: Vehicle populated with a number of occupants corresponding to (or exceeding) the specified minimum number of passengers.

FeatureAttribute.name: lightRail
FeatureAttribute.definition: Train-like transport vehicle limited to a rail network within a limited area.
NOTE Does not include heavy rail lines.

FeatureAttribute.name: mailVehicle
FeatureAttribute.definition: A vehicle that collects, carries or delivers mail.

FeatureAttribute.name: militaryVehicle
FeatureAttribute.definition: Vehicle authorized by a military authority.

FeatureAttribute.name: moped
FeatureAttribute.definition: Two or three wheeled vehicle equipped with internal combustion engine, with size less than 50 cc and maximum speed that does not exceed 45 km/h (28mph).

FeatureAttribute.name: motorcycle
FeatureAttribute.definition: Two or three wheeled vehicle equipped with internal combustion engine, with size more than 50 cc and maximum speed that does exceed 45 km/h (28mph).

FeatureAttribute.name: passengerCar
FeatureAttribute.definition: A small vehicle designed for private transport of people.

FeatureAttribute.name: privateBus
FeatureAttribute.definition: A vehicle designed for transport of large groups of people, privately owned or chartered.

FeatureAttribute.name: publicBus
FeatureAttribute.definition: A vehicle designed for transport of large groups of people that is generally charterized by published routes and schedules.

FeatureAttribute.name: residentialVehicle
FeatureAttribute.definition: A vehicle whose owner is resident (or a guest) of particular street or town area.

FeatureAttribute.name: schoolBus
FeatureAttribute.definition: Vehicle operated on behalf of a school to transport students.

FeatureAttribute.name: snowChainEquippedVehicle
FeatureAttribute.definition: Any vehicle equipped with snow chains.

FeatureAttribute.name: tanker
FeatureAttribute.definition: A truck with more than two axels used to transport liquid loads in bulk.

FeatureAttribute.name: taxi
FeatureAttribute.definition: A vehicle licensed for hire usually fitted with a meter.

FeatureAttribute.name: transportTruck
FeatureAttribute.definition: A truck vehicle for long range transport of goods.

FeatureAttribute.name: trolleyBus
FeatureAttribute.definition: A bus-like mass transport vehicle hooked up to an electrical network for power supply.

FeatureAttribute.name: vehicleForDisabledPerson
FeatureAttribute.definition: A vehicle with supporting identification that designates a vehicle for disabled persons.

FeatureAttribute.name: vehicleWithOtherDangerousLoad
FeatureAttribute.definition: Vehicle transporting dangerous cargo, other than explosive or waterpollution loads.

FeatureType.name: WeatherConditionValue
FeatureType.definition: Values to indicate weather conditions that affect speed limits.

FeatureAttribute.name: fog
FeatureAttribute.definition: Speed applies when fog is present.

FeatureAttribute.name: ice
FeatureAttribute.definition: Speed applies when ice is present.

FeatureAttribute.name: rain
FeatureAttribute.definition: Speed applies when rain is present.

FeatureAttribute.name: smog
FeatureAttribute.definition: Speed applies when a certain amount of smog is present.

FeatureAttribute.name: snow
FeatureAttribute.definition: Speed applies when snow is present.

FeatureType.name: ElevationPropertyTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: Enumeration type which determines the elevation property which has been measured or calculated.

NOTE 1 An elevation property is a vertically-constrained dimensional property of an element consisting of an absolute measure referenced to a well-defined surface which is commonly taken as origin (geoid, water level, etc.).
NOTE 2 It does not include relative elevations of the element referenced to other spatial objects.

FeatureAttribute.name: height
FeatureAttribute.definition: Elevation property measured along a plumb line in a direction opposite to Earth's gravity field (upwards).
NOTE This definition intentionally avoids making reference to complex geodetic terms. It is only intended to specify the direction in which the elevation property has been measured.

FeatureAttribute.name: depth
FeatureAttribute.definition: Elevation property measured along a plumb line in a direction coincident to Earth's gravity field (downwards).
NOTE This definition intentionally avoids making reference to complex geodetic terms. It is only intended to specify the direction in which the elevation property has been measured.

FeatureType.name: SurfaceTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: Enumeration type which determines the elevation surface with regard to its relative adherence to the Earth's bare surface.

FeatureAttribute.name: DTM
FeatureAttribute.definition: EXAMPLE Buildings, bridges or vegetation do not form part of a DTM.
NOTE 1 For DTM surfaces describing the floor of water bodies (e.g. the sea-floor), the water bodies are not considered as part of the Earth's bare surface. Hence, they are excluded from the DTM.
NOTE 2 For DTM surfaces in which any features placed on the Earth's bare surface have not been totally filtered and excluded, the deviations must be explained in the metadata.

FeatureAttribute.name: DSM
FeatureAttribute.definition: EXAMPLE 1 Vegetation, buildings and bridges are examples of static features.
EXAMPLE 2 Cars, trucks and other dynamic features are examples of temporary phenomena.

NOTE 1 For DSM surfaces describing the floor of water bodies (e.g. the sea-floor) and those features placed on it, the water bodies are not considered as part of the Earth's bare surface. Hence, they are excluded from the DSM.
NOTE 2 For DSM surfaces in which any temporary phenomena have not been totally filtered and excluded, the deviations must be explained in the metadata.

FeatureType.name: ElevationGridCoverage
FeatureType.definition: Continuous coverage which uses a systematic tessellation based on a regular rectified quadrilateral grid to cover its domain, where the elevation property value is usually known for each of the grid points forming this domain.

constraint.name: domainDimensionIs2
constraint.expression: /* The grid dimension shall always be 2 for an elevation grid coverage */ inv: domainSet.dimension=2

constraint.name: domainExtentContainsGeographicElement
constraint.description: The domainExtent shall be at least populated with a subtype of EX_GeographicExtent
constraint.expression: inv: domainExtent.geographicElement->size()>=1

constraint.name: domainRequiresCRS
constraint.expression: /* The coordinate reference system used to reference the grid shall be provided */ inv: domainSet.origin.coordinateReferenceSystem->notEmpty

constraint.name: identicalOffsetVectorsWithinElevationCoverageAggregation
constraint.expression: /* All the ElevationGridCoverage instances to which an aggregated ElevationGridCoverage instance refers, shall share the same orientation of grid axes and the same grid spacing in each direction*/ Inv: contributingElevationCoverage->forAll(v | v.domainSet.offsetVectors = self.domainSet.offsetVectors)

constraint.name: originDimensionIs2
constraint.expression: /* The origin of the grid shall be described in two dimensions */ inv: domainSet.origin.dimension=2

constraint.name: rangeSetValuesAreOfTypeFloat
constraint.expression: /* The values in the range set shall be described by the Float type */ inv: rangeSet->forAll(v | v.oclIsKindOf(Float))

constraint.name: domainIsRectifiedGrid
constraint.description: The domain shall be a rectified grid.
constraint.expression: inv: domainSet.oclIsKindOf(CV_RectifiedGrid)

constraint.name: grid points shall coincide with grid cell centres
constraint.expression: /*Grid points of a RectifiedGridCoverage shall coincide with the centres of cells of the geographical grids defined in Section 2.2 of Annex II at any resolution level.*/

constraint.name: gridFunctionRequiresGridDomain
constraint.expression: /*The grid function shall only be valid for domains that are grids */ inv: coverageFunction.gridFunction.notEmpty() implies domainSet.oclIsKindOf(CV_Grid)

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: domainExtent
FeatureAttribute.definition: Extent of the spatiotemporal domain of the coverage.
NOTE 1 The data type EX_Extent, is defined in ISO 19103. Extents may be specified in both space and time.

NOTE 2 The domain extent shall be specified at least in space by using EX_BoundingPolygon, EX_GeographicBoundingBox or EX_GeographicDescription. The whole geographic extent of the elevation coverage is affected, including areas where grid points hold nil reason values.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.

NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: propertyType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Attribute determining the elevation property represented by the elevation grid coverage.

FeatureAttribute.name: surfaceType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Attribute indicating the type of elevation surface that the coverage describes in relation to the Earth's bare surface.

RelationshipRole.name: contributingElevationGridCoverage
RelationshipRole.definition: Reference to the elevation grid coverages that compose an aggregated elevation grid coverage.
The association has additional properties as defined in the association class ElevationGridCoverageAggregation.

FeatureType.name: ElevationGridCoverageAggregation
FeatureType.definition: Geometrical characteristics of the elevation grid coverage aggregation.

FeatureAttribute.name: contributingFootprint
FeatureAttribute.definition: Multi polygon delineating the geographic area of the elevation grid coverage that contributes to the aggregated elevation grid coverage.

FeatureType.name: BreakLine
FeatureType.definition: A line of a critical nature which describes the shape of an elevation surface and indicates a discontinuity in the slope of the surface (i.e. an abrupt change in gradient). Triangles included within a TIN model must never cross it.
Breaklines represent local ridges or depressions (streams or drainage lines) in the surface, man-made structures (e.g. roads), etc.
NOTE 1 A breakline connects points with different elevation and therefore its description using 2.5-D coordinates (using the 'geometry' attribute) is fully recommended.
NOTE 2 No triangle in a TIN may cross a breakline (in other words, breakline segments are enforced as triangle edges), even if doing so violates the triangulation criterion.
NOTE 3 All breaklines are located on the ground surface or on any of the artificial structures built on it.
NOTE 4 Breaklines are useful as input data for the generation of a more appropriate or accurate digital elevation model by using interpolation methods.

FeatureAttribute.name: breakLineType
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of break line with regard the natural or man-made real world characteristic it represents, or the specific function it has in calculating a Digital Elevation Model (DEM).

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Represents the geometric properties of the spatial object.

FeatureAttribute.name: manMadeBreak
FeatureAttribute.definition: Line which represents an elevation break due to an artificial or man-made construction present on the terrain.

FeatureType.name: BreakLineTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: List of possible type values for break lines based on the physical characteristics of the break line [in the elevation surface].

FeatureType.name: ChartDatum
FeatureType.definition: Local vertical coordinate reference system which is used to refer and portray depth measurements as property values.

NOTE This data type is intended to describe the main characteristics of a vertical CRS for measurement of depths in cases where this information is rarely or not available through a CRS registry (e.g. like EPSG).
EXAMPLE Local datums for referring depths in lakes and navigable rivers.

FeatureAttribute.name: datumWaterLevel
FeatureAttribute.definition: Water level determining the origin of depth measurements for the chart datum.
EXAMPLE High water, low water, etc.
NOTE 1 Values in the code list are applicable either for sea or inland waters.

NOTE 2 When defining a depth datum for inland waters, it is recommended the use of "highWater", "lowWater" or "meanWaterLevel" - as applicable. All the other levels in the code list are well defined but usually just locally and do not serve for cross border purposes.

FeatureAttribute.name: offset
FeatureAttribute.definition: Relative difference between the height of each reference point and the height of the water level determining the chart datum.
NOTE 1 In order to calculate the offset parameter, the height(s) of the reference point(s) and the height of the water level determining the chart datum must be compared in the same vertical CRS.
NOTE 2 When a single reference point is provided, the offset parameter is supposed to be zero (by default). If this condition is true, there is no need to inform the offset parameter.

NOTE 3 When a set of reference points is provided, an individual offset parameter shall be provided for each of these points. The multiplicity between both properties - "referencePoint" and "offset" - is ordered with the aim to maintain this correspondence.

FeatureAttribute.name: referencePoint
FeatureAttribute.definition: - Case A: a single point which is used to refer depth values within the geographical scope of the chart datum.
- Case B: a set of points where water level measurements are performed to determine the water level of the chart datum.
NOTE 1 The altimetric position of each reference point must be its height in a common vertical CRS:
- in EVRS within its geographical scope (continental Europe).
- in a vertical CRS identified and documented by the Member State concerned, outside the geographical scope of EVRS (overseas territories).

NOTE 2 In Case A - The altimetric position of the reference point can be directly utilised as input to calculate approximate heights in a common vertical CRS for those vector objects whose depth values are referred to the chart datum.

NOTE 3 In Case B - The altimetric positions of the reference points can be utilised, together with the respective offset parameter, as input to calculate approximate heights in a common vertical CRS for those vector objects whose depth values are referred to the water level of the chart datum.
NOTE 4 The common vertical CRS mentioned in Note 2 and Note 3 shall be the one determined by Note 1.

FeatureAttribute.name: scope
FeatureAttribute.definition: Geographic scope in which the local depth datum is practically used.
NOTE Chart datums should only be used to refer and portray depths at local level, since they are determined by a local water level.
EXAMPLE 1 Lake or part of a lake in which a specific water level is used as depth datum.
EXAMPLE 2 River section in which a specific water level is used as depth datum.
EXAMPLE 3 Extent of the sea area in which a specific local tide level is used as depth datum.

FeatureType.name: ContourLine
FeatureType.definition: Linear spatial object composed of a set of adjoining locations characterized by having the same elevation property value. It describes, together with other contour lines present in the area, the local morphology of the Earth's surface.
NOTE 1 The attribute propertyType is equal to 'height' in the case of contour lines and it is equal to 'depth' in the case of depth contours.

constraint.name: propertyValueDimensionIs1
constraint.description: The dimension of the property value coordinate shall be 1
constraint.expression: inv: propertyValue.dimension=1

constraint.name: propertyValueIsReferredToVerticalCRS
constraint.expression: /*The property value shall be expressed referring to a vertical coordinate reference system*/ inv: propertyValue.coordinateReferenceSystem.oclIsKindOf(SC_VerticalCRS)

FeatureAttribute.name: contourLineType
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of contour line with regard to the normal contour vertical interval (if any).
NOTE This attribute is often applicable to contour lines describing the relief of a land-based area. For depth contours describing the floor of a water body is not always applicable.

FeatureAttribute.name: downRight
FeatureAttribute.definition: Property indicating that the contour line spatial object is digitized in a way that the height of the elevation surface is lower at the right side of the line.
NOTE 1 In the case of contour lines, when the downRight attribute is 'true' this indicates that the height of the surface is lower at the right side of the line.
NOTE 2 In the case of depth contours, when the downRight attribute is 'true' this indicates that the depth of the surface is higher at the right side of the line.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Represents the geometric properties of the spatial object.

FeatureAttribute.name: propertyValue
FeatureAttribute.definition: Value of the elevation property of the spatial object referred to a specific vertical coordinate reference system.

FeatureType.name: ContourLineTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: List of possible categories of contour lines based on the equidistance parameter of the data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: master
FeatureAttribute.definition: Contour at a vertical distance which is multiple to the equidistance parameter (corresponding to a certain multiple of the normal contour vertical interval) associated with the nominal scale.

FeatureAttribute.name: ordinary
FeatureAttribute.definition: Contour at the equidistance parameter (corresponding to the normal contour vertical interval) associated with the nominal scale, and which is not a master contour.

FeatureAttribute.name: auxiliary
FeatureAttribute.definition: A supplementary contour – not corresponding to the normal contour vertical interval – estimated or interpolated from surrounding contours, used in areas where there is insufficient height information for elevation mapping purposes or to control the creation of a digital elevation model.
NOTE This term is equivalent to the value 'intermediate' used in some Member States.

FeatureType.name: ElevationVectorObject
FeatureType.definition: Elevation spatial object forming part of a vector data set, which participates in the description of the elevation property of a real world surface. It consists of an identity base for all vector objects which can be included as part of an elevation data set.
It is an abstract feature type which generically describes every possible type of elevation vector object. It includes common attributes, properties and constraints for such spatial objects.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: localDepthDatum
FeatureAttribute.definition: Identification of a local vertical coordinate reference system not included in a registry, which is used to refer depth measurements.
NOTE This data type is applicable only to bathymetric vector objects.
EXAMPLE Local datums for referring depths in lakes and navigable rivers.

FeatureAttribute.name: propertyType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Attribute categorizing the elevation vector object as a land-elevation or a bathymetry spatial object. It determines the elevation property represented by the object.

FeatureType.name: IsolatedArea
FeatureType.definition: Delimitation of an area of the Earth's surface where an isolated part of the elevation model exists. Its outside surroundings have no elevation information.
NOTE 1 It includes the delimitation of any island of elevation data which are isolated from the main DEM. They may be included inside void areas.
NOTE 2 Isolated areas can be useful as masks when calculating a more appropriate or accurate DEM.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Represents the geometric properties of the spatial object.

FeatureType.name: SpotElevation
FeatureType.definition: Point spatial object which describes the elevation of an Earth's surface at a specific location. It provides a single elevation property value.
NOTE 1 It often represents a singular point in the morphology of a land or water body's floor surface.
NOTE 2 The attribute propertyType is equal to 'height' in the case of spot heights. It is equal to 'depth' in the case of spot depths.

constraint.name: propertyValueDimensionIs1
constraint.description: The dimension of the property value coordinate shall be 1
constraint.expression: inv: propertyValue.dimension=1

constraint.name: propertyValueIsReferredToVerticalCRS
constraint.expression: /*The property value shall be expressed referring to a vertical coordinate reference system*/ inv: propertyValue.coordinateReferenceSystem.oclIsKindOf(SC_VerticalCRS)

FeatureAttribute.name: classification
FeatureAttribute.definition: Class of spot elevation according to the LAS specification of the American Society for Photogrammetry and Remote Sensing (ASPRS).

FeatureAttribute.name: geographicalName
FeatureAttribute.definition: A geographical name that is used to identify a named land or water body's floor location in the real world, which is represented by the spot elevation spatial object.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Represents the geometric properties of the spatial object.

FeatureAttribute.name: propertyValue
FeatureAttribute.definition: Value of the elevation property of the spatial object referred to a specific vertical coordinate reference system.

FeatureType.name: SpotElevationClassValue
FeatureType.definition: Possible classification values for spot elevations based on the LAS specification maintained by the American Society for Photogrammetry and Remote Sensing (ASPRS).
NOTE These classes are proposed regardless of the adquisition method of the spot elevation. They correspond to the ASPRS Standard LIDAR Point Classes.

FeatureType.name: SpotElevationTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: Possible values for spot elevation points that describe a singularity of the surface.

FeatureType.name: VoidArea
FeatureType.definition: Area of the Earth's surface where the elevation model is unknown because of missing input data. This area shall be excluded from a DEM.
NOTE 1 A void area may contain a number of isolated areas with elevation data. These are considered as holes of the container void area.
NOTE 2 Void areas can be useful as masks when calculating a more appropriate or accurate DEM.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Represents the geometric properties of the spatial object.

FeatureType.name: AnthropogenicGeomorphologicFeature
FeatureType.definition: A geomorphologic feature (ie, landform) which has been created by human activity.
EXAMPLE: dredged channel, midden, open pit, reclaimed land.

FeatureAttribute.name: anthropogenicGeomorphologicFeatureType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Terms describing the type of a geomorphologic feature.

FeatureType.name: AnthropogenicGeomorphologicFeatureTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: The types of anthropogenic geomorphologic feature.

FeatureType.name: Borehole
FeatureType.definition: A borehole is the generalized term for any narrow shaft drilled in the ground.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.

FeatureAttribute.name: downholeGeometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: The downhole geometry of the borehole

FeatureAttribute.name: boreholeLength
FeatureAttribute.definition: This will be determined by the data provider (ie, "length" can have different sources, like drillers measurement, loggers measurement, survey).

FeatureAttribute.name: elevation
FeatureAttribute.definition: The vertical height above datum of the borehole collar.

This is a compromise approach to supply elevation explictly for location; this is to allow for software that cannot process 3-D GM_Point. Use null if elevation is unknown. Direct position shall have a dimension of 1, and CRS will be a "vertical" CRS (e.g. EPSG CRSs in the range 5600-5799).

FeatureAttribute.name: location
FeatureAttribute.definition: The location of the borehole collar.

FeatureAttribute.name: purpose
FeatureAttribute.definition: The purpose for which the borehole was drilled.
EXAMPLE: site investigation, mineral exploration, hydrocarbon exploration, water resources.

RelationshipRole.name: logElement
RelationshipRole.definition: 1-D MappedFeature instances that are logged (interpreted) intervals within a borehole.

FeatureType.name: BoreholePurposeValue
FeatureType.definition: Purposes for which a borehole was drilled.
EXAMPLE: mineral exploration, water pumping, site evaluation, stratigraphic research, etc.

FeatureType.name: CollectionTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: Types of collections of geological and geophysical objects.
EXAMPLE: geological map, thematic map etc.

FeatureType.name: CompositionPart
FeatureType.definition: The composition of a geologic unit in terms of lithological constituents.

FeatureAttribute.name: material
FeatureAttribute.definition: The material that comprises part or all of the geologic unit.
This refers to a vocabulary of lithological terms.

FeatureAttribute.name: proportion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Quantity that specifies the fraction of the geologic unit composed of the material.

FeatureAttribute.name: role
FeatureAttribute.definition: The relationship of the composition part to the geologic unit composition as a whole.
EXAMPLE: vein, interbedded constituent, layers, dominant constituent.

FeatureType.name: CompositionPartRoleValue
FeatureType.definition: Roles that a compositional part plays in a geologic unit.

FeatureType.name: EventEnvironmentValue
FeatureType.definition: Terms for the geologic environments within which geologic events take place.

FeatureType.name: EventProcessValue
FeatureType.definition: Terms specifying the process or processes that occurred during an event.

FeatureType.name: FaultTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: Terms describing the type of shear displacement structure.
EXAMPLE: thrust fault, normal fault, wrench fault.

FeatureType.name: Fold
FeatureType.definition: One or more systematically curved layers, surfaces, or lines in a rock body.

A fold denotes a structure formed by the deformation of a Geologic Structure to form a structure that may be described by the translation of an abstract line (the fold axis) parallel to itself along some curvilinear path (the fold profile). Folds have a hinge zone (zone of maximum curvature along the surface) and limbs (parts of the deformed surface not in the hinge zone).

FeatureAttribute.name: profileType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Folds are typed according to the concave/convex geometry of the fold relative to the earth surface, and the relationship to younging direction in folded strata if known.
EXAMPLE: antiform, synform, anticline, syncline, etc.

FeatureType.name: FoldProfileTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: Terms specifying the type of fold.
Folds are typed according to the concave/convex geometry of the fold relative to the earth surface, and the relationship to younging direction in folded strata if known.
EXAMPLE: antiform, synform, anticline, syncline, etc.

FeatureType.name: GeochronologicEraValue
FeatureType.definition: Terms specifying recognised geological time units.

FeatureType.name: GeologicCollection
FeatureType.definition: A collection of geological or geophysical objects.
Geologic objects are commonly grouped into collections such as geological maps, thematic maps, or the required input to a geological model.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.

FeatureAttribute.name: collectionType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Refers to a vocabulary of types.
EXAMPLE: geological map, thematic map etc.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

RelationshipRole.name: mapMember
RelationshipRole.definition: A Mapped Feature member of a Geologic Collection.
Association that allows MappedFeature objects to be included as members in a GML Collection, through the use of the GeologicCollection class.

RelationshipRole.name: geophObjectSet
RelationshipRole.definition: A GeophObjectSet member of a Geologic Collection.

RelationshipRole.name: geophObjectMember
RelationshipRole.definition: A GeophObject member of a Geologic Collection.

RelationshipRole.name: boreholeMember
RelationshipRole.definition: A Borehole member of a Geologic Collection.
Association that allows Borehole objects to be included as members in a GML Collection, through the use of the GeologicCollection class.

FeatureType.name: GeologicEvent
FeatureType.definition: An identifiable event during which one or more geological processes act to modify geological entities.

A GeologicEvent should have a specified geologic age and process, and may have a specified environment. An example might be a cratonic uplift event during which erosion, sedimentation, and volcanism all take place. A GeologicEvent age can represent an instant in time or an interval of time.

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.definition: The name of the Geologic Event.
Only major Geologic Events, such as orogenies, are likely to have names.

FeatureAttribute.name: eventEnvironment
FeatureAttribute.definition: The physical setting within which the geologic event takes place.

GeologicEnvironment is construed broadly to include physical settings on the Earth surface specified by climate, tectonics, physiography or geography, and settings in the Earth’s interior specified by pressure, temperature, chemical environment, or tectonics.

FeatureAttribute.name: eventProcess
FeatureAttribute.definition: The process or processes that occurred during the geologic event.

FeatureAttribute.name: olderNamedAge
FeatureAttribute.definition: Older boundary of the age of the event.
This is expressed using a geochronologic era defined in a vocabulary of recognised units, such as those of the International Commission on Stratigraphy (ICS) Stratigraphic Chart.

FeatureAttribute.name: youngerNamedAge
FeatureAttribute.definition: Younger boundary of the age of the event.
This is expressed using a geochronologic era defined in a vocabulary of recognised units, such as those of the International Commission on Stratigraphy (ICS) Stratigraphic Chart.

FeatureType.name: GeologicFeature
FeatureType.definition: A conceptual geological feature that is hypothesized to exist coherently in the world.
This corresponds with a "legend item" from a traditional geologic map. While the bounding coordinates of a Geologic Feature may be described, its shape is not.
The implemented Geologic Feature instance acts as the "description package"

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.definition: The name of the geologic feature.
EXAMPLE: a lithostratigraphic unit, mineral occurrence, or major fault.
Not all GeologicFeatures will have names, for example minor faults.

RelationshipRole.name: geologicHistory
RelationshipRole.definition: An association that relates one or more geologic events to a geologic feature to describe their age or geologic history.

RelationshipRole.name: themeClass
RelationshipRole.definition: A thematic classification of the geologic feature.
A GeologicFeature may be classified according to one or more thematic schema, for example ground stability or mineral resource potential.

FeatureType.name: GeologicStructure
FeatureType.definition: A configuration of matter in the Earth based on describable inhomogeneity, pattern, or fracture in an earth material.
The identity of a GeologicStructure is independent of the material that is the substrate for the structure.

FeatureType.name: GeologicUnit
FeatureType.definition: A volume of rock with distinct characteristics.

Includes both formal units (i.e. formally adopted and named in an official lexicon) and informal units (i.e. named but not promoted to the lexicon) and unnamed units (i.e. recognisable and described and delineable in the field but not otherwise formalised).
Spatial properties are only available through association with a MappedFeature.

FeatureAttribute.name: geologicUnitType
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of geological the unit.
Logical constraints of definition of unit and valid property cardinalities should be contained in the definition.

RelationshipRole.name: composition
RelationshipRole.definition: Describes the composition of the geologic unit.

FeatureType.name: GeologicUnitTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: Terms describing the type of geologic unit.

FeatureType.name: GeomorphologicActivityValue
FeatureType.definition: Terms indicating the level of activity of a geomorphologic feature.

FeatureType.name: GeomorphologicFeature
FeatureType.definition: An abstract spatial object type describing the shape and nature of the Earth's land surface (ie, a landform).

These landforms may be created by natural Earth processes (eg, river channel, beach, moraine, mountain) or through human (anthropogenic) activity (eg, dredged channel, reclaimed land, mine waste dumps).

FeatureType.name: MappedFeature
FeatureType.definition: A spatial representation of a GeologicFeature.
A MappedFeature is part of a geological interpretation.

It provides a link between a notional feature (description package) and one spatial representation of it, or part of it (exposures, surface traces and intercepts, etc) which forms the specific bounded occurrence, such as an outcrop or map polygon.

FeatureAttribute.name: shape
FeatureAttribute.definition: The geometry of the mapped feature.

FeatureAttribute.name: mappingFrame
FeatureAttribute.definition: The surface on which the mapped feature is projected.
EXAMPLE: Topographic surface, Bedrock surface, Base of Permian

RelationshipRole.name: specification
RelationshipRole.definition: A description association that links a mapped feature to a notional geologic feature.

A geologic feature, such as a geologic unit may be linked to mapped features from a number of different maps. A mapped feature, however is always associated with only a single description (geologic feature).

FeatureType.name: MappedInterval
FeatureType.definition: A special kind of mapped feature whose shape is a 1-D interval and which uses the SRS of the containing borehole.

FeatureType.name: MappingFrameValue
FeatureType.definition: Terms indicating the surface on which the MappedFeature is projected.

FeatureType.name: NaturalGeomorphologicFeature
FeatureType.definition: A geomorphologic feature (ie, landform) that has been created by natural Earth processes.
EXAMPLE: river channel, beach ridge, caldera, canyon, moraine, mud flat.

FeatureAttribute.name: naturalGeomorphologicFeatureType
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of the natural geomorphologic feature.

FeatureAttribute.name: activity
FeatureAttribute.definition: The level of activity of the natural geomorphologic feature.

FeatureType.name: NaturalGeomorphologicFeatureTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: Terms describing the type of natural geomorphologic feature.

FeatureType.name: ShearDisplacementStructure
FeatureType.definition: Brittle to ductile style structures along which displacement has occurred.
These range from from a simple, single 'planar' brittle or ductile surface to a fault system comprised of tens of strands of both brittle and ductile nature.

FeatureAttribute.name: faultType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Refers to a vocabulary of terms describing the type of shear displacement structure.
EXAMPLE: thrust fault, normal fault, wrench fault.

FeatureType.name: ThematicClass
FeatureType.definition: A generic thematic classifier to enable the reclassification of Geologic Features with user defined classes appropriate to thematic maps.
This datatype allows Geologic Features to be classified against thematic classes. This provides a generic means of delivering geological thematic map data.

FeatureAttribute.name: themeClass
FeatureAttribute.definition: The value of the thematic class.
The thematic class value should be constrained by a codelist of defined terms, but these will commonly be specific to a particular thematic map.

FeatureType.name: ThematicClassValue
FeatureType.definition: Values for thematic classification of geologic features.

FeatureType.name: ThematicClassificationValue
FeatureType.definition: List of thematic classifications for geologic features.

FeatureType.name: ActiveWell
FeatureType.definition: A well influencing the groundwater resources of the aquifer.
The most common examples of Active Well are: extracting, artificial recharging, or dewatering wells.
NOTE: ActiveWell by extracting, recharging or dewatering influences and changes the state of groundwater resources.

FeatureAttribute.name: activityType
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of activity carried out by the well.
Indicates if the well is used for extracting, recharging, dewatering etc of the groundwater resources.

RelationshipRole.name: borehole
RelationshipRole.definition: The Borehole upon which the ActiveWell is based.

RelationshipRole.name: groundWaterBody
RelationshipRole.definition: The GroundWaterBody from which the ActiveWell extracts groundwater resources.

RelationshipRole.name: environmentalMonitoringFacility
RelationshipRole.definition: Groundwater ObservationWell is a monitoring object.

FeatureType.name: Aquiclude
FeatureType.definition: An impermeable body of rock or stratum of sediment that acts as a barrier to the flow of groundwater.

A formation which, although porous and capable of absorbing water slowly, will not transmit water fast enough to furnish an appreciable supply for a well or spring. Aquicludes are characterized by very low values of "leakage" (the ratio of vertical Hydraulic Conductivity to thickness), so that they transmit only minor inter-aquifer flow and also have very low rates of yield from compressible storage. Therefore, they constitute boundaries of aquifer flow systems.

FeatureType.name: Aquifer
FeatureType.definition: A wet underground layer of water-bearing permeable rock or unconsolidated materials (gravel, sand, silt, or clay) from which groundwater can be usefully extracted using a water well.
An underground geological formation able to store and yield water.

FeatureAttribute.name: aquiferType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Water in an Aquifer is, or is not, under pressure. Based on that unconfined, confined, artesian, or subartesian types are distinguished.

FeatureAttribute.name: mediaType
FeatureAttribute.definition: The classification of the medium in which the groundwater flow occurs.

FeatureAttribute.name: isExploited
FeatureAttribute.definition: Indicates if groundwater from aquifer is exploited by wells or intakes

FeatureAttribute.name: isMainInSystem
FeatureAttribute.definition: Indicates if aquifer is the main useful aquifer in the aquifer system

FeatureAttribute.name: vulnerabilityToPollution
FeatureAttribute.definition: An index value or interval of values determining the potential degree of aquifer risk arising from the geological structure, hydrogeological conditions and the existence of real or potential source of contamination.

A single value should be used if it is determined directly from the DRASTIC method. If attribute data comes from another data source which is expressed by categorized items, for example: low, moderate or high, interval should be used expressed by lowest and highest value of category. EXAMPLE: ‘Moderate’ means interval from 101 to 140.

FeatureAttribute.name: permeabilityCoefficient
FeatureAttribute.definition: The volume of an incompressible fluid that will flow in unit time through a unit cube of a porous substance across which a unit pressure difference is maintained.

The parameter represents the hydraulic conductivity of a rock container. Describes the ease with which water can move through pore spaces or fractures. It depends on the intrinsic permeability of the material and on the degree of saturation.
NOTE: Because of their high porosity and permeability, sand and gravel have higher hydraulic conductivity than clay or unfractured granite aquifers.

FeatureAttribute.name: storativityCoefficient
FeatureAttribute.definition: The ability of an aquifer to store water.

FeatureAttribute.name: hydroGeochemicalRockType
FeatureAttribute.definition: The rock type with respect to the soluble rock components and their hydrogeochemical influence of groundwater.
Defines the prevailing geochemical character of natural groundwater within the Aquifer.

RelationshipRole.name: aquitard
RelationshipRole.definition: The Aquitard(s) that separates the Aquifer.

RelationshipRole.name: hydrogeologicalObject
RelationshipRole.definition: The HydrogeologicalObject(s) related to the aquifer.

RelationshipRole.name: aquiferSystem
RelationshipRole.definition: The specific AquiferSystem where the Aquitard occurs.

FeatureType.name: AquiferMediaTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: Values describing the characteristics of the aquifer medium.

FeatureType.name: AquiferSystem
FeatureType.definition: A collection of aquifers and aquitards, which together constitute the environment of groundwater - "communicating vessels", that are filled or can be filled with water.
Attributes of Aquifer System and its components determine the feasibility of water collection, its movement, as well as the impact on its chemical state.
NOTE: The Aquifer System components and their attributes (including geometry) are relatively stable over time except in special cases.

FeatureAttribute.name: isLayered
FeatureAttribute.definition: Indicates if the AquiferSystem consists of more than one layer.

RelationshipRole.name: aquifer
RelationshipRole.definition: The Aquifer(s) contained in the AquiferSystem.

RelationshipRole.name: aquiclude
RelationshipRole.definition: This acts as a barrier for groundwater flow.

RelationshipRole.name: aquitard
RelationshipRole.definition: The Aquitard(s) contained within the AquiferSystem.

FeatureType.name: Aquitard
FeatureType.definition: A saturated, but poorly permeable bed that impedes groundwater movement.

It does not yield water freely to wells, but may transmit appreciable water to or from adjacent aquifers and, where sufficiently thick, may constitute an important ground-water storage unit. Aquitards are characterized by values of leakance that may range from relatively low to relatively high. A really extensive aquitard of relatively low leakance may function regionally as boundaries of aquifer flow systems.

FeatureAttribute.name: approximatePermeabilityCoefficient
FeatureAttribute.definition: The volume of an incompressible fluid that will flow in unit time through a unit cube of a porous substance across which a unit pressure difference is maintained.

The parameter represents the hydraulic conductivity of a rock container. Describes the ease with which water can move through pore spaces or fractures. It depends on the intrinsic permeability of the material and on the degree of saturation.
NOTE: Because of their high porosity and permeability, sand and gravel have higher hydraulic conductivity than clay or unfractured granite aquifers.

FeatureAttribute.name: approximateStorativityCoefficient
FeatureAttribute.definition: The ability of an aquifer to store water.

RelationshipRole.name: aquifer
RelationshipRole.definition: The Aquifers separated by the Aquitard.

RelationshipRole.name: aquiferSystem
RelationshipRole.definition: The AquiferSystem of which the Aquitard is a part.

FeatureType.name: ConditionOfGroundwaterValue
FeatureType.definition: Values indicating the approximate degree of change which has taken place on the natural state of groundwater.
The groundwater in a GroundWaterFlowSystem is in a variable condition, dependent on external factors, among which are diverse human activities.

FeatureType.name: GroundWaterBody
FeatureType.definition: A distinct volume of groundwater within an aquifer or system of aquifers, which is hydraulically isolated from nearby groundwater bodies.

Groundwater bodies form the principal management units under the European Water Framework Directive (2000/60/CE, 2000). They should be hydraulically continuous entities, and must be defined on the basis of flow or abstraction, and are inextricably linked to surface water bodies.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.

NOTE: An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: approximateHorizontalExtend
FeatureAttribute.definition: The geometry defining the boundary of the GroundWaterBody.

FeatureAttribute.name: conditionOfGroundWaterBody
FeatureAttribute.definition: The approximate degree of change to groundwater as a result of human activity.

FeatureAttribute.name: mineralization
FeatureAttribute.definition: One of the main chemical characteristics of water. A value is a sum of all water chemical concentration components.

FeatureAttribute.name: piezometricState
FeatureAttribute.definition: Specifies the piezometric state of the GroundwaterBody water table

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

RelationshipRole.name: hydrogeologicalObjectNatural
RelationshipRole.definition: A HydrogeologicalObjectNatural interacting with the GroundwaterBody.

RelationshipRole.name: activeWell
RelationshipRole.definition: The ActiveWell which changes the state of the GroundwaterBody through the extraction of groundwater resources.
ActiveWell by extracting groundwater resources influences the state of GroundWaterBody resources it is installed in.

RelationshipRole.name: aquiferSystem
RelationshipRole.definition: The AquiferSystem which includes the GroundWaterBody.

RelationshipRole.name: observationWell
RelationshipRole.definition: The observation wells which monitor the GroundWaterBody

FeatureType.name: HydroGeochemicalRockTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: Values describing the hydrogeochemical condition of the groundwater environment.

FeatureType.name: HydrogeologicalObject
FeatureType.definition: An abstract class for man-made facilities or natural features that have an interaction with the hydrogeological system.
Hydrogeological objects may be natural (eg. spring) or the manmade (eg. wells). The vast majority of hydrogeological objects are manmade.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.

NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: The geometry defining the spatial location of the HydrogeologicalObject.

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.definition: The name or code of the HydrogeologicalObject.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

RelationshipRole.name: aquifer
RelationshipRole.definition: The Aquifer within which the HydrogeologicalObject occurs.

FeatureType.name: HydrogeologicalObjectManMade
FeatureType.definition: Examples of manmade hydrogeological objects are: well, groundwater intake, groundwater monitoring station or monitoring well.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: Official date and time the hydrogeological object was/will be legally established.
NOTE This is the date and time the register reference can be used in legal acts.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which the hydrogeological object legally ceased/will cease to be used.
NOTE This is the date and time the register reference can no longer be used in legal acts.

FeatureAttribute.name: statusCode
FeatureAttribute.definition: A code defining the formal status of a man-made hydrogeological object.

FeatureType.name: HydrogeologicalObjectNatural
FeatureType.definition: HydrogeologicalObject which was created by natural processes.
Examples of natural hydrogeological objects are: a source, vanishing point and geyser.

FeatureAttribute.name: naturalObjectType
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of natural hydrogeological object.

FeatureAttribute.name: waterPersistence
FeatureAttribute.definition: The degree of persistence of water flow.

FeatureAttribute.name: approximateQuantityOfFlow
FeatureAttribute.definition: An approximate value defining the water yield in a natural hydrogeological object.
The discharge of water flow for a certain cross-section per time unit.

RelationshipRole.name: groundWaterBody
RelationshipRole.definition: The GroundWateBody with which the natural hydrogeological object interacts.

FeatureType.name: HydrogeologicalSurface
FeatureType.definition: A surface that represents the interpolated groundwater table, or other surface, for a local or regional area.
This is the 2.5D geometry for hydrogeological surfaces and is based on hydrogeological measurements in a group of wells or other sources of data.

FeatureAttribute.name: surfaceRectifiedGrid
FeatureAttribute.definition: A surface whose domain is a rectified grid.

A rectified grid is a grid for which there is an affine transformation between the grid coordinates and the coordinates of a coordinate system. It can be used for both discrete and continuous coverages.

FeatureAttribute.name: surfaceReferencableGrid
FeatureAttribute.definition: Surface whose domain consists of a referenceable grid.

A referenceable grid is a grid associated with a transformation that can be used to convert grid coordinate values to values of coordinates referenced to a coordinate reference system. It can be used for both discrete and continuous coverages.

FeatureAttribute.name: surfacePointCollection
FeatureAttribute.definition: Hydrogeological surface represented by collection of observations in points.

FeatureType.name: HydrogeologicalUnit
FeatureType.definition: A part of the lithosphere with distinctive parameters for water storage and conduction.

FeatureAttribute.name: approximateDepth
FeatureAttribute.definition: The approximate depth of the HydrogeologicalUnit occurrence.

FeatureAttribute.name: approximateThickness
FeatureAttribute.definition: The approximate thickness of the HydrogeologicalUnit.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

RelationshipRole.name: geologicStructure
RelationshipRole.definition: Relates one or many HydrogeologicalUnit(s) to a GeologicStructure.
Allows the description of groundwater occurrence in geological structures.

FeatureType.name: PiezometricState
FeatureType.definition: The piezometric state of a GroundWaterBody
Groundwater state (level) as a surface. It can be a set of point observations or interpolated to form a coverage.

FeatureAttribute.name: observationTime
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time of groundwater state observation.

FeatureAttribute.name: piezometricSurface
FeatureAttribute.definition: A surface that represents the level to which water will rise in tightly cased wells.
If the head varies significantly with depth in the aquifer, then there may be more than one potentiometric surface. The water table is a particular potentiometric surface for an unconfined aquifer.

FeatureType.name: QuantityValue
FeatureType.definition: Data container with a single quantity value or a range of quantity values .

FeatureAttribute.name: singleQuantity
FeatureAttribute.definition: Scalar component with decimal representation and a unit of measure used to store value of a continuous quantity.

FeatureAttribute.name: quantityInterval
FeatureAttribute.definition: Decimal pair for specifying a quantity range with a unit of measure.

FeatureType.name: StatusCodeTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: Values describing the statuses of man-made hydrogeological objects.

FeatureType.name: WaterPersistenceValue
FeatureType.definition: Types of hydrological persistence of water.

FeatureType.name: WaterSalinityValue
FeatureType.definition: A code list indicating salinity classes in water.

Salinity is the saltiness or dissolved salt content of a body of water. Generally, it is the concentration of mineral salts dissolved in water. Salinity may be expressed in terms of a concentration or as electrical conductivity. When describing salinity influenced by seawater salinity often refers to the concentration of chlorides in the water. See also total dissolved solids.

FeatureType.name: Campaign
FeatureType.definition: Geophysical activity extending over a limited time range and limited area for producing similar geophysical measurements, processing results or models.
Campaigns can be considered as parents of geophysical measurements or models. Children may refer to parent campaigns through the largerWork identifier.

constraint.name: shape must be GM_Surface
constraint.expression: /* The shape attribute shall be of type GM_Surface */ inv: shape.oclIsKindOf(GM_Surface)

constraint.name: projectedGeometry must be GM_Point, GM_Curve or GM_Surface
constraint.expression: /* The projectedGeometry shall be of type GM_Point, GM_Curve or GM_Surface */ inv: projectedGeometry.oclIsKindOf(GM_Point) or projectedGeometry.oclIsKindOf(GM_Curve) or projectedGeometry.oclIsKindOf(GM_Surface)

FeatureAttribute.name: campaignType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Type of activity to produce data
Value shall be one of the items defined in codelist CampaignTypeValue

FeatureAttribute.name: surveyType
FeatureAttribute.definition: The geophysical method is specified by this attribute. Value shall be one of the items defined in codelist SurveyTypeValue.

FeatureAttribute.name: client
FeatureAttribute.definition: Party for which data was created.

FeatureAttribute.name: contractor
FeatureAttribute.definition: Party by which data was created
Party responsible for creating the data related to the campaign

FeatureType.name: CampaignTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: An initial set of values are provided in the Implementation Rules. The codelist is expected to be extended by the geophysical community. Recommendations can be found in the Technical Guidence.

FeatureType.name: GeophMeasurement
FeatureType.definition: Generic spatial object type for geophysical measurements.
Geophysical measurements collect data outside or on the boundary of the observed spatial domain.

constraint.name: projectedGeometry must be GM_Point, GM_Curve or GM_Surface
constraint.expression: /* The projectedGeometry shall be of type GM_Point, GM_Curve or GM_Surface */ inv: projectedGeometry.oclIsKindOf(GM_Point) or projectedGeometry.oclIsKindOf(GM_Curve) or projectedGeometry.oclIsKindOf(GM_Surface)

FeatureAttribute.name: relatedModel
FeatureAttribute.definition: Identifier of the geophysical model that was created from the measurement
Results of the measurement can be referenced by these identifiers.

FeatureAttribute.name: platformType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Platform from which the measurement was carried out
Values to be used are defined in codelist PlatformTypeValue.

FeatureAttribute.name: relatedNetwork
FeatureAttribute.definition: Name of a national or international observation network to which the facility belongs, or to which measured data is reported.
Permanent measuring installations maz be part of larger observation networks. It means that observation data is regularly sent to the archives of the related network in an official way.

FeatureType.name: GeophObject
FeatureType.definition: A generic class for geophysical objects.
GeophObject models single geophysical entities that are used for spatial sampling either by means of data acquisition or data processing.

constraint.name: projectedGeometry must be GM_Point, GM_Curve or GM_Surface
constraint.expression: /* The projectedGeometry shall be of type GM_Point, GM_Curve or GM_Surface */ inv: projectedGeometry.oclIsKindOf(GM_Point) or projectedGeometry.oclIsKindOf(GM_Curve) or projectedGeometry.oclIsKindOf(GM_Surface)

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the measurement.

NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: citation
FeatureAttribute.definition: Used for title, date of related documentation and URL for online access. At the minimum a short name (title) shall be given.

FeatureAttribute.name: projectedGeometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: 2D projection of the feature to the ground surface (as a representative point, curve or bounding polygon) to be used by an INSPIRE view service to display the spatial object location on a map.

When measurement setup is 3 dimensional, it is necessary to define a 2D geometry for displaying purposes. It shall be the 2D projection of the spatial object on the ground surface. Allowed types: point, track and outline. Examples: projected geometry of a borehole logging measurement is a point coincident with the borehole collar location. Projected geometry of a 3D multielectrode DC measurement is a polygon

FeatureAttribute.name: verticalExtent
FeatureAttribute.definition: Vertical extent of the range of interest.

This parameter serves discovery purposes. It may refer both to the vertical extent of the measurement setup (p.e. borehole logging) or the extent of the range where processed data is spatially referenced to (Vertical Electric Sounding). The aim is to give an idea to the user about the estimated depth of investigation.

FeatureAttribute.name: distributionInfo
FeatureAttribute.definition: Data providers may use external services to provide information on a geophysical measurement. Links to the access points, description of ordering procedures or external services can be added in distributionInfo, that is an ISO MD_Distributor record.

FeatureAttribute.name: largerWork
FeatureAttribute.definition: Identifier of a larger work dataset, typically a campaign or project
Measurements are usually made in campaigns. The largerWork identifier points to the parent Campaign or Project

FeatureType.name: GeophObjectSet
FeatureType.definition: Generic class for collections of geophysical objects
