FeatureAttribute.definition: The 95th Percentile. The value below which 95 percent of the observations may be found.

FeatureAttribute.name: maximum
FeatureAttribute.definition: The highest biomarker value determined in an individual participant in the biomonitoring survey.

FeatureAttribute.name: numberOfPartecipants
FeatureAttribute.definition: The number of participants that have provided samples that have contributed to the calculation of the biomarker statistical parameter.

FeatureAttribute.name: pinLOD
FeatureAttribute.definition: Proportion of individuals with undetectable levels of tested parameter (below limit of detection).

FeatureType.name: BiomarkerThematicMetadata
FeatureType.definition: Thematic Metadata describing the purpose of the study, target population and the characteristic of the studied areas.

FeatureAttribute.name: studyType
FeatureAttribute.definition: The aim of the study (hypothesis driven, general population survey, opportunistic) when these choices are predefined.

FeatureAttribute.name: areaType
FeatureAttribute.definition: The characteristics of the sampling area (urban, rural, semi-urban) when these choices are predefined in a human biomonitoring study.

FeatureAttribute.name: specificSubPopulation
FeatureAttribute.definition: The characteristics of the sampled population with respect to age, gender, and other population characteristics when these choices are predefined in a human biomonitoring survey.

FeatureAttribute.name: meanAge
FeatureAttribute.definition: The mean age of the specific sub population.

FeatureType.name: BiomarkerType
FeatureType.definition: A biomarker is defined both by a quantified or determined chemical (e.g. cadmium, lead) or its metabolite, and a matrix (e.g. blood, urine) that is used for quantification; for example - cadmium in urine, lead in blood.

FeatureAttribute.name: chemical
FeatureAttribute.definition: Identification of the compound by name or abbreviation, chemical formula, CAS-PubChem or any other number that is quantified by the measurement.

FeatureAttribute.name: matrix
FeatureAttribute.definition: Type of biological material or body compartment that is sampled to determine or quantify a biomarker.

FeatureType.name: CODValue
FeatureType.definition: Data on causes of death (COD) provide information on mortality patterns and form a major element of public health information.

COD data refer to the underlying cause which - according to the World Health Organisation (WHO) - is "the disease or injury which initiated the train of morbid events leading directly to death, or the circumstances of the accident or violence which produced the fatal injury". Causes of death are classified by the 65 causes of the "European shortlist" of causes of death. This shortlist is based on the International Statistical Classification of Diseases and Related Health Problems (ICD).
As values in the INSPIRE data, the numeric code could be used (e.g 01, 02, 03...).

FeatureType.name: ComponentTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: Particular component type (chemical substance, biological species, etc) whose concentration in an environmental media is measured.

FeatureType.name: Concentration
FeatureType.definition: A measure of concentration of a specified component in a specified media.

FeatureType.name: Disease
FeatureType.definition: Statistical information related to pathologies linked directly or indirectly to the quality of environment.

Statistical information related to diseases, health-related conditions and external causes of disease and injury, as classified in the International Statistical Classification of Diseases and Related Health Problems, 10th Revision (ICD-10). For practical reasons, a short term ‘disease’ is used to label all conditions covered by this definition.

constraint.name: CODusability
constraint.expression: /* The COD code list shall be used only if the diseaseMeasureType attribute of diseaseMeasure takes a value that represents mortality. */

constraint.name: pathologiOrCODnotempty

FeatureAttribute.name: ageRange
FeatureAttribute.definition: Age interval of a specific subpopulation expressed as starting age and an interval, both alternatively expressed in years, months or weeks.

FeatureAttribute.name: diseaseMeasure
FeatureAttribute.definition: Different ways how data on diseases and related health problems in a population can be reported.

FeatureAttribute.name: referencePeriod
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time period to which data refers.

FeatureAttribute.name: pathology
FeatureAttribute.definition: Disease as defined in the ICD-10 update 2007 "ICD (International Classification of Diseases, 10th revision)".
As values in the INSPIRE data, the code could be used (e.g A00, A01, A01.1, ...).

FeatureAttribute.name: COD
FeatureAttribute.definition: Data on causes of death (COD) that provide information on mortality patterns and form a major element of public health information.

FeatureType.name: DiseaseMeasure
FeatureType.definition: Different ways in which data on diseases and related health problems in a population can be reported.

There is a strong agreement between the two codelists addressed in the Data Specifications Document; the “ICD10Value” and the “CODValue” codelist. Taking into account that the main source of harmonized data is Eurostat, the reporting formats of Eurostat should be promoted in the definition of DiseaseMeasureType:
• Absolute numbers: the total prevalence of a disease or mortality cause, without any further weighing or processing;

• Crude death rate: describes mortality in relation to the total population. Expressed in deaths per 100,000 inhabitants, it is calculated as the number of deaths recorded in the population for a given period divided by population in the same period and then multiplied by 100,000;

• Standardised death rate: weighted average of age-specific mortality rates. The weighting factor is the age distribution of a standard reference population. Standardised death rates are calculated for the age group 0-64 ('premature death') and for the total of ages. As most causes of death vary significantly with people's age and sex, the use of standardised death rates improves comparability over time and between countries.
The reporting formats as presented above are regulated through the European Parliament’s “ Regulation on Community statistics on public health and health and safety at work (EC) No 1338/2008”.

FeatureAttribute.name: diseaseMeasureType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Different ways how data on diseases and related health problems in a population can be reported.

FeatureAttribute.name: value
FeatureAttribute.definition: Value of the measured disease indicator.

FeatureType.name: DiseaseMeasureTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: Different ways how data on diseases and related health problems in a population can be reported.

FeatureType.name: EnvHealthDeterminantMeasure
FeatureType.definition: A raw measurement performed at some place that is of interest for human health determinant analysis.

FeatureAttribute.name: location
FeatureAttribute.definition: This location should be a point geometry in most cases.

FeatureAttribute.name: type
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of environmental health determinant.

FeatureAttribute.name: measureTime
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time period when the measure has been performed.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time when the information will start being used.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time when the information will stop being used.

FeatureType.name: EnvHealthDeterminantStatisticalData
FeatureType.definition: A statistical data of interest for human health determinant analysis, resulting from the aggregation of raw measurements located within a statistical unit.

FeatureAttribute.name: statisticalMethod
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of statistical method used to aggregate the raw measurement data on the statistical unit.

FeatureAttribute.name: type
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of environmental health determinant.

FeatureType.name: GeneralHealthStatistics
FeatureType.definition: Numbers about some aspects of health related to a population or an area. For the purpose of this data model, 'general health' data include issues such as self-perceived health, demographic distribution of various health problems, smokers, etc., expressed as raw numbers, rates, percentage, stratified by gender, age, and/or socio-economic, cultural, ethnic or other factors.

FeatureAttribute.name: ageRange
FeatureAttribute.definition: Age interval of a specific subpopulation expressed as starting age and an interval, both alternatively expressed in years, months or weeks.

FeatureAttribute.name: generalHealthValue
FeatureAttribute.definition: A numerical expression of a health index/indicator.

FeatureAttribute.name: referencePeriod
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time period to which data is referred to.

FeatureType.name: GroundWaterQualityComponentTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: Ground water component type, as specified in the relevant INSPIRE Technical Guidance document.

FeatureAttribute.name: referencePeriod
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time period to which data is referred to.

FeatureType.name: HealthServicesTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: This codelist contains some items included and defined by Eurostat as "Non-expenditure health care data" (http://epp.eurostat.ec.europa.eu/cache/ITY_SDDS/EN/hlth_care_esms.htm).

FeatureType.name: HealthStatisticalData
FeatureType.definition: Human health related data, from recorded diseases and related health problems (according to internationally accepted code lists, such as ICD-10), expressed as morbidity and mortality, to data on general health status (BMI, self perceived health, etc.), data on health care services (health care expenditure, day cases, etc.), and data on biomarkers; these are statistical indices aggregated at different statistical units, collected/reported in different population groups. Inclusion of human biomonitoring data provides an opportunity to explore potential direct or indirect links between human health and the environment.

RelationshipRole.name: aggregationUnit
RelationshipRole.definition: Statistical unit to which health statistical data refers.

FeatureType.name: ICDValue
FeatureType.definition: Disease as defined in the ICD-10 update 2007 "ICD (International Classification of Diseases, 10th revision)".
As values in the INSPIRE data, the code could be used (e.g A00, A01, A01.1, ...).

FeatureType.name: LakeWaterQuality
FeatureType.definition: Lake water component type, as specified in the relevant INSPIRE Technical Guidance document.

FeatureType.name: MatrixValue
FeatureType.definition: Type of human tissue or compartment for biomarker measurement.

FeatureType.name: MediaTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: The media in which the concentration of a health component is measured.
EXAMPLE: Drinking water, indoor air, ambient air, etc.

FeatureAttribute.name: uom
FeatureAttribute.definition: A unit of measure for noise intensity.

FeatureType.name: ReferencePeriodType
FeatureType.definition: The time period which the refer.

FeatureType.name: RiverWaterQualityComponentTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: River water component type, as specified in the relevant INSPIRE Technical Guidance document.

FeatureType.name: StatisticalAggregationMethodValue
FeatureType.definition: The types of statistical methods used to aggregate raw measurement data on the statistical unit.

FeatureType.name: UomConcentration
FeatureType.definition: A unit of measure for concentration of a specified component within a specified media.

FeatureAttribute.name: component
FeatureAttribute.definition: The component whose concentration is measured.
EXAMPLE: SO2 in ambient air, lead in drinking water, benzo-a-pyrene in indoor air, ragweed pollens in ambient air.

FeatureAttribute.name: media
FeatureAttribute.definition: The media in which the concentration is measured.
EXAMPLE: SO2 in ambient air, lead in drinking water, benzo-a-pyrene in indoor air, ragweed pollens in ambient air.

FeatureType.name: UomNoise
FeatureType.definition: A unit of measure for noise intensity.

FeatureAttribute.name: source
FeatureAttribute.definition: EXAMPLE: Road traffic, rail traffic, air traffic, industrial activity, etc.

FeatureType.name: ExistingLandUseDataSet
FeatureType.definition: An existing land use data set is a collection of areas for which information on existing (present or past) land uses is provided.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the existing land use dataset.

NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: extent
FeatureAttribute.definition: Boundary of the geometrical union of all the instances of the spatial object type ExistingLandUseObject.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the existing land use data set was inserted or changed in the provided set of data.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the existing land use data set was superseded or retired in the provided set of data.

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Human readable name of the data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: the time when the existing land use data set started to exist in the real world

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which this existing land use data set no longer exists in the real world.

RelationshipRole.name: member
RelationshipRole.definition: Existing land use objects that belong to this existing land use data set.

RelationshipRole.name: dataset
RelationshipRole.definition: Existing land use data set to which this land use object belongs.

FeatureType.name: ExistingLandUseObject
FeatureType.definition: An existing land use object describes the land use of an area having a homogeneous combination of land use types.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the existing land use object.

An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Geometric representation of spatial area covered by this spatial object.

FeatureAttribute.name: hilucsLandUse
FeatureAttribute.definition: Land use HILUCS classes that are present in this existing land use object.

NOTE The Existing Land Use model enables the provision of information on land uses inside one land use object. The ExistingLandUseObject may be associated with 1 to many HILUCSLandUse that represents the Land Uses for the polygon from the economical point of view. It makes possible the assignment of more than one HILUCSLandUse existences when they cannot be managed by HILUCSPresences.

FeatureAttribute.name: hilucsPresence
FeatureAttribute.definition: Actual presence of a land use category according to HILUCS within the object.

FeatureAttribute.name: specificLandUse
FeatureAttribute.definition: Land Use Category according to the nomenclature specific to this data set.
Reference to an entry in the classfication that is part of the SpecificLandUseClassification.

FeatureAttribute.name: specificPresence
FeatureAttribute.definition: Actual presence of a land use category within the object.

FeatureAttribute.name: observationDate
FeatureAttribute.definition: The observation date associated to a description.

Defines the observation date of the description. It could be the date of an aerial/satellite acquisition or a field survey. The observation date allows the user to have accurate date of when the description was made in the real word. In a database, not all objects are necessarily captured at the same time.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time when the phenomenon started to exist in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which the phenomenon no longer exists in the real world.

FeatureType.name: ExistingLandUseGrid
FeatureType.definition: An existing land use grid is a collection of pixels for which information on existing (present or past) land use is provided. The HILUCS system shall be used for classification.

constraint.name: rangeIsCategoryOrNill
constraint.expression:
/*rangeSet values shall be of type CategoryOrNilReason
NOTE:Range is based on either HILUCS or on a specific land use classification sytem defined by the data provider */ inv: rangeSet.forAll(oclIsKindOf(CategoryOrNilReason))

constraint.name: domainIsRectifiedGrid
constraint.description: The domain shall be a rectified grid.
constraint.expression: inv: domainSet.oclIsKindOf(CV_RectifiedGrid)

constraint.name: grid points shall coincide with grid cell centres
constraint.expression: /*Grid points of a RectifiedGridCoverage shall coincide with the centres of cells of the geographical grids defined in Section 2.2 of Annex II at any resolution level.*/

constraint.name: gridFunctionRequiresGridDomain
constraint.expression: /*The grid function shall only be valid for domains that are grids */ inv: coverageFunction.gridFunction.notEmpty() implies domainSet.oclIsKindOf(CV_Grid)

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Human readable name of the data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the sampled land use data grid.

NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: extent
FeatureAttribute.definition: Contains the extent of the data set.
NOTE Extents may be specified in space, time or space-time.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: First date at which this grid is a valid representation of reality.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which the grid is no longer a valid representation of reality.

FeatureType.name: HILUCSPercentage
FeatureType.definition: Percentage of land use object that is covered by this HILUCS presence.
NOTE1:The percentage is according to the socio-economic or functional importance of the use.
NOTE2:examples are provided in the narrative description part of the data specification.

FeatureAttribute.name: hilucsValue
FeatureAttribute.definition: HILUCS category for this HILUCS percentage.

FeatureAttribute.name: percentage
FeatureAttribute.definition: Percentage of land use object that is covered by this specific presence.
NOTE The percentage is according to the socio-economic importance of the use. In section 5.2.1.1.2. examples of the use of percentages are given.

FeatureType.name: HILUCSPresence
FeatureType.definition: Presence of one or several HILUCS values in an area, indicated either as the percentage covered for each value or as the values listed in their order of importance.

The HILUCS presence data type enables the provision of information on land uses inside one land use object in order to collect more than one land use existence perfectly identifiable by importance order or percentages.
NOTE 1: The order of land use value presence without percentages enable providing an order of dominance/importance of each land use present in the land use object
NOTE 2: The sum of the percentages can be below 100%, or above. The order is provided according to the respective importance when the percentages are not known.

FeatureType.name: HILUCSValue
FeatureType.definition: List of land use categories to be used in INSPIRE Land Use and agreed at the European level.
This list is populated with the land use categories of the Hierarchical INSPIRE Land Use Classification System (HILUCS).
The elements of the list should be both applicable to existing land use and planned land use.

FeatureType.name: LandUseClassificationValue
FeatureType.definition: List of land use categories to be used in INSPIRE Land Use and agreed at a national or local level.
This CodeList is empty in the INSPIRE context and must be extended by each data provider in their national codeList register.

FeatureType.name: SpecificPercentage
FeatureType.definition: Percentage of land use object that is covered by this specific presence.

FeatureAttribute.name: specificValue
FeatureAttribute.definition: specific value category for this specific percentage.

FeatureAttribute.name: percentage
FeatureAttribute.definition: Percentage of land use object that is covered by a specific presence.
NOTE The percentage is according to the socio-economic importance of the use. In section 5.2.1.1.2. examples of the use of percentages are given.

FeatureType.name: SpecificPresence
FeatureType.definition: Presence of one or several land use classification values in an area according to the code list
provided by the data provider, indicated either as the percentage covered for each value or as
the values listed in their order of importance.
NOTE 1: The order of land use value presence without percentages enable providing an order of dominance/importance of each land use present in the land use object
NOTE 2: The sum of the percentages can be below 100%, or above. The order is provided according to the respective importance when the percentages are not known.

FeatureType.name: BackgroundMapValue
FeatureType.definition: Information regarding the map that has been used as a background in the definition of a spatial plan, a zoning element or a supplementary regulation.

FeatureAttribute.name: backgroundMapDate
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date of the background map used.

FeatureAttribute.name: backgroundMapReference
FeatureAttribute.definition: Reference to the background map that has been used.

FeatureAttribute.name: backgroudMapURI
FeatureAttribute.definition: URI referring to service that provides background map.

FeatureType.name: DimensioningIndicationCharacterValue
FeatureType.definition: Dimensioning indication whose value is of type CharacterString.

FeatureType.name: DimensioningIndicationIntegerValue
FeatureType.definition: Dimensioning indication whose value is of type integer.

FeatureType.name: DimensioningIndicationMeasureValue
FeatureType.definition: Dimensioning indication whose value is a measure.

FeatureType.name: DimensioningIndicationRealValue
FeatureType.definition: Dimensioning indication whose value is a floating point number.

FeatureType.name: DimensioningIndicationValue
FeatureType.definition: Specifications about the dimensioning of the urban developments.

FeatureType.name: OfficialDocumentation
FeatureType.definition: The official documentation that composes the spatial plan; it may be composed of, the applicable legislation, the regulations, cartographic elements, descriptive elements that may be associated with the complete spatial plan, a zoning element or a supplementary regulation . In some Member States the actual textual regulation will be part of the data set (and can be put in the regulationText attribute), in other Member States the text will not be part of the data set and will be referenced via a reference to a document or a legal act.
At least one of the three voidable values shall be provided.

NOTE: The LegislationCitation is the value type of the attribute regulation reference. An example of a regulation reference would be: http://www2.vlaanderen.be /ruimtelijk/grup/00350/00362_00001/data/ 212_00362_00001_d_0BVR.pdf.

constraint.name: OneMustBeFilled

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of this spatial textual regulation.

NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: legislationCitation
FeatureAttribute.definition: Reference to the document that contains the text of the regulation.

FeatureAttribute.name: planDocument
FeatureAttribute.definition: Citation of scanned plans and structural drawings which may sometimes be geo-referenced or not,. E.g. raster images, vector drawings or scanned text.

FeatureType.name: OrdinanceValue
FeatureType.definition: Reference to administrative ordinance. Ordinance is a regulation/rule that is adopted by an authority that is legally mandated to take such ordinance.

FeatureAttribute.name: ordinanceDate
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date of the relevant administrative ordinance.

NOTE This attribute is multiple because, independently from the current legal status of the plan, there can be references to the dates of more than one ordinance, in relation to the different steps that the planning process has already undergone (e.g. ordinance for the preparation of a new plan, ordinance of adoption, ordinance of approval, etc.).

FeatureAttribute.name: ordinanceReference
FeatureAttribute.definition: NOTE This attribute is multiple because, independently from the current legal status of the plan, there can be references to more than one ordinance, in relation to the different steps that the planning process has already undergone (e.g. ordinance for the preparation of a new plan, ordinance of adoption, ordinance of approval, etc.).

FeatureType.name: PlanTypeNameValue
FeatureType.definition: Types of plans as defined in the Member States. The allowed values for this code list comprise any values defined by data providers.
NOTE For each plan type name a level of spatial plan must be provided using the enumeration LevelOfSpatialPlanValue

FeatureType.name: ProcessStepGeneralValue
FeatureType.definition: General indication of the step of the planning process that the plan is undergoing.
NOTE This enumeration contains values that are common to most planning systems.

FeatureType.name: RegulationNatureValue
FeatureType.definition: Legal nature of the land use indication.

FeatureType.name: SpatialPlan
FeatureType.definition: A set of documents that indicates a strategic direction for the development of a given geographic area, states the policies, priorities, programmes and land allocations that will implement the strategic direction and influences the distribution of people and activities in spaces of various scales. Spatial plans may be developed for urban planning, regional planning, environmental planning, landscape planning, national spatial plans, or spatial planning at the Union level.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial plan.

NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: extent
FeatureAttribute.definition: Geometrical union of all the instances of the spatial objects ZoningElement and SupplementaryRegulation. When a SpatialPlan is only composed of a document, the attribute extent is the border of the cartographic image that contains the land use information (i.e. the land use map extent).

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: officialTitle
FeatureAttribute.definition: Official title of the spatial plan.

FeatureAttribute.name: levelOfSpatialPlan
FeatureAttribute.definition: Level of the administrative units covered by the plan.
Member states should make a mapping to this enumeration.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: First date at which this spatial plan is valid in reality.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which the spatial plan no longer exists in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: alternativeTitle
FeatureAttribute.definition: Alternative (unofficial) title of the spatial plan.

FeatureAttribute.name: planTypeName
FeatureAttribute.definition: Name of the type of plan that the Member State has given to the plan.
NOTE The admissible values for this attribute are managed at the member state level via a code list

FeatureAttribute.name: processStepGeneral
FeatureAttribute.definition: General indication of the step of the planning process that the plan is undergoing.
NOTE This enumeration contains values that are common to most planning systems.

FeatureAttribute.name: backgroundMap
FeatureAttribute.definition: Identification of the background map that has been used for constructing this Plan.

FeatureAttribute.name: ordinance
FeatureAttribute.definition: NOTE This attribute is multiple because, independently from the current legal status of the plan, there can be references to more than one ordinance, in relation to the different steps that the planning process has already undergone (e.g. ordinance for the preparation of a new plan, ordinance of adoption, ordinance of approval, etc.).

RelationshipRole.name: restriction
RelationshipRole.definition: Links to supplementary regulations providing information and/or limitations on the use of land/water that supplements the zoning as part of this spatial plan.

RelationshipRole.name: plan
RelationshipRole.definition: Link to the plan this supplementary regulation is part of.

RelationshipRole.name: member
RelationshipRole.definition: Reference to the ZoningElements which belong to this SpatialPlan.

RelationshipRole.name: plan
RelationshipRole.definition: SpatialPlan which this ZoningElement belongs to.

RelationshipRole.name: officialDocument
RelationshipRole.definition: Link to the official documents that relate to the spatial plan.

FeatureType.name: SpecificSupplementaryRegulationValue
FeatureType.definition: Category of supplementary regulation provided in a specific nomenclature of supplementary
regulations provided by the data provider.
The allowed values for this code list comprise any values defined by data providers.

FeatureType.name: SupplementaryRegulation
FeatureType.definition: A spatial object (point, line or polygon) of a spatial plan that provides supplementary information and/or limitation of the use of land/water necessary for spatial planning reasons or to formalise external rules defined in legal text.
NOTE the supplementary regulations affects all land use that overlap with the geometry

EXAMPLE an air field generates restriction in its surroundings regarding aircraft landing, radar and telecommunication devices. It is the buffer around these artefacts that generates the supplementary regulation on the Land Use.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: First date at which this version of this supplementary regulation is valid in reality.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which the supplementary regulation is no longer valid.

FeatureAttribute.name: specificSupplementaryRegulation
FeatureAttribute.definition: Reference to a category of supplementary regulation provided in a specific nomenclature of supplementary regulations provided by the data provider.

FeatureAttribute.name: processStepGeneral
FeatureAttribute.definition: General indication of the step of the planning process that the supplementary regulation is undergoing.
NOTE This enumeration contains values that are common to most planning systems.

FeatureAttribute.name: backgroundMap
FeatureAttribute.definition: Identification of the background map that has been used for constructing the supplementary regulation.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: dimensioningIndication
FeatureAttribute.definition: Specifications about the dimensioning that are added to the dimensioning of the zoning elements that overlap the geometry of the supplementary regulation.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.

NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Geometry of the piece of land on which the supplementary regulation applies.

FeatureAttribute.name: inheritedFromOtherPlans
FeatureAttribute.definition: Indication whether the supplementary regulation is inherited from another spatial plan.

FeatureAttribute.name: specificRegulationNature
FeatureAttribute.definition: Legal nature of the land use regulation from a national perspective.

On member state level the legal classification for plan regulations may be complex. A supplementary regulation may be principally "bindingOnlyForAuthorities" but according to national law this regulation have to be more specified to explain the specific degree of binding. (e.g. on state or regional planning level in Germany: principles of spatial planning, other spatial planning requirements or goals of spatial planning).
NOTE This attribute complements the information provided by the attribute regulationNature.

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Official name of the supplementary regulation

FeatureAttribute.name: regulationNature
FeatureAttribute.definition: Legal nature of the land use regulation.
NOTE Indicates whether the land use regulation is legally binding or not.

FeatureAttribute.name: supplementaryRegulation
FeatureAttribute.definition: Code of the supplementary regulation from the hierarchical supplementary regulation code list agreed at the European level.

RelationshipRole.name: officialDocument
RelationshipRole.definition: Link to the Textual regulations that correspond to this supplementary regulation.

FeatureType.name: SupplementaryRegulationValue
FeatureType.definition: Types of conditions and constraints in spatial plans.
This list is populated with the categories of the Hierarchical Supplementary Regulation Code List (HSRCL).

FeatureType.name: ZoningElement
FeatureType.definition: A spatial object which is homogeneous regarding the permitted uses of land based on zoning which separate one set of land uses from another.

Zoning elements refer to the regulation of the kinds of activities which will be acceptable on particular lots (such as open space, residential, agricultural, commercial or industrial). The intensity of use at which those activities can be performed (from low-density housing such as single family homes to high-density such as high-rise apartment buildings), the height of buildings, the amount of space that structures may occupy, the proportions of the types of space on a lot, such as how much landscaped space, impervious surface, traffic lanes, and parking may be provided.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.

An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: The date when the phenomenon started to exist in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which the phenomenon no longer exists in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: hilucsLandUse
FeatureAttribute.definition: Land use HILUCS class that is dominant in this land use object.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: hilucsPresence
FeatureAttribute.definition: Actual presence of a land use HILUCS category wihtin the object.

FeatureAttribute.name: specificLandUse
FeatureAttribute.definition: Land Use Category according to the nomenclature specific to this data set.
Reference to an entry in the classfication that is part of the SpecificLandUseClassification.

FeatureAttribute.name: specificPresence
FeatureAttribute.definition: Actual presence of a land use category wihtin the object.

FeatureAttribute.name: regulationNature
FeatureAttribute.definition: Legal nature of the land use indication.
NOTE Indicates whether the land use indication is legally binding or not.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: processStepGeneral
FeatureAttribute.definition: General indication of the step of the planning process that the zoning element is undergoing.
NOTE This enumeration contains values that are common to most planning systems.

FeatureAttribute.name: backgroundMap
FeatureAttribute.definition: Identification of the background map that has been used for constructing this zoning element.

FeatureAttribute.name: dimensioningIndication
FeatureAttribute.definition: Specifications about the dimensioning of the urban developments.

RelationshipRole.name: officialDocument
RelationshipRole.definition: Textual Regulation that is part of this zoning element.

FeatureType.name: ExistingLandUseSample
FeatureType.definition: Description of the existing land use that is present at the specific location.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the land use sample.

An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: location
FeatureAttribute.definition: Location where the land use sample is taken.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: hilucsLandUse
FeatureAttribute.definition: Land use HILUCS classes that are present in this existing land use sample.

NOTE The Sampled Existing Land Use model enables the provision of information on land uses inside one land use object. The ExistingLandUseObject may be associated with 1 to many HILUCSLandUse that represents the Land Uses for the polygon from the economical point of view. It makes possible the assignment of more than one HILUCSLandUse existences when they cannot be managed by HILUCSPresences.

FeatureAttribute.name: hilucsPresence
FeatureAttribute.definition: Actual presence of a land use category according to HILUCS within the object.

FeatureAttribute.name: specificLandUse
FeatureAttribute.definition: Land Use Category according to the nomenclature specific to this data set.
Reference to an entry in the classfication that is part of the SpecificLandUseClassification provided by the data producer.

FeatureAttribute.name: observationDate
FeatureAttribute.definition: The observation date associated to a description.

Defines the observation date of the description. It could be the date of an aerial/satellital acquisition or a field survey. The observation date allows the user to have accurate date of when the description was made in the real word. In a database, not all object informations are necessarily captured at the same time.

FeatureAttribute.name: specificPresence
FeatureAttribute.definition: Actual presence of a land use category within the object.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time when the phenomenon started to exist in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which the phenomenon no longer exists in the real world.

RelationshipRole.name: dataset
RelationshipRole.definition: Data set to which this sample belongs.

RelationshipRole.name: member
RelationshipRole.definition: Reference to the members of the sampled existing land use data set.

FeatureType.name: SampledExistingLandUseDataSet
FeatureType.definition: sampled existing land use data set
A sampled existing land use data set is a collection of locations for which information on existing (present or past) land uses is provided.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the sampled land use data set.

NOTE An external object identifier is a unique object identifier published by the responsible body, which may be used by external applications to reference the spatial object. The identifier is an identifier of the spatial object, not an identifier of the real-world phenomenon.

FeatureAttribute.name: extent
FeatureAttribute.definition: The convex hull of all the instances of the spatial object type ExistingLandUseSample.

FeatureAttribute.name: name
FeatureAttribute.definition: Human readable name of the data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: First date at which this data set is valid in reality.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which the data set no longer exists in the real world.

FeatureType.name: ClassificationMethodUsedValue
FeatureType.definition: Codes indicating the means used to calculate the ore measurement.
EXAMPLE: JORC, PERC, Unspecified, UNESCO/World Bank and the Canadian CIM.

FeatureType.name: Commodity
FeatureType.definition: The material of economic interest in the EarthResource

RelationshipRole.name: source
RelationshipRole.definition: The deposit/resource from which the commodity comes.

RelationshipRole.name: source
RelationshipRole.definition: The deposit/resource from which the commodity comes.

RelationshipRole.name: commodityDescription
RelationshipRole.definition: Exhaustive list of the commodities present in the resource, ranked by importance order. Determining the rank of a commodity is not as simple as it may look: not only the tonnage (expressed in tons of metal) has to be taken into account, but also the scarcity and thus the price of the commodity. A deposit containing 500,000 t Cu and only 50 t Au will be classified as an Au-(Cu) deposit.

FeatureAttribute.name: commodity
FeatureAttribute.definition: EXAMPLE: Cu, Au, Dimension Stone etc.

FeatureAttribute.name: commodityImportance
FeatureAttribute.definition: The importance of the deposit for the commodity.

Several commodities may be of interest inside a deposit. A deposit may be a very large deposit for one commodity (this commodity is the main one) and only a medium-sized deposit for some other commodities. Such a ranking is based on a statistical study of a large set of deposits throughout the world to ensure that it is valid. It is made using histograms allowing for each commodity to define class boundaries and what is a super large, a large, a medium-sized etc deposit for this commodity. This classification is based on the potential or endowment: reserves + resources.

FeatureAttribute.name: commodityRank
FeatureAttribute.definition: Commodity rank is based on endowment, i.e. (cumulated) past production + reserves (not including past production) + resources, or if the deposit has never been exploited, reserves + resources. A statistical comparison with a large set of deposits throughout the world enables the determination of the deposit as class A (very large), B (large), or C (medium-sized) for a particular commodity, and also which commodity is the main one, the 2nd one, etc. The rank of a commodity is thus not based on political or economic considerations.

FeatureType.name: CommodityCodeValue
FeatureType.definition: Values indicating the type of commodity.
EXAMPLE: Cu, Au, Dimension Stone etc.

FeatureType.name: CommodityMeasure
FeatureType.definition: A measure of the amount of the commodity based on a Reserve, Resource or Endowment calculation.
Where OreMeasure is Resource or Reserve CommodityMeasure is mandatory

FeatureAttribute.name: cutOffGrade
FeatureAttribute.definition: The cut off grade used for calculating the commodity measure.
The lowest concentration of a mineralized material that qualifies as ore in a given deposit (adapted from Neuendorf, 2005).

RelationshipRole.name: commodityOfInterest
RelationshipRole.definition: The commodity to which the CommodityMeasure refers.

FeatureType.name: EarthResource
FeatureType.definition: The kinds of observable or inferred phenomena required to classify economic and non-economic earth resources.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanversion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

RelationshipRole.name: explorationHistory
RelationshipRole.definition: Recaps the work which has been done from regional reconnaissance, surface detailed prospecting, subsurface prospecting, assessment of the resource, to evaluation of the ore deposit. Depending on the work done on occurrences and prospects, allows an estimate of the 'still to be discovered' potential of an area. A detailed assessment with no result would lead to a pessimistic opinion.

RelationshipRole.name: supergeneModification
RelationshipRole.definition: A supergene process which would allow a metal enrichment produced by the chemical remobilisation of metals in an oxidised or transitional environment.

RelationshipRole.name: geneticDescription
RelationshipRole.definition: Provides a description for how the EarthResource formed

RelationshipRole.name: resourceExtraction
RelationshipRole.definition: Indicates if this resource is the subject of exploitation, and if so of which type. Depending on several factors (type of mineralization, size, grade, shape, depth, etc.) one or several (combined) methods may be used, including off site methods, surface mining (among which methods related to the exploitation of alluvial/elluvial deposits), underground mining. Knowledge about these methods is important as it may be strongly related to the quantity and type of wastes and environmental impacts generated by the extraction.

RelationshipRole.name: resourceExtraction
RelationshipRole.definition: One or more periods of mining activity of the earth resource.

Indicates if this resource is the subject of exploitation, and if so of which type. Depending on several factors (type of mineralization, size, grade, shape, depth, etc.) one or several (combined) methods may be used, including off site methods, surface mining (among which methods related to the exploitation of alluvial/elluvial deposits), underground mining. Knowledge about these methods is important as it may be strongly related to the quantity and type of wastes and environmental impacts generated by the extraction.

RelationshipRole.name: commodityDescription
RelationshipRole.definition: The commodities present in the resource ranked by importance order.

Determining the rank of a commodity is not as simple as it may look: not only the tonnage (expressed in tons of metal) has to be taken into account, but also the scarcity and thus the price of the commodity. A deposit containing 500,000 t Cu and only 50 t Au will be classified as an Au-(Cu) deposit.

RelationshipRole.name: explorationHistory
RelationshipRole.definition: Chronological list of surveys undertaken to better define the potential of a mineral occurrence.

Recaps the work which has been done from regional reconnaissance, surface detailed prospecting, subsurface prospecting, assessment of the resource, to evaluation of the ore deposit. Depending on the work done on occurrences and prospects, allows an estimate of the 'still to be discovered' potential of an area. A detailed assessment with no result would lead to a pessimistic opinion.

FeatureAttribute.name: sourceReference
FeatureAttribute.definition: The source or reference for the Earth Resource.

FeatureAttribute.name: dimension
FeatureAttribute.definition: The size/volume of the earth resource.

FeatureAttribute.name: expression
FeatureAttribute.definition: An indicator of whether an EarthResource appears on the surface or has been detected under cover rocks.

FeatureAttribute.name: form
FeatureAttribute.definition: The orebody's typical physical and structural relationship to wallrocks and associated rocks.
EXAMPLE: stratiform, stratabound, cross-cutting, vein, intrusive contact etc.

FeatureAttribute.name: linearOrientation
FeatureAttribute.definition: The linear orientation of the Earth Resource.

FeatureAttribute.name: planarOrientation
FeatureAttribute.definition: The planar orientation of the Earth Resource.

FeatureAttribute.name: shape
FeatureAttribute.definition: The typical geometrical shape of the Earth Resource.

RelationshipRole.name: classification
RelationshipRole.definition: Systematically arranged information describing the essential attributes of a class of mineral deposits. May be empirical (descriptive) or theoretical (genetic).

RelationshipRole.name: oreAmount
RelationshipRole.definition: The estimated or calculated amount of ore with the identification of the commodities contained and their grade.

FeatureType.name: EarthResourceDimension
FeatureType.definition: The size and volume of the earth resource.

FeatureAttribute.name: area
FeatureAttribute.definition: The area of the Earth Resource.

FeatureAttribute.name: depth
FeatureAttribute.definition: The depth of the Earth Resource.

FeatureAttribute.name: length
FeatureAttribute.definition: The length of the Earth Resource.

FeatureAttribute.name: width
FeatureAttribute.definition: The width of the Earth Resource.

FeatureType.name: Endowment
FeatureType.definition: The quantity of a mineral (or a group of minerals for industrial rocks) in accumulations (deposits) meeting specified physical characteristics such as quality, size and depth.

Usually includes Resources, as unlike the latter, it does not have to have prospects for "eventual economic extraction". It often includes the total amount of a commodity originally introduced to a particular location during the deposit forming processes - and thus can include resources, reserves, past production and mining and metallurgical losses.

FeatureAttribute.name: includesReserves
FeatureAttribute.definition: A flag indicating if the estimate includes the reserves value.

FeatureAttribute.name: includesResources
FeatureAttribute.definition: A flag indicating if the estimate includes the resources value.

FeatureType.name: EndusePotentialValue
FeatureType.definition: Values indicating the end-use potential of the mineral.
EXAMPLE: for energy, fertilizer, building raw material etc.

FeatureAttribute.name: activityDuration
FeatureAttribute.definition: Period, or extent in time, of the exploration activity.

The beginning of the activity links the TM_Period to the TM_Instant at which it starts. The ending links the TM_Period to the TM_Instant at which it ends. For a variety of reasons, the position of the TM_Instant designated by 'begin' or 'end' may be inderterminate.

FeatureAttribute.name: activityType
FeatureAttribute.definition: EXAMPLE: geological mapping, drilling, geophysical surveys, geochemical mapping, etc.

FeatureAttribute.name: explorationResult
FeatureAttribute.definition: The result of the exploration activity.

FeatureType.name: ExplorationActivityTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: Types of exploration activity carried out.

FeatureType.name: ExplorationResultValue
FeatureType.definition: Values indicating the result of the exploration activity.

FeatureType.name: ImportanceValue
FeatureType.definition: Values indicating the importance of the commodity for the Earth Resource.

Such a ranking is based on a statistical study of a large set of deposits throughout the world to ensure that it is valid. It is made using histograms allowing for each commodity to define class boundaries and what is a very large, a large, a medium-sized etc deposit for this commodity.. This classification is based on the potential or endowment: reserves + resources.

FeatureType.name: Mine
FeatureType.definition: An excavation carried out for the extraction of mineral deposits.

‘True’ mines are underground workings and open-pit workings (also called open-sky mines) generally for the extraction of metallic commodities. The Mine feature also includes open workings generally for the extraction of industrial minerals, commonly referred to as quarries.

FeatureAttribute.name: endDate
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date on which the mine ceased operation.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifespanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

RelationshipRole.name: relatedActivity
RelationshipRole.definition: The MiningActivity associated with the Mine.

RelationshipRole.name: relatedActivity
RelationshipRole.definition: The MiningActivity associated with the Mine

FeatureAttribute.name: startDate
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date on which the mine commenced operation.

FeatureAttribute.name: mineName
FeatureAttribute.definition: Data type indicating the Mine Name and whether it is the preferred name.

FeatureAttribute.name: sourceReference
FeatureAttribute.definition: The source reference for the mine.

FeatureAttribute.name: status
FeatureAttribute.definition: Operational status value of the mine.
EXAMPLE: Care & Maintenance; Pending Approval; Operating continually.

RelationshipRole.name: relatedMine
RelationshipRole.definition: A mine currently exploited may result from the resumption and the extension of a – or several – former or older (abandoned) mine(s). Mines need not aggregate to form other mines, they may just be associated in some way or another (eg the Kalgoorlie SuperPit is associated with its preceding mines).

FeatureType.name: MineName
FeatureType.definition: A data type indicating the Mine Name and whether it is the preferred name.

FeatureAttribute.name: isPreferred
FeatureAttribute.definition: A boolean operator indicating if the value in mineName is the preferred name of the mine.

FeatureType.name: MineStatusValue
FeatureType.definition: Values indicating the operational status of the mine.

FeatureType.name: MineralDepositGroupValue
FeatureType.definition: Values indicating the grouping of mineral deposits on the basis of their generic characteristics.
EXAMPLE: host rock, host structure, commodity, association with similar mineral processes e.g. porphyry.

FeatureType.name: MineralDepositModel
FeatureType.definition: Systematically arranged information describing the essential attributes of a class of mineral deposits. It may be empirical (descriptive) or theoretical (genetic).

FeatureAttribute.name: mineralDepositGroup
FeatureAttribute.definition: A grouping of mineral deposits defined by generic characteristics
EXAMPLE: host rock, host structure, commodity, association with similar mineral processes e.g. porphyry. Regional, national and more universal lists e.g. Cox and Singer 1986.

FeatureAttribute.name: mineralDepositType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Style of mineral occurrence or deposit.
Generally a local or regional term. Should be referenced for definitions and descriptions. Single deposit terms may form member of a Mineral Deposit Group in local and regional schemas.

FeatureType.name: MineralDepositTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: Values indicating the style of mineral occurrence or deposit.
Generally a local or regional term. Should be referenced for definitions and descriptions. Single deposit terms may form member of a Mineral Deposit Group in local and regional schemas.

FeatureType.name: MineralOccurrence
FeatureType.definition: A mineral accumulation in the lithosphere.

FeatureAttribute.name: endusePotential
FeatureAttribute.definition: The end-use potential of the mineral.
EXAMPLE: for energy, fertilizer, building raw material.

FeatureAttribute.name: type
FeatureAttribute.definition: EXAMPLE: prospect, occurrence, mineral deposit, ore deposit.

FeatureType.name: MiningActivity
FeatureType.definition: The process of extracting metallic, non-metallic mineral, or industrial rock deposits from the Earth.
The term may also include preliminary treatment eg. cleaning or sizing.

FeatureAttribute.name: processingType
FeatureAttribute.definition: The type of processing carried out during the mining activity.

RelationshipRole.name: rawMaterial
RelationshipRole.definition: An ore is rarely extracted or mined alone. It is most of the time accompanied by a variable quantity of gangue, very slightly mineralized or completely barren, composed of non-metallic minerals (sometimes of interest) and/or altered host-rock(s).

RelationshipRole.name: role_Sas54851
RelationshipRole.definition: This is an outbound association only and has no role

RelationshipRole.name: producedMaterial
RelationshipRole.definition: Product(s) elaborated from mining activity, through a processing phase. Usually in the form of concentrates containing one or several commodities at various grades for metallic ores.

RelationshipRole.name: producedWaste
RelationshipRole.definition: Waste products from a mining activity, through a processing phase.

RelationshipRole.name: deposit
RelationshipRole.definition: To which deposit a mining activity is associated.

RelationshipRole.name: associatedMine
RelationshipRole.definition: The mine where the mining activity takes, or took, place.

RelationshipRole.name: associatedMine
RelationshipRole.definition: The mine that the MiningActivity occurred in

RelationshipRole.name: deposit
RelationshipRole.definition: The deposit to which the mining activity is associated.

FeatureAttribute.name: activityDuration
FeatureAttribute.definition: Period, or extent in time, of the mining activity.

The beginning of the activity links the TM_Period to the TM_Instant at which it starts. The ending links the TM_Period to the TM_Instant at which it ends. For a variety of reasons, the position of the TM_Instant designated by 'begin' or 'end' may be inderterminate.

FeatureAttribute.name: activityType
FeatureAttribute.definition: EXAMPLE: Open Pit, Underground Mine, multiple, unspecified) or processing activity (eg Ore Processing) or production.

Using activity to distinguish between the extraction, processing and production activities allows distinguishing between ore mined/grade/recovery, ore treated/grade/recovery and produced payable/plant recovery.

FeatureAttribute.name: oreProcessed
FeatureAttribute.definition: The amount of ore processed by the activity.

FeatureType.name: MiningActivityTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: The type of mining activity, processing activity, or production.

FeatureType.name: MiningFeature
FeatureType.definition: Spatial object type grouping the common properties of mines and mining activities.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.

RelationshipRole.name: occurrence
RelationshipRole.definition: Point to the single MiningFeature which describes the Mining feature Occurrence

RelationshipRole.name: specification
RelationshipRole.definition: Indicates the MiningFeature that the occurrence specifies

Points to any number of MiningFeatureOccurrences which are occurrences of the Miningfeature. MiningFeatureOccurrences may all be from a single map or from several maps, or reflect different levels of detail, eg point, area, 3D volume.

FeatureType.name: MiningFeatureOccurrence
FeatureType.definition: A spatial representation of a MiningFeature.

A MiningFeatureOccurrence provides a link between a notional feature (description package) and one spatial representation of it, or part of it. The MiningFeatureOccurrence carries a geometry and the association with a Mining Feature provides specification of all the other descriptors.

RelationshipRole.name: specification
RelationshipRole.definition: Indicates the MiningFeature that the MiningFeatureOccurrence specifies.

FeatureType.name: OreMeasure
FeatureType.definition: The estimate of the Reserve, Resource or Endowment ore amount.

FeatureAttribute.name: classificationMethodUsed
FeatureAttribute.definition: EXAMPLE: JORC, PERC, Unspecified, UNESCO/World Bank and the Canadian CIM.

FeatureAttribute.name: date
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date of calculated or estimated value.
This may be a single date or a range.

FeatureAttribute.name: dimension
FeatureAttribute.definition: Size of the body used in the calculation.

FeatureAttribute.name: proposedExtractionMethod
FeatureAttribute.definition: The method proposed to extract the commodity.

FeatureAttribute.name: sourceReference
FeatureAttribute.definition: The reference for the OreMeasure values.

RelationshipRole.name: measureDetails
RelationshipRole.definition: A measure of the amount of each commodity, based on a reserve, resource or endowment calculation.
This measure is obtained by multiplying the ore tonnage by the average grade of the commodity within the ore (generally expressed in tons of metal).

FeatureType.name: ProcessingActivityTypeValue
FeatureType.definition: Values indicating the type of processing carried out during a mining activity.

FeatureType.name: Reserve
FeatureType.definition: The economically mineable part of a Measured and/or Indicated Mineral Resource.

It includes diluting materials and allowances for losses, which may occur when the material is mined. ‘Marketable Coal Reserves’ maybe reported in conjunction with, but not instead of, reports of Ore (Coal) Reserves. ‘Saleable product’ (e.g. for industrial minerals) can be reported in conjunction with ore reserve.

Synonyms: Ore Reserve; Coal Reserve (s); Diamond (or gemstone) Ore Reserve; Mineral Reserves (not preferred, should be stated that used to mean the same as JORC’s Ore Reserve); Mineable production estimates

FeatureAttribute.name: category
FeatureAttribute.title: jorcClassification
FeatureAttribute.definition: The level of confidence of the estimate (proved, probable).

FeatureType.name: ReserveCategoryValue
FeatureType.definition: The level of confidence of the estimate of the reserve.

FeatureType.name: Resource
FeatureType.definition: An accumulation of material of intrinsic economic interest in or on the Earth’s crust in such form, quality and quantity that there are reasonable prospects for economic extraction.
Synonyms: Mineral Resource; Coal Resource (s); Diamond (Gemstone) Resource; Potentially Mineable Mineralisation.

FeatureAttribute.name: category
FeatureAttribute.title: jorcClassification
FeatureAttribute.definition: Indication of whether the resource is measured, indicated, or inferred.

FeatureAttribute.name: includesReserves
FeatureAttribute.definition: A flag indicating whether the estimate of resources includes reserve values.

FeatureType.name: ResourceCategoryValue
FeatureType.definition: Indication whether the resource is measured, indicated, or inferred.

FeatureType.name: AbstractExposedElement
FeatureType.definition: People, property, systems, or other elements present in hazard zones that are thereby subject to potential losses.

constraint.name: If the "source of spatial representation" is empty, the geometry AbstractExposedElement spatial object shall be provided.
constraint.expression: /*If the "source of spatial representation" is empty, the geometry AbstractExposedElement spatial object shall be provided.*/ inv: AbstractExposedElement.sourceOfSpatialRepresentation. isEmpty() implies ExposedElement.geometry.notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the exposed element.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifeSpanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifeSpanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time when the exposed element started to exist in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which the exposed element no longer exists in the real world.

FeatureType.name: AbstractHazardArea
FeatureType.definition: An area affected by a natural hazard.

A natural hazard is a natural process or phenomenon that may cause loss of life, injury or other impacts, property damage, loss livelihoods and services, social and economic disruption, or environmental damage. [Council of The European Union - Commission Staff Working Paper - Risk Assessment and Mapping Guidelines for Disaster Management].

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifeSpanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: determinationMethod
FeatureAttribute.definition: Specifies if the hazard area result is delineated after modelling or determined after interpretation.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifeSpanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the hazard area.

FeatureAttribute.name: typeOfHazard
FeatureAttribute.definition: A generic classification and a specific classification of the type of natural hazard.

FeatureAttribute.name: validityPeriod
FeatureAttribute.definition: Future finite time frame where the hazard applies.
It is an interval of dates, or the expression of a time frame for which the estimates are meant (eg: until 2090; summer of 2011; winter seasons until 2015).

RelationshipRole.name: source
RelationshipRole.definition: The observed event that triggered the modelling of a hazard area.

FeatureType.name: AbstractObservedEvent
FeatureType.definition: A natural phenomenon relevant to the study of natural hazards which occurred and which has been observed.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifeSpanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifeSpanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.

FeatureAttribute.name: nameOfEvent
FeatureAttribute.definition: common name of the observed event.

FeatureAttribute.name: typeOfHazard
FeatureAttribute.definition: A generic classification and a specific classification of the type of hazard.

FeatureAttribute.name: validFrom
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time when the observed event started to exist in the real world.

FeatureAttribute.name: validTo
FeatureAttribute.definition: The time from which the observed event no longer exists in the real world.

RelationshipRole.name: isMonitoredBy
RelationshipRole.definition: The program that monitors the observed event.

FeatureType.name: AbstractRiskZone
FeatureType.definition: A risk zone is the spatial extent of a combination of the consequences of an event (hazard) and the associated probability/likelihood of its occurrence.

FeatureAttribute.name: beginLifeSpanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was inserted or changed in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: endLifeSpanVersion
FeatureAttribute.definition: Date and time at which this version of the spatial object was superseded or retired in the spatial data set.

FeatureAttribute.name: inspireId
FeatureAttribute.definition: External object identifier of the spatial object.

FeatureAttribute.name: sourceOfRisk
FeatureAttribute.definition: A generic classification and a specific classification of the type of hazard which is the source of risk.

FeatureAttribute.name: validityPeriod
FeatureAttribute.definition: Future finite time frame where the model applies.
It is an interval of dates, or the expression of a time frame for which the estimates are meant (eg: until 2090; summer of 2011; winter seasons until 2015).

RelationshipRole.name: source
RelationshipRole.definition: The hazard which is considered for the creation of the risk zone object.

RelationshipRole.name: exposedElement
RelationshipRole.definition: The element that is within a hazardous area.

FeatureType.name: DeterminationMethodValue
FeatureType.definition: An enumeration to describe the method used to define the area of hazard or risk.
There are several ways to delineate the perimeter of a hazard or a risk : to model it, or to assess it indirectly

FeatureAttribute.name: modelling
FeatureAttribute.definition: The area has been computed according to a model.

FeatureAttribute.name: indirectDetermination
FeatureAttribute.definition: The area has been defined by interpretation of available data and/or information.

FeatureType.name: ExposedElement
FeatureType.definition: Discrete spatial objects representing exposed element.

constraint.name: If the "source of spatial representation" is empty, the geometry AbstractExposedElement spatial object shall be provided.
constraint.expression: /*If the "source of spatial representation" is empty, the geometry AbstractExposedElement spatial object shall be provided.*/ inv: AbstractExposedElement.sourceOfSpatialRepresentation. isEmpty() implies ExposedElement.geometry.notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Geometric representation of the exposed element.
If the feature is linked to a spatially referenced INSPIRE feature, then it has no geometry. If not, then it has a geometry.

FeatureAttribute.name: assessmentOfVulnerability
FeatureAttribute.definition: Assessment of the vulnerability of the exposed element.

FeatureType.name: ExposedElementCategoryValue
FeatureType.definition: A classification of the exposed element.

FeatureType.name: ExposedElementClassification
FeatureType.definition: This class provides piece of information about the nature of the exposed element which is relevant to risk analysis.

FeatureAttribute.name: exposedElementCategory
FeatureAttribute.definition: A generic classification of the types of elements that are exposed to a risk.

FeatureAttribute.name: specificExposedElementType
FeatureAttribute.definition: An additional denomination of exposed element according to a nomenclature that is specific to this dataset.

FeatureType.name: ExposedElementCoverage
FeatureType.definition: A coverage representating continuous information about exposed elements.

constraint.name: DomainisrectifedGridOrReferenceableGrid
constraint.description: A domain is a rectified grid or referenceable grid
constraint.expression: inv: domainSet.oclIsKindOf(CV_RectifiedGrid) or domainSet.oclIsKindOf(CV_ReferenceableGrid)

constraint.name: Range set is the levelOfVulnerability of VulnerabilityAssessment
constraint.expression: /* Range set is the level, or intensity, of the vulnerability assessment */ inv: rangeSet.oclIsKindOf(VulnerabilityAssessment.levelOfVulnerability)

constraint.name: If the "source of spatial representation" is empty, the geometry AbstractExposedElement spatial object shall be provided.
constraint.expression: /*If the "source of spatial representation" is empty, the geometry AbstractExposedElement spatial object shall be provided.*/ inv: AbstractExposedElement.sourceOfSpatialRepresentation. isEmpty() implies ExposedElement.geometry.notEmpty()

constraint.name: gridFunctionRequiresGridDomain
constraint.expression: /*The grid function shall only be valid for domains that are grids */ inv: coverageFunction.gridFunction.notEmpty() implies domainSet.oclIsKindOf(CV_Grid)

FeatureAttribute.name: typeOfElement
FeatureAttribute.definition: A classification of the exposed element.

FeatureType.name: HazardArea
FeatureType.definition: Discrete spatial objects representing a natural hazard.

FeatureAttribute.name: geometry
FeatureAttribute.definition: Geometric representation of spatial extent covered by the hazard area.

FeatureAttribute.name: likelihoodOfOccurrence
FeatureAttribute.definition: Likelihood is a general concept relating to the chance of an event occuring.

FeatureAttribute.name: magnitudeOrIntensity
FeatureAttribute.definition: An expression of the magnitude or the intensity of a phenomenon.
It may address a value within the Richter scale, or a description of the european macro-seismic scale, or a flood flow, etc...

FeatureType.name: HazardCoverage
FeatureType.definition: A coverage representing continuous information about a type of natural hazard.

constraint.name: DomainIsRectifiedGridOrReferenceableGrid
constraint.description: A domain is a rectified grid or referenceable grid
constraint.expression: inv: domainSet.oclIsKindOf(CV_RectifiedGrid) or domainSet.oclIsKindOf(CV_ReferenceableGrid)

constraint.name: RangeSet is levelOrIntensity, or likelihoodOfOccurrence
constraint.expression:
/*A range set is described by magnitude or intensity, or by the likelihood of occurence. As "magnitude or intensity" is modelled by the "LevelOrIntensity" data type, the constraint refers to this data type */
inv: rangeSet.oclIsKindOf(levelOrIntensity) or rangeSet.oclIsKindOf(LikelihoodOfOccurrence)

constraint.name: gridFunctionRequiresGridDomain
constraint.expression: /*The grid function shall only be valid for domains that are grids */ inv: coverageFunction.gridFunction.notEmpty() implies domainSet.oclIsKindOf(CV_Grid)

FeatureType.name: LevelOrIntensity
FeatureType.definition: Quantitative or qualitative assessment of either risk, hazard or vulnerability.
Common concept for assessing the level of risk, or the level of hazard, or the level of vulnerability.

constraint.name: either the quantitative value or the qualitative value must be completed.
constraint.expression: /*either the qualitative value or the quantitative value must be completed. */ inv: self.qualitativeValue.isEmpty() implies self.quantitativeValue.notEmpty() and self.quantitativeValue.isEmpty() implies self.qualitativeValue.notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: qualitativeValue
FeatureAttribute.definition: A qualitative assessment of the level or intensity.

FeatureAttribute.name: quantitativeValue
FeatureAttribute.definition: A quantitative assessment of the level or intensity.

FeatureAttribute.name: assessmentMethod
FeatureAttribute.definition: A citation to the method used to express the level or intensity.

FeatureType.name: LikelihoodOfOccurrence
FeatureType.definition: Likelihood is a general concept relating to the chance of an event occurring.
Likelihood is generally expressed as a probability or a frequency. [EXCIFF].

constraint.name: Either the qualitative likelihood or the quantitative likelihood must be completed.
constraint.expression: /*either the qualitative likelihood or the quantitative likelihood must be completed. */ inv: self.qualitativeLikelihood.isEmpty() implies self.quantitativeLikelihood.notEmpty() and self.quantitativeLikelihood.isEmpty() implies self.qualitativeLikelihood.notEmpty()

FeatureAttribute.name: qualitativeLikelihood
FeatureAttribute.definition: A qualitative assessment of the likelihood of occurrence of a hazard.
Sometimes, this is known as susceptibility.

FeatureAttribute.name: quantitativeLikelihood
FeatureAttribute.definition: A frequency of occurence or return period of a hazard phenomenon.
Sometimes, this is known as susceptibility.

FeatureAttribute.name: assessmentMethod
FeatureAttribute.definition: A citation to the method used to express the likelihood.

FeatureType.name: NaturalHazardCategoryValue
FeatureType.definition: A generic classification of types of natural hazards.

FeatureType.name: NaturalHazardClassification
FeatureType.definition: This class provides piece of information about the nature of the natural hazard as well as the type of hazard which is the source of risk.

FeatureAttribute.name: hazardCategory
FeatureAttribute.definition: A generic classification of types of natural hazards or risks.

FeatureAttribute.name: specificHazardType
FeatureAttribute.definition: Additional classification of the natural hazard that further specifies the hazard type according to a nomenclature that is specific to this dataset.
