Value.definition: The concepts overlap, but each one has a part that is not included in the other.

Value.label: counted
Value.definition: The units defined by the countUnitValues have been counted.

Value.label: estimated
Value.definition: The units defined by the countUnitValues have been estimated.

Value.label: calculated
Value.definition: The units defined by the countUnitValues have been calculated by some modelling technique.

Value.label: eunomen
Value.definition: Names and taxonomic concepts as defined by the Pan European Species Inventory, published by eunomen.eu/portal.

Value.label: eunis
Value.definition: Names and taxonomic concepts as defined by the EUNIS Species list.

Value.label: natureDirectives
Value.definition: Names and taxonomic concepts as defined by the nature directives species list.

Value.label: collection
Value.definition: tbd - definition: mainly used for collection of sewage water

Value.label: distribution
Value.definition: tbd-definition: mainly used for delivery of water/elelectricity/etc from a distribution point to consumers

Value.label: private
Value.definition: tbd-def: Private utility network cable/pipe owned by a user (not part of a public distribution utility network) e.g. electricity cables linking facilities

Value.label: transport
Value.definition: tbd - def: mainly used for transportation of water/electr/etc over long distances to distribution points

Value.label: combined
Value.definition: A combined wastewater sewer is a type of sewer system that collects sanitary sewage and stormwater runoff in a single pipe system.

Value.label: reclaimed
Value.definition: Reclaimed water, sometimes called recycled water, is former wastewater (sewage) that has been treated to remove solids and certain impurities, and then used in sustainable landscaping irrigation or to recharge groundwater aquifers.

Value.label: sanitary
Value.definition: Sanitary sewers remove waste products from peoples' home and send them underground to a treatment plant.

Value.label: storm
Value.definition: Storm wastewater drains gather rain and storm runoff and direct them to wetlands and lakes. Ditches and curb line grates are storm drains.

Value.label: coaxial
Value.definition: A coaxial cable, or coax, is an electrical cable with an inner conductor surrounded by a flexible, tubular insulating layer, surrounded by a tubular conducting shield.

Value.label: opticalFiber
Value.definition: A fiber optic cable is composed of thin filaments of glass through which light beams are transmitted to carry large amounts of data. The optical fibers are surrounded by buffers, strength members, and jackets for protection, stiffness, and strength. A fiber-optic cable may be an all-fiber cable, or contain both optical fibers and metallic conductors.

Value.label: twistedPair
Value.definition: A copper cable is a group of metallic conductors (copper wires) bundled together that are capable of carrying voice and data transmissions. The copper wires are bound together, usually with a protective sheath, a strength member, and insulation between individual conductors and the entire group.

Value.label: potable
Value.definition: Potable water or drinking water is water of sufficiently high quality that can be consumed or used without risk of immediate or long term harm.

Value.label: raw
Value.definition: Raw water is water taken from the environment, and is subsequently treated or purified to produce potable water in a water purification works. Raw water should not be considered safe for drinking or washing without further treatment.

Value.label: salt
Value.definition: Salt water or saline water is a general term for water that contains a significant concentration of dissolved salts (NaCl).

Value.label: treated
Value.definition: Treated water is the water that went throgh treatment proces.Treatment processes are the ones commonly used in water purification plants.

Value.label: lessThanOrEqualTo
Value.definition: Less than or exactly equal to

Value.label: greaterThanOrEqualTo
Value.definition: Greater than or exactly equal to

Value.label: international
Value.definition: An international legal act or convention.

Value.label: european
Value.definition: A legal act of the European Union.

Value.label: national
Value.definition: A legal act at national level.

Value.label: sub-national
Value.definition: A legal act at sub-national level.
NOTE The sub-national level encompasses both regional or local legislative instruments.
